NAME: Karuizawa - 31 Year Old Sapphire Geisha #3558
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is 5th in the series from Karuizawa Geishas. It was exclusive to The Whisky Exchange who released it in February 2020, it bottled by Elixir Distillers. The series is made from 2 single cask bottlings, one which is rare and one that is well known and wanted. The whisky was matured in sherry casks for 31 years then bottled at 58.9% ABV. The distillery has been shut for 2 decades but the Sapphire Geishas still show the characteristics that Karuizawas so well known for, rich and lavish.

NAME: Bowmore - 29 Year Old 1964 Black Bowmore 1st Edition
DESCRIPTION:
A legend in the Islay, Scotland and the Whisky world. This is the very first edition of the Bowmore Black Series. It was distilled in 1964 and matured for 29 years in a Oloroso sherry casks before being bottled in 1993 when it took the world by storm! There were only ever 2000 bottles released, all of which were matured below sea level and are now individually numbered. 
When the bottle was first released it cost around £70 to buy from the distillery and now its one of the most recognisable and famous bottles of Scotch Whisky in the world. 
There was a recall on these bottles from the distillery due to leaking wax capsules however this plastic version is very common and now hold a better seal for this very unique bottling.

NAME: Caol Ila - 2008 Hogshead #641 - 221.92 Bulk L 59.3% | Held In Bond
DESCRIPTION:
Caol Ila - 2008 Hogshead #641 - 221.92 Bulk L 59.3% | Held In Bond
A great chance to be the new owner of a 11 (Almost 12) Year Old Caol Ila Single Malt Cask, held in bond at Whisky Broker.
Filled on the 10.10.2008, cask #641 has been maturing very nicely and was re-gauged on the 10th June 2020. 
 There a few key facts and figures that have been listed below for your attention -
Unofficial Tasting Notes
Nose: @ Cask Strength 59.3% - Big and robust briny peat with an oily cereal of citrus.
Nose: @ 20% - Lemon citrus freshness cutting across the oiliness.
Palate: Sweet hay turning floral.
 If bottled at cask strength and at 70cl, this cask would approximately yield 315 bottles of 11 Year Old Caol Ila. 
Whiskybroker is currently holding this cask and the storage fee is £0.28 per week with insurance at £0.0035 a year per £1 of the value of the cask.
The buyer is responsible for the £20 administration fee is payable to Whiskybroker. 
Please Note -

NAME: Craigellachie - 2007 Hogshead #314608 -  202 Bulk L 59.3% | Held In Bond
DESCRIPTION:
Craigellachie - 2007 Hogshead #314608 -  202 Bulk L 59.3% | Held In Bond
A great chance to be the new owner of a 12 Year Old Craigellachie Single Malt Cask, held in bond at Whisky Broker.
Filled on the 5.12.2007, cask #314608 has been maturing very nicely and was re-gauged on the 10th June 2020. 
 There a few key facts and figures that have been listed below for your attention -
 Unofficial Tasting Notes
Nose: @ Cask Strength 59.3% - Oily and hints of cereal.
Nose: @ 20% - Starts of peat smoke with an oily finish.
Finish: The nose really comes through with hints of peat lingering in the background.
 If bottled at cask strength and at 70cl, this cask would approximately yield 288 bottles of 12 Year Old Craigellachie. 
 Whiskybroker is currently holding this cask and the storage fee is £0.28 per week with insurance at £0.0035 a year per £1 of the value of the cask.
The buyer is responsible for the £20 administration fee is payable to Whiskybroker. 
 Please Note -

NAME: Karuizawa - 35 Year Old (1981) Cask #6412 - Fazzino
DESCRIPTION:
An American 3D artist Fazzino designed this bottle and on the back of the bottle created the Japanese snow scene.
At 35 years old, this very rare bottle of Karuizawa which was distilled in 1981 and bottled in 2017 from Cask #6412 is extremely saught after. 
505 bottles have been produced.

NAME: Port Ellen - 40 Year Old 1979 - 9 Rogue Casks
DESCRIPTION:
This is one of the oldest and most limited Port Ellen ever released for the public.  This special single malt from Port Ellen that tells the story of nine casks uncovered from the four centuries old stocks of casks. These casks produced only 1380 bottles. With the distillery set to re-open in 2021, this limited edition sought after by whisky lovers worldwide.
This is bottle number 843.

NAME: Yamazaki - 25 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
Yamazaki 25 Year Old is an award-winning Japanese single malt from Suntory Distillery. The distillery was founded in 1923 and is the oldest whisky distillery in Japan. 
What makes the distillery so unique are its stills - they vary in shape, arm position and fire type.  This allows the distillers great flexibility when making their tremendous malt.

NAME: Speyside - 1994 Hogshead #1477 -  78 Bulk L 50.8% | Held In Bond
DESCRIPTION:
Speyside - 1994 Hogshead #1477 -  78 Bulk L 50.8% | Held In Bond
A great chance to be the new owner of a  26 Year Old Speyside Single Malt Cask, held in bond with Inver House Distillers.
Filled on the 11/02/1994, cask #1477 has been maturing very nicely and was re-gauged on the 10th July 2020. 
 There a few key facts and figures that have been listed below for your attention -
 Unofficial Tasting Notes
 Nose: @ Cask Strength - Lemond zest, fresh barley, barley sugars, charred wood and Nutmeg
Nose: @ 20% - Opens up with Floral notes and sweet vanilla. 
Taste: Fresh Lemond zest with toasted wood and light digestive biscuit. 
 If bottled at cask strength and at 70cl, this cask would approximately yield 111 bottles of 26 Year Old Speyside Single Malt. 
Inver House Distillers is currently holding this cask and should you require any information regarding storage costs we can be reached - casks@thegrandwhiskyauction.com
The buyer is responsible for any administration fees payable to Inver House Distillers.
Please Note -

NAME: Macallan - Archival Series - Folio 1
DESCRIPTION:
The Macallan Folio 1 is a limited edition that was released exclusively at the Macallan Distillery in 2015.  This is one of 2000 bottles.
Folio 1 is the first release in a 24 part series that celebrates and revisits The Macallan's original print, press and film advertising campaign; mapping the story of The Macallan from a remote farmstead on the River Spey to a whisky that is enjoyed around the world.
As with all the Folio releases, the bottle is presented in an elegant book-shaped tin box.

NAME: Hibiki - 30 Year Old Kacho Fugetsu
DESCRIPTION:
An absolutely stunning and limited edition release from Hibiki. Hibiki is the flagship blend from Suntory & this bottle has become increasingly rare. This particular bottling was exclusive to the travel retail market in 2015. 
This is the oldest age statement in the Hibiki range. 
The desgin of this bottle has been such that it reflects the Japanese appreciation of the beauty of nature. It has 24 sides, one for each hour in the day and 24 seasons or "Sekki"

NAME: Macallan - 1954  - Campbell, Hope and King
DESCRIPTION:
The most collectable single malt in the world, Macallan currently holds the record for the most expensive single malt ever sold at auction. 
The distillery is owned by the Edrington Group who purchased it in 1999 from Highland Distillers. 
This bottling was distilled in 1957 and bottled Campbell, Hope and King Ltd who were based in Edinburgh in the 19th century & into 20th century. The company also had premises in New Elgin from which the relationship with Macallan would have blossomed. Prior to the 1980s the bottling of Macallans product was subcontracted out to independent bottlers.

NAME: Macallan - 30 Year Old - 2019
DESCRIPTION: This 2019 release from The Macallan is aged exclusively in Oloroso sherry seasoned casks from Jerez for all thirty years of its maturation. Resultingly, it is said to have a beautiful Oloroso sherry presence after this extended ageing. It is a naturally dark, Speyside single malt full of rich dried fruits, spice and wood smoke.

NAME: Macallan - 30 Year Old - 2019
DESCRIPTION: This 2019 release from The Macallan is aged exclusively in Oloroso sherry seasoned casks from Jerez for all thirty years of its maturation. Resultingly, it is said to have a beautiful Oloroso sherry presence after this extended ageing. It is a naturally dark, Speyside single malt full of rich dried fruits, spice and wood smoke.

NAME: Port Ellen Maltings - 21 Year Old 1973 - 25th Anniversary
DESCRIPTION:
A rare and a stunning Port Ellen, bottled 1998 to commemorate the 25th Anniversary of Port Ellen Maltings.  Rear label printed with the names of the distillery staff, 1998.
This bottling impressively scored 94 points from Serge Valentin's whiskyfun.com.
This is bottle number 292.

NAME: Macallan - 1997 Exceptional Cask #14813/12 / 2018 Release
DESCRIPTION:
This series is widely recognised as one of the most collectable not just among Macallan fanatics but whisky enthusiasts all around the world. The 2018 series was made available for Asia and the USA. The series originated from some single cask bottlings in the 90's that are described at some of the greatest Macallans of them all.
The date of distillation for this exceptionally hard to find bottling from Macallan is back on the 20th of October 1997. The vessel that created this beautiful dram was a refill American Sherry hogshead (Ref: 2018/ASH-14813/12). Only 187 bottles were produced from this cask!
It was bottled in 2018 on the 15th of October and selected by one of the distillers, Sarah Burgess. This is the 12th release in the series and we just love it. Thank you Sarah!

NAME: Ardbeg - 1976 Single Cask #2390 - Feis Ile 2002
DESCRIPTION:
A sherry butt of Ardbeg from the legendary 1976 batch, this rare Ardbeg was bottled for the Feis Ile in 2002.
This is bottle number 42.

NAME: Bimber - 8 Bottle Collection - Includes 1st Release
DESCRIPTION:
1st Release
One of only 1000 bottles the Bimber Inaugural release was handcrafted and aged in Ex Pedro Ximenez Sherry Casks.
5 casks were used to make the Polish creators first malt - number 6,19,31,37 and 38.
After immigrating from Poland, the founder Dariusz Plazewski pursued his passion for distilling. We must say, we are very glad he did!
Huge congrats to all that were involved in this special release. Only 800 bottles were released to the UK market and the other 200 were available internationally.
Tudor House - Special Release 
A single cask release that was matured in a Pedro Ximenez cask #25 has been selected in 2020  for the 25th anniversary of Tudor House. This is one of 76 bottles.
Oloroso Sherry Butt #544-7/67 - Selfridges Exclusive & Wine
An exclusive partnership between the London distillery and department store Selfridges. This Bimber was made from single farm barley (which was malted at Westminster Maltings) and matured in four 1st fill American Oak Ex-bourbon casks. It was then finished in a 2010 single Oloroso sherry butt from hugely renowned Spanish sherry producer González Byass. Bottled in June 2020 at 51.5% ABV.
Only 937 bottles were produced from Cask #544-7/67. Each tube which cases the bottles has artwork from the Dutch artist and sculptor Eelke van Willegen.
Gonzalez Byass Oloroso 2010 sherry: 750ml, 18%. The renowned Gonzalez Byass one of the most celebrated Bodegas across Spain. This Oloroso 2010 is stunning and very popular.  It is said to be short and dry, with notes of almond, plum and figs. Pair with game, cheese and nuts to bring out its natural, fruity undertones.
Ex-bourbon - Small Batch #1
One of only 1948 bottles in the Bimber Ex-bourbon Batch 1 Small Batch release. It was firstly matured in 1st fill bourbon barrels. 
The batch number for this bottling is 01/2020 which was bottled in May 2020. 
Re-Charred Oak Cask - Small Batch #1
This Bimber Re-charred oak bottling is from Batch 1 of Bimber small-batch releases. Matured in re-charred, American Oak Casks, this is one of just 5000 bottles produced at 51.9%.
Sherry Cask #42
This single cask release was fully matured in an Ex-Pedro Ximenez sherry cask #42. Sourced from Spain, this cask was previously utilised in a Jerez Solera for several decades, imparting a delectable selection of bright and rich fruit-forward notes. This is one of only 329 bottles produced. 
Virgin Cask #7
Released in June 2020, this single cask Bimber, matured in American virgin oak cask #7 was bottled at the natural cask strength of 57.8%. This is one of just 249 bottles produced. 
Ex-Bourbon Cask #8
Released in June 2020, this single cask Bimber, matured in ex-bourbon cask #8 was bottled at the natural cask strength of 58.3%. This is one of just 267 bottles produced.

NAME: Macallan - 1997 Exceptional Cask #14369-11 2018 Release
DESCRIPTION:
This series is widely recognised as one of the most collectable not just among Macallan fanatics but whisky enthusiasts all around the world. The 2018 series was made available for Asia and the USA. The series originated from some single cask bottlings in the 90's that are described at some of the greatest Macallans of them all. 
This bottling has the reference is 2018/ESH-14369/11 and is one of only 228 bottles.
It was distilled on the 13th of October 1997 and bottles 21+ years later. It was matured in a single Sherry hogshead made from European Oak. Steven Bremner selected this cask and was the 11th cask to be reserved for the 2018 series on 6th July 2018.

NAME: Ardbeg - 1976 Single Sherry Cask #2398
DESCRIPTION:
From one of the most famous distilleries in the world, this Ardbeg single cask was distilled back in 1976.
It lay to rest in cask #2398 for 27 years and was eventually bottled in May 2004.
Only 504 bottles were taken from this Sherry Butt.
Signed on the label by the legendary Jackie Thompson, bottle number 193.

NAME: Lagavulin - 37 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
This is bottling is the oldest and most precious single malt that Lagavulin have bottled. It was distilled in 1976 in refill American Oak and European Oak cask for 37 years before being bottled. There was 1,868 bottles produced.
This is bottle number 183.

NAME: Balvenie - 32 Year Old 1967 Cask #9913
DESCRIPTION:
One of the finest single malts that Balvenie make is their vintage cask range. This particular bottling is a limited edition from cask number #9913. It was distilled on the 20th of June 1967 and hand bottled at the distillery on the 17th of November 1999. 
Only 195 bottles were produced of this fine expression and this is bottle number 25.

NAME: Waterford - SFO - Bannow, Ballykilcavan,  Ratheadon, Ballymorgan, Sheestown 1.1  & Pilgrimage
DESCRIPTION: This lot includes 6 x 70cl bottlings:

NAME: Macallan - 18 Year Old - 1970
DESCRIPTION:
This Macallan is very collectable and highly acclaimed.
It was distilled in 1970 but previously had been stored in sherry wood casks and bottled in 1978.
This 18 year old rare and collectable is hugely sought after.

NAME: Macallan - 18 Year Old - 1983
DESCRIPTION:
The start of this series began in 1982 and quite possibly the most recognisable malt in the world, The Macallan 18 Year Old. The 18 year old in the tube packaging is one of 6 releases of this kind, depicting Sara Middletons view of the estate on the front.
This 1983 vintage single malt was, matured exclusively in sherry casks for 18 years and was bottled in 2000. These released have acquired many fans over the years, and are becoming increasingly hard to find.

NAME: Macallan - 2002 Exceptional Cask #2340-04 2018
DESCRIPTION:
This series was relaunched in 2017 and takes its name from single casks that Macallan released during the 1990s.
This particular release was distilled on the 4th March 2002 and bottled 16+ years later. It was matured in a European oak sherry hogshead #2340 (Ref: 2018/ESH-2340/04).
Sarah Burges selected this dram, one of the Macallan Whisky Makers.
It was the fourth cask to be reserved for the 2018 releases.
One of only 283 bottles.

NAME: Highland Park - 40 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: A stunning Highland Park, bottled at a hugely respectable 40 years old. It comes in a show-stopping black, heavy presentation box. Matured in Oak, with a high percentage of sherry casks this is a complex dram with a dash of smoke.  This expression of Highland Park, and is all-round pretty special.

NAME: Macallan - Folio 2
DESCRIPTION: Released as a distillery exclusive in 2017, this retro-style bottle from The Macallan is part of the Archival Series, recreating some of the distillery's vintage advertising campaigns. This second release in the series is matured in sherry casks for 12 years and bottled at 43% abv. Presented in a book-shaped tin case with an accompanying folio showcasing the watercolour artwork of Sara Midda. Only 2,000 bottles were produced and made available at the distillery.

NAME: Talisker - Pure Malt 80 Proof 13 1/3FL OZ Spring Cap
DESCRIPTION:
Found on the beautiful Island of Skye, the Talisker distillery was founded by Hugh and Kenneth MacAskill in 1830. The two were as you probably guessed...brothers. A freak fire resulted in the distillery being badly damaged, so much so that had to be rebuilt in the 1960s. Eventually, as the drinks giant Diageo knocked on the door, they were added to their portfolio. 
This is an early bottling shown with the spring cap and in 13 1/3 FL OZ. Bottled at 80 Proof, this pure malt is a real collector's item.

NAME: Macallan - Folio 2
DESCRIPTION: Released as a distillery exclusive in 2017, this retro-style bottle from The Macallan is part of the Archival Series, recreating some of the distillery's vintage advertising campaigns. This second release in the series is matured in sherry casks for 12 years and bottled at 43% abv. Presented in a book-shaped tin case with an accompanying folio showcasing the watercolour artwork of Sara Midda. Only 2,000 bottles were produced and made available at the distillery.

NAME: Highland Park - 42 Year Old John Scott 1967 - 2009 #6282
DESCRIPTION:
This rare 42 year old Orkney single malt from Highland Park was bottled for John Scott & Miller.
Only 12 single casks were laid down in the 1960's by Robert Firth Miller, who was the former proprietor of John Scott and Miller.
This spectacularly dark expression comes from a from single Sherry cask #6282. Its natural cask strength is 50.3% ABV. This combined with being one of only 190 bottles makes it extra special. Bottled in 2009.
This is bottle #173.

NAME: Macallan - 2007 Exceptional Cask #3112-05 - 2019 Release
DESCRIPTION:
This series is widely recognised as one of the most collectable not just among Macallan fanatics but whisky enthusiasts all around the world.
Distilled on 28th February 2007, aged in single a single American Oak Bourbon Barrel, Cask #3112-05 and bottled on the 2nd of September 2019 at 64.6%.
This is single cask ref: 2019/ABL-3112/05

NAME: Macallan - 30 Year Old SMWS 24.140 Sublime Nectar
DESCRIPTION:
Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
This Speyside single malt is from Macallan and has been aged for 30 years in a refill sherry butt. One of only 565 and given the title of Sublime Nectar.

NAME: Macallan - 30 Year Old SMWS 24.140 Sublime Nectar
DESCRIPTION:
Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
This Speyside single malt is from Macallan and has been aged for 30 years in a refill sherry butt. One of only 565 and given the title of Sublime Nectar.

NAME: Macallan - Genesis (2018)
DESCRIPTION:
The Macallan Genesis Limited Edition marks the creation of the iconic Distillery in a unique collaboration with internationally acclaimed architects Rogers Stirk Harbour + Partners.  Released in August 2018, the special edition bottling commemorates the unveiling of the brand new Macallan Distillery which opened in June 2018.
The bottle is presented in a beautiful gift box featuring a signed lithographic print of the Macallan Distillery and is said to be of such quality that it will never degrade, and will last as long as any unopened bottle!
One of 2500 bottles available exclusively from the Macallan Distillery and duty-free retail.

NAME: Bowmore - 1997 - 22 Year Old - Devil's Cask #666 - Hand Filled - Feis Ile 2019
DESCRIPTION:
This is a very limited release and a very much surprise release by Bowmore for many during the 2019 Fèis Ìle.  It is a hand filled bottling from Devil's Cask #666, it was matured for 22 matured in a single sherry cask. 
 
This is bottle number 164.

NAME: Macallan - Genesis (2018)
DESCRIPTION:
The Macallan Genesis Limited Edition marks the creation of the iconic Distillery in a unique collaboration with internationally acclaimed architects Rogers Stirk Harbour + Partners.  Released in August 2018, the special edition bottling commemorates the unveiling of the brand new Macallan Distillery which opened in June 2018.
The bottle is presented in a beautiful gift box featuring a signed lithographic print of the Macallan Distillery and is said to be of such quality that it will never degrade, and will last as long as any unopened bottle!
One of 2500 bottles available exclusively from the Macallan Distillery and duty-free retail.

DESCRIPTION:

DESCRIPTION:
The Macallan Genesis Limited Edition marks the creation of the iconic Distillery in a unique collaboration with internationally acclaimed architects Rogers Stirk Harbour + Partners.  Released in August 2018, the special edition bottling commemorates the unveiling of the brand new Macallan Distillery which opened in June 2018.

One of 2500 bottles available exclusively from the Macallan Distillery and duty-free retail.

NAME: Royal Lochnagar - 30 Year Old 1988 Single Cask - The Prince's Foundation
DESCRIPTION:
Bottled on The Prince’s 70th birthday, 14 November 2018, this is one of the oldest single cask releases of Royal Lochnagar Single Malt Scotch Whisky. This is one of 206 individually numbered bottles released in 2018 from American Oak cask #1129.
In 1988 Royal Lochnagar distillery gifted a cask of whisky to HRH Prince Charles, Duke of Rothesay. 30 years later, HRH donated the whisky from this cask to be sold in aid of The Prince's Foundation. 
This is bottle number 196.

NAME: Laphroaig - 30 Year Old Cairdeas
DESCRIPTION:
Available only on the beautiful Island of Islay at Laphroaig distillery/website.
30 year old Cairdeas release is a combination of around 60% sherry casks and 40% bourbon casks.
Before being bottled they were merged in bourbon casks before bottling.
This special bottling is one of 1,536 bottles.

NAME: Ladyburn - 40 Year Old 1974 - Private Cask Collection
DESCRIPTION:
A very rare bottling of Ladyburn single malt, selected from the private cask collection of the Grant family on 30th March 2014. This single cask whisky was distilled in November 1974, matured in a first-fill bourbon cask 89/199-49 and bottled in November 2014, long after the distillery fell silent.  
Ladyburn Distillery was built in 1966 by William Grant & Sons Ltd and distillery closed in 1975 making well-aged bottlings very rare due to the short time the distillery was operational.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 35 Year Old - 1965 Single Cask
DESCRIPTION:
Islay's Bunnahabhain distillery held this single cask in their storage for 35 years until it was eventually bottled in 2001.
Matured in single cask number 7159, the cask liquid was distilled on 1st November 1965 and is one of only 594 bottles.
What are you waiting for? This bottle is for you!

NAME: Macallan - Edition 1,2,3,4,5
DESCRIPTION:
This lot brings together the Macallan Edition set to date, comprising of Edition no.  1, 2, 3 4 and 5 in the annual limited edition series.  
The Macallan 'Edition' series is a showcase of select casks producing a taste with their own individual characteristics.

NAME: Macallan - Edition 1,2,3,4,5
DESCRIPTION:
This lot brings together the Macallan Edition set to date, comprising of Edition no.  1, 2, 3 4 and 5 in the annual limited edition series.  
The Macallan 'Edition' series is a showcase of select casks producing a taste with their own individual characteristics.

NAME: Macallan - Folio 3
DESCRIPTION:
The Macallan Folio 3 is a limited edition that was released exclusively at the Macallan Distillery in 2018.  It is the third release in the Folio series.
The theme of the Folio 3 is Macallan's advertising campaigns from the 1980s and 1990s.  The presentation includes a book containing the best of these.  The illustration on the box is from an advert used in a Victorian-era edition of Punch Magazine.  It is intended to capture the sentiment that whisky is best produced in cold weather - a remark that Macallan claim was made on their very own estate at Easter Elchies.
As with the previous Folio releases, the bottle is presented in an elegant book-shaped tin box.

NAME: Macallan - Folio 3
DESCRIPTION:
The Macallan Folio 3 is a limited edition that was released exclusively at the Macallan Distillery in 2018.  It is the third release in the Folio series.
The theme of the Folio 3 is Macallan's advertising campaigns from the 1980s and 1990s.  The presentation includes a book containing the best of these.  The illustration on the box is from an advert used in a Victorian-era edition of Punch Magazine.  It is intended to capture the sentiment that whisky is best produced in cold weather - a remark that Macallan claim was made on their very own estate at Easter Elchies.
As with the previous Folio releases, the bottle is presented in an elegant book-shaped tin box.

NAME: Clynelish - 12 Year Old Ainslie and Heilbron 1970s
DESCRIPTION:
Clynelish 12 year old bottled by Ainslie & Heilbron distillers.
The classic label, used for Edoardo Giaccone in 1973 is widely recognised all around the world.
With Brora reopening in the near future all bottles associated with Clynelish have been rising in value as of late.

NAME: Macallan - 25 Year Old - Sherry Oak - 2018
DESCRIPTION:
The Macallan 25 Year Old Sherry Oak 2018 release is part of Macallan's super popular Sherry Oak range.  This 25 year old has been matured exclusively in hand-picked, sherry seasoned oak casks from Jerez, Spain. 
An interesting fact about The Macallan’s curiously small spirit stills is that they are the smallest in Speyside. They have this unique size and shape to give the spirit maximum surface area contact with the copper.  This, in turn, helps to concentrate on the ‘new make’ spirit.  It will provide the viscosity and rich, fruity, full-bodied flavours so characteristic of The Macallan.

NAME: Mortlach - 25 Year Old 1957 Cadenheads
DESCRIPTION: Mortlach 25 Year Old was distilled in May 1957 by George Cowie & Son Ltd and bottled 25 years later by Wm Cadenhead in September 1982.

NAME: Lagavulin - 12 Year Old - White Horse 1980s
DESCRIPTION:
Lagavulin 12 Year Old bottled by White Horse Distillers in the 1980s.
This bottle carries the Royal Warrant to Her Majesty the Queen.
'Specially Selected Lagavulin Pure Islay Malt Scotch Whisky White Horse Distillers Ltd'. 
Becoming rarer by the year, this bottle is very iconic and would look great in any collection.

NAME: Macallan - 25 Year Old - Sherry Oak - 2019
DESCRIPTION: This is the 2019 edition of Macallan's 25 Year Old Sherry Oak. It comes with a stunning wooden presentation box.  It's matured exclusively in hand-picked sherry oak casks from Jerez for a quarter of a century.

NAME: Macallan - 25 Year Old - Sherry Oak - 2019
DESCRIPTION: This is the 2019 edition of Macallan's 25 Year Old Sherry Oak. It comes with a stunning wooden presentation box.  It's matured exclusively in hand-picked sherry oak casks from Jerez for a quarter of a century.

NAME: Pappy Van Winkle - 20 Year Old - Family Reserve
DESCRIPTION: This is 20 Year Old Pappy Van Winkle was distilled and bottled by the Old Rip Van Winkle Distillery in Frankfort.  It is a limited edition Kentucky straight bourbon, bottled at 45.2% and comes with a red velvety presentation bag.

NAME: Ardbeg - Guaranteed 30 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
With one of the strongest followings in all of Scotch Whisky, this Ardbeg is highly sought after. It is one of their oldest age statements and were present / bottled in the late 1970s until the early 1990s. 29 casks were used to produce this 30 year old release and many people will not know it was actually bottled at Laphoraig.
This is the last Ardbeg bottling produced by Aliied before the distillery's sale.

NAME: Waterford - SFO - Bannow, Ballykilcavan,  Ratheadon, Ballymorgan & Sheestown 1.1
DESCRIPTION: This lot includes 5 x 70cl bottlings:

NAME: Glenfarclas - 15 Year Old - Averys of Bristol
DESCRIPTION: The Averys purchased this whisky in 1967 from the Ben Rinnes Distillery before bottling it themselves in Autumn 1983.

NAME: Glenfarclas - 1984 Family Cask Summer 2014 #6032
DESCRIPTION:
Owned by the Grant family, this Speyside distillery in Ballindalloch has 6 stills and has a production capacity of around 3.5 million litres of spirit per year. 
Around 68,000 casks are being kept maturing for the future.
This bottling is part of their family cask selection, bottled in 27/03/14 this is one of only 211 bottles produced from cask #6032.

NAME: Macallan - Folio 4
DESCRIPTION: The fourth edition in the Archival Series from The Macallan. Folio 4 remembers the legendary advertising campaigns of the 1970s, 1980s and 1990s that brought The Macallan to the public’s attention outside of Scotland.  It is presented in a beautiful book shaped, tin case. It features an advertisement including a Strathspey composed by James Scott Skinner (1843-1927). The advert notes that Skinner was so moved by his favourite malt he created a unique piece of music featuring his signature lilting notes with the simple catchphrase: “The Macallan. The Malt.”

NAME: Scapa - 25 Year Old 1980
DESCRIPTION:
Most recently reopened in 2004 after quite a colourful history, this old Scpapa would be one of their rarest bottlings and is certainly their oldest official release.
It was distilled in 1980 and bottled in 2005 where only 2000 bottles were produced from a refill bourbon hogshead.
Bottle 1007.

NAME: Macallan - 25 Year Old - Fine Oak
DESCRIPTION: Macallan 25 Year Old Fine Oak from Macallan is matured in a combination of bourbon and sherry casks.

NAME: Macallan - 25 Year Old - Fine Oak
DESCRIPTION: Macallan 25 Year Old Fine Oak from Macallan is matured in a combination of bourbon and sherry casks.

NAME: Ardbeg - Blaaack 20th Anniversary Committee Release 2020 (x6)
DESCRIPTION:
Founded in the year 2000, the Ardbeg committee marks the occasion every year with a special release. This release celebrates 20 years of releases with the Ardbeg Blaaack.
This limited edition is feisty and unique in the same breath. Its the first time in the distilleries history that they have used Pinot Noir casks from the country that lies the furthest distance from Islay - New Zealand. 
The legendary have knitted together this special release to give hints of "velvety summer fruit pudding and bitter cherry, with a deeper edge of soot and Ardbeg’s hallmark smoke."
The Grand Whisky Auction is very proud to have this bottling as their bonus bottle in the February auction of 2020.
Sláinte to all the Ardbeg committee members out there!

NAME: Ardbeg - 1980 Kildalton
DESCRIPTION:
This legendary Ardbeg was released in 2004 and is from the times where the Islay distillery was experimenting with lightly and non peated expressions. This took place between 1979 and 1981.
Only 1,300 bottles of Kildalton were every released to the public and as you can see by the price trend below, it is becoming ever more popular among collectors.

NAME: Brora - 21 Year Old - 1977 Rare Malts 56.90%
DESCRIPTION:
This wonderful series was created by United Distillers, using bottlings from mostly closed distilleries in 1995. The single malts were distilled between the late 60’s and early 80’s maturing for at least 18 years each and some even reaching 30 years. Due to the great success of this, an annual release was formed, aptly named “Special Releases” in 2001. Distilleries on that list include Benrinnes, Brora, Linkwood & Teaninich.
This Highland single malt from the closed distillery, Brora, is 21 years old and bottled at cask strength (56.90%)

NAME: Port Ellen - 20 Year Old - 1978 Rare Malt 60.90%
DESCRIPTION:
The Rare Malt Selection is one of the best third-party bottlers the whisky world has ever seen. Single malt whiskies range from operational to lost distilleries that were released between 1995 and 2005.
This 20 year old was distilled in 1978 and bottled in October 1998.
 
This is bottle number 02438

NAME: Longmorn - 25 Year Old 1957 Gordon and MacPhail Connoisseurs Choice
DESCRIPTION:
Arguably the most famous independent bottler of Scotch whisky there is. Gordon & MacPhail was founded in Elgin in 1895 by James Gordon and John Alexander MacPhail. It is now owned by the Urquhart Family who have bow bottled over 350 different expressions from around 69 different distilleries. Gordon & MacPhail is the Trading name of Speymalt Whiskies while also owning the Benromach distillery, which they purchased in 1993. Some of the brands include Connoisseurs Choice, Cask Strength, Rare Old and Speymalt.
Distilled in 1957 at the Longmorn distillery in Speyside, this single malt was aged for 25 years prior to being bottled by Gordon and Macphail as part of their original connoisseurs choice range.

NAME: Ardbeg - 2005 Single Cask #1321 - Fèis Ìle 2018
DESCRIPTION:
This is a very collectable bottling from Ardbeg, released in celebration of Fèis Ìle 2018. It was distilled in April 2005 and filled into an Oloroso sherry butt, where it aged until April 2018. This is one of just 543 individually numbered bottles released.
Bottle 128.

NAME: Arran - Scottish Folklore Series - 2nd Release - Cask 88
DESCRIPTION:
This is the 2nd release of the Scottish Folklore Series with a bottling of a 22 year old Arran Malt by the Cask 88 company. It was distilled on 24/01/1997 in a sherry hogshead cask #13.
 
This is bottle number 72 of 180.

NAME: Oban - 16 Year Old - Managers Dram 1994 - 200th Anniversary
DESCRIPTION:
This special edition 16-year-old sherry cask whisky was selected in 1994, the 200th anniversary of the Oban distillery.
It is part of the Manager’s Dram series bottled for the employees of Diageo, as it is now known.
The Manager’s Dram selection process was done by each distillery manager on rotation and was bottled at cask strength. John William chose this cask, it was bottled in 1995 from a refill cask.

NAME: Macallan - 15 Year Old - Gran Reserva (2017)
DESCRIPTION: In 2017 Macallan released a 15 Year Old Gran Reserva and it has been highly sought after since. The single malt features whisky matured predominantly in specially selected first-fill European oak sherry seasoned casks.

NAME: Laphroaig - 30 Year Old 1985
DESCRIPTION:
Originally released around the year 2000, this is the 2016 release, this beautifully packaged Laphroig 30-year-old comes in a striking wooden presentation box.  It is an Islay gem that is becoming rarer and rarer.
Only a few releases from the distillery have been of an age older than this since its release. 
Awards include double Gold Medal at the San Francisco World Spirits Competition 2005.

NAME: Macallan - 15 Year Old - Gran Reserva (2017)
DESCRIPTION: In 2017 Macallan released a 15 Year Old Gran Reserva and it has been highly sought after since. The single malt features whisky matured predominantly in specially selected first-fill European oak sherry seasoned casks.

NAME: Highland Park - 1980 21 Year Old  - Single Cask #8421
DESCRIPTION: A single cask of 1980 vintage Highland Park bottled in commemoration of a visit from Maxxium UK to the distillery. Distilled on 16th October 1980, matured in a traditional sherry hogshead #8421, selected on Thursday 31st of May ready for bottling on its 21st birthday. This is one of only 252 bottles.

NAME: Chichibu - 2012 Peated Single Cask #2089 TWE Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
Only 349 bottles on this Single malt have been produced from cask #2089. It was bottled to celebrate the Whisky Exchanges 20th anniversary. 
It was distilled in 2012 and bottled in 2019.
It comes from peated concerto Barley.

NAME: Brora - 20 Year Old - Rare Malts 58.1%
DESCRIPTION:
The Rare Malts Selection is now-discontinued - but it was a series of cask-strength releases designed by Diageo to showcase some of the hidden treasures in their portfolio.
This Brora from the highlands is 20 years old and was distilled in 1982. Bottled at 58.1% this bottle has the added twist that the distillery is about to reopen in the coming years.

NAME: St. Magdalene - 19 Year Old 1979 - Rare Malts Selection 63.8%
DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Saint Magdalene  Linlithgow Whisky for auction
DESCRIPTION: This 19 Year Old St. Magdalene was bottled at the natural cask strength of 63.80% as part of the Rare Malts Selection.  It was distilled in 1979, using the traditional direct-fired stills. The distillery sadly closed in the 1980s. This is a collectable bottling.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 30 Year Old 1989  Spiorad An Dochais Feis Ile 2020
DESCRIPTION:
This 30 year old release was distilled at Bunnahabhain distillery and was bottled for the cancelled Fèis Ìle festival in 2020.
This bottling has spent most of its life maturing in a sherry cask before being transferred for a finishing period in virgin oak casks.
Said to be spicy but sweet the name Spiorad An Dochais mean spirit “Spirit of Hope” in Gaelic.
Only 200 bottles being produced.
This lot comes with the sample.

NAME: Daftmill - 2006 Single Cask #048 - Taiwan
DESCRIPTION:
This first fill Bourbon barrel 048/2006 was filled on the 31st July 2006 and was selected by Ho-cheng Yao to be the first exclusive bottling for Taiwan.  Only 201 bottles were produced.  
Bottle 68.

NAME: St Magdalene - 17 Year Old 1964 Gordon and MacPhail Connoisseurs Choice
DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Saint Magdalene  Linlithgow Whisky for auction
DESCRIPTION:
Arguably the most famous independent bottler of Scotch whisky there is. Gordon & MacPhail was founded in Elgin in 1895 by James Gordon and John Alexander MacPhail. It is now owned by the Urquhart Family who have bow bottled over 350 different expressions from around 69 different distilleries. Gordon & MacPhail is the Trading name of Speymalt Whiskies while also owning the Benromach distillery, which they purchased in 1993. Some of the brands include Connoisseurs Choice, Cask Strength, Rare Old and Speymalt.
A lowland single malt from St Magdalene, aged for 17 years afer being distilled in 1964. This was bottled by Gordon and Macphail as part of their original connoisseurs choice range.

NAME: Macallan - Reflexion
DESCRIPTION:
Would you believe us if we told you that for most of the 20th century, the now world famous Macallan was used as the main ingredient of blended malts....
The 1980's was a real turning point for the brand when they moved their focus onto producing some of the finest malts we sample today. 
Their success saw them build a piece of architectural genius in their new distillery in 2018. Perched on the hillside it blends in beautifully to the surrounding landscape overlooking the famous Easter Elchies House. 
This particular release came to market in 2014 as part of their super-premium range. It is part of the 1824 series and was matured in Spanish and American first-fill sherry 'seasoned' casks.

NAME: Bimber - 1st Release London Single Malt
DESCRIPTION:
One of only 1000 bottles the Bimber Inaugural release was handcrafted and aged in Ex Pedro Ximenez Sherry Casks.
5 casks were used to make the Polish creators first malt - number 6,19,31,37 and 38.
After imigrating from Poland, the founder Dariusz Plazewski pursued his passion for distilling. We must say, we are very glad he did!
Huge congrats to all that were involved in this special release. Only 800 bottles were released to the UK market and the other 200 were avalable internationally.
Bottle 289.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - Fèis Ìle 2019 -1988 Champagne Finish
DESCRIPTION:
Bunnahabhain released three bottlings for 2019 Feis Ile on Islay. This is by far and away the most spectacular of the three, coming in at 30 years old. It comes with a 1cl tasting mini and in a beautiful leather case. One of the lighter whiskies on Islay, combined with this champagne cask is a recipe for success.
Distilled on 1st December 1988 and bottled on 17th May 2019.
One of only 120 bottles.
This is bottle number 16.

NAME: Laphroaig - 10 Year Old Pre Royal Warrant
DESCRIPTION: These are a special bottling of Laphroaig 10-year-old that were around before Laphroaig was granted the Royal Warrant.  Every bottle since has featured the Coat of Arms of HRH.  This is a 75cl bottling.

NAME: Dungourney - 1964 Special Reserve
DESCRIPTION:
This is a triple distilled bottling of Dungourney special reserve which was found by the Master Distiller at the time Barry Crockett, who came across some whisky in the Irish warehouse that the company did not have registered. This a rare bottling from the distillery at this time.
 
This is bottle number 4.

NAME: Caol Ila - 20 Year Old - 150th Anniversary
DESCRIPTION:
Released in 1996 celebrating and commemorating 150 years of Caol Ila, which opened in 1846.
This stunning bottle was only ever given to employees of Diageo.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 30 Year Old New Acquaintance
DESCRIPTION:
To celebrate the new decade, the 20th year of the third millennium, Bunnahabhain introduced 'New Acquaintance', a 1988, 30 year old Bunnahabhain.  
Limited to 400 bottles and this single malt was matured in French Oak and was bottled at 45% abv. It has notes of sweet light fudge, delicate notes of soft fruit, crème brûlée and toasted honey malt. It is presented in a leather bag.
 
Bottle 346.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 30 Year Old New Acquaintance
DESCRIPTION:
To celebrate the new decade, the 20th year of the third millennium, Bunnahabhain introduced 'New Acquaintance', a 1988, 30 year old Bunnahabhain.  
Limited to 400 bottles and this single malt was matured in French Oak and was bottled at 45% abv. It has notes of sweet light fudge, delicate notes of soft fruit, crème brûlée and toasted honey malt. It is presented in a leather bag.

NAME: Oban - 20 Year Old 1962 Gordon and MacPhail Connoisseurs Choice
DESCRIPTION:
Arguably the most famous independent bottler of Scotch whisky there is. Gordon & MacPhail was founded in Elgin in 1895 by James Gordon and John Alexander MacPhail. It is now owned by the Urquhart Family who have bow bottled over 350 different expressions from around 69 different distilleries. Gordon & MacPhail is the Trading name of Speymalt Whiskies while also owning the Benromach distillery, which they purchased in 1993. Some of the brands include Connoisseurs Choice, Cask Strength, Rare Old and Speymalt.
This Highland malt was distilled in 1962 and bottled 20 years later by Gordon and Macphail as part of their original connoisseurs choice range.

NAME: Glen Garioch - 27 Year Old - 1970
DESCRIPTION: This is a beautifully presented limited edition single Highland malt from Glen Garioch.  It was distilled in April 1970, matured in hogshead barrel #13 for 27 years and was bottled at 50.6% ABV.

NAME: Dalmore - 33 Year Old 1978 - Scotia Royale
DESCRIPTION: A well-aged Dalmore in a handsome black presentation case, bottled by Scotia Royale. Distilled in 1978, this limited edition was matured for 33 years and this is one of just 210 bottles.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 40 Year Old Masam / Silvano's Collection
DESCRIPTION:
Maryse Accorsi Samaroli is the wife of the world-famous Silvano Samaroli. She created the independent bottler Masam. Antonio Bleve has been running Samaroli since 2008 and this 40-year-old Islay single malt bottling came from their private collection. 
This is a full strength Bunnahabhain that is only one of 520 bottles that came from butt #7229 in 2019.
Hugely attractive both in shape and for collectors.

NAME: Octomore - Black Arts Concept 0.1 (OBA)
DESCRIPTION:
Adam Hannett's first creation as Bruichladdich's distillery manager.
Its journey begins in May 2016 at last years Feis Ile in May 2016.
10 casks of 6 different types were used in the making of this expression.
1 x 2002; 2 x 2008; 4 x 2006; 3 x 2007 Vintages.
Bottle 683.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 30 Year Old 1989  Spiorad An Dochais Feis Ile 2020
DESCRIPTION:
This 30 year old release was distilled at Bunnahabhain distillery and was bottled for the cancelled Fèis Ìle festival in 2020.
This bottling has spent most of its life maturing in a sherry cask before being transferred for a finishing period in virgin oak casks.
Said to be spicy but sweet the name Spiorad An Dochais mean spirit “Spirit of Hope” in Gaelic.
Only 200 bottles being produced.

NAME: Scapa - 8 Year Old Gordon and MacPhail 75cl 100 Proof
DESCRIPTION:
Arguably the most famous independent bottler of Scotch whisky there is. Gordon & MacPhail was founded in Elgin in 1895 by James Gordon and John Alexander MacPhail. It is now owned by the Urquhart Family who have bow bottled over 350 different expressions from around 69 different distilleries. Gordon & MacPhail is the Trading name of Speymalt Whiskies while also owning the Benromach distillery, which they purchased in 1993. Some of the brands include Connoisseurs Choice, Cask Strength, Rare Old and Speymalt.
This Orcadian single malt was distilled at Scapa and matured for 8 great years before being bottled by Gordon and Macphail.
This bottling is at 100% Proof.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 36 Year Old 1966 Legacy Series #1
DESCRIPTION:
Released for the Legacy series from 2002 until 2007 from Bruichladdich and this is the first release.
It was distilled in 1966 before being bottled in 2002 to celebrate the Queen's Golden Jubilee.

NAME: Midleton - Very Rare 1999 - Irish Whiskey
DESCRIPTION:
A blend of famous whiskies released every year since 1984. Each bottle is numbered individually and signed by the master distiller Barry Crockett. 2012 was the year he decided to retire and to honour him they release Barry Crockett legacy. This whisky has been aged for a maximum of 25 years and a minimum of 12 years in Bourbon casks only.
This bottling was aged to perfection and bottled in 1999.  
Lot comes complete with 2 certificates

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.1
DESCRIPTION:
Setting world records and winning awards for their structures, Macallan is at the forefront of the Scotch whisky industry.  
The Macallan Edition No. 1 is the debut expression in the Edition Series.  This is a limited edition drawn from eight European and American oak cask styles selected for their unique characteristics.

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.1
DESCRIPTION:
Setting world records and winning awards for their structures, Macallan is at the forefront of the Scotch whisky industry.  
The Macallan Edition No. 1 is the debut expression in the Edition Series.  This is a limited edition drawn from eight European and American oak cask styles selected for their unique characteristics.

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.1
DESCRIPTION:
Setting world records and winning awards for their structures, Macallan is at the forefront of the Scotch whisky industry.  
The Macallan Edition No. 1 is the debut expression in the Edition Series.  This is a limited edition drawn from eight European and American oak cask styles selected for their unique characteristics.

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.1
DESCRIPTION:
Setting world records and winning awards for their structures, Macallan is at the forefront of the Scotch whisky industry.  
The Macallan Edition No. 1 is the debut expression in the Edition Series.  This is a limited edition drawn from eight European and American oak cask styles selected for their unique characteristics.

NAME: Redbreast - 20 Year Old - Dream Cask 50cl
DESCRIPTION:
Redbreast 20 Year Old Dream Cask 50cl / Pedro Ximenez Edition.  This whisky is from a single Pedro Ximénez cask, number 374932.
Four different single pot-still whiskies make up this 20 year old expression from the Midleton Distillery. 
This sold out in just 14 minutes...be sure to place your bid to catch this beauty today!
One of 924 bottles. 
Bottle 619.

NAME: Glenmorangie - 2001 Single Cask 16 Year Old 175th Anniversary
DESCRIPTION:
Bottled to celebrate the 175th anniversary of the Highland distillery right outside of Tain. It was bottled in 2018 and distilled in 2001.
Maturation of this liquid was in a 1st fill bourbon cask and selected by Dr. Bill Lumsden to mark this milestone. 
191 bottles were released.
 
This is bottle number 15.

NAME: Waterford - SFO - Bannow, Ballykilcavan,  Ratheadon, Ballymorgan & Sheestown 1.1
DESCRIPTION: This lot includes 5 x 70cl bottlings:

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.1
DESCRIPTION:
Setting world records and winning awards for their structures, Macallan is at the forefront of the Scotch whisky industry.  
The Macallan Edition No. 1 is the debut expression in the Edition Series.  This is a limited edition drawn from eight European and American oak cask styles selected for their unique characteristics.

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.1
DESCRIPTION:
Setting world records and winning awards for their structures, Macallan is at the forefront of the Scotch whisky industry.  
The Macallan Edition No. 1 is the debut expression in the Edition Series.  This is a limited edition drawn from eight European and American oak cask styles selected for their unique characteristics.

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.1
DESCRIPTION:
Setting world records and winning awards for their structures, Macallan is at the forefront of the Scotch whisky industry.  
The Macallan Edition No. 1 is the debut expression in the Edition Series.  This is a limited edition drawn from eight European and American oak cask styles selected for their unique characteristics.

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.1
DESCRIPTION:
Setting world records and winning awards for their structures, Macallan is at the forefront of the Scotch whisky industry.  
The Macallan Edition No. 1 is the debut expression in the Edition Series.  This is a limited edition drawn from eight European and American oak cask styles selected for their unique characteristics.

NAME: Ardbeg - 2007 Single Cask #5824
DESCRIPTION:
This 2007 vintage single cask is very special and very hard to come by with only 245 bottles being produced from a single First Fill Bourbon Barrel.
This single butt #5824 was bottled on the 12th June 2019.
This is bottle number 109.

NAME: Laphroaig - 15 Year Old 1980s
DESCRIPTION:
Holding the title of the largest producer on Islay, Laphroaig put Ardbeg and Lagavulin in its shadows. Laphroaig has been producing single malt whiskies since the 1920's and especially heavily peated ones!
They are a very tradition distillery in many ways however they also employed Scotland’s first ever female distillery manager in 1954...Bessie Williamson.
This bottling is said to be Prince Charles' favourite.

NAME: Macallan - 25 Year Old - Pearls of Scotland
DESCRIPTION: This 25-year-old Macallan was distilled in September 1989 and bottled in September 2015 by Pearls of Scotland as part of their Golden Pearl Collection. this is one of a limited outturn of 71 decanter bottles.  COmes in a striking presentation box and complete with handsome glass stopper.

NAME: Ardbeg - 2007 Single Cask #5824
DESCRIPTION:
This 2007 vintage single cask is very special and very hard to come by with only 245 bottles being produced from a single First Fill Bourbon Barrel.
This single butt #5824 was bottled on the 12th June 2019.
This is bottle number 76.

NAME: Ardbeg - Supernova - Committee Release
DESCRIPTION:
2009 was the start of this great series to the Ardbeg Committee members.
This is the original Ardbeg Supernova, peated to 100 ppm.
Only 2,400 bottles were produced.

NAME: Glendronach - Grandeur - 27 Year Old #10
DESCRIPTION:
Exclusively matured in Sherry oak casks for 27 years this beautifully presented bottle is part of the Grandeur series by the Highland distillery.
Only 2293 bottles produced making this a great item for collectors.

NAME: Convalmore - 32 Year Old Cask Strength 1984
DESCRIPTION:
This very special bottling of Convalmore was distilled in 1984 and bottled in 2017 giving it the great age of 32 years old. Only 3972 bottles were produced at a cask strength of 48.2%.
Convalmore, founded in 1894, was eventually sold to W&P Lowrie & Co in 1904. They eventually went into partnership with James Buchanan in 1906.

NAME: Macallan - 21 Year Old - Fine Oak
DESCRIPTION:
Macallan Fine Oak 21 Year Old was matured in both bourbon and sherry cask. 
Whisky colour is measured using a device called a tint meter or a Tintometer. It will refer to the Lovibond colour scale which is of course brown.

NAME: Hibiki - 21 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
Hibiki 21 Year Old is a very popular blended whisky from Suntory.  It is made up of a blend of specially selected mature malt and grain whiskies aged over 21 years. The key Yamazaki sherry casked malt is vatted with other carefully chosen mellow unblended grain whiskies over 21 years old. 
Some awards Hibiki 21-Year-Old has received:

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 30 Year Old 1989  Spiorad An Dochais Feis Ile 2020
DESCRIPTION:
This 30 year old release was distilled at Bunnahabhain distillery and was bottled for the cancelled Fèis Ìle festival in 2020.
This bottling has spent most of its life maturing in a sherry cask before being transferred for a finishing period in virgin oak casks.
Said to be spicy but sweet the name Spiorad An Dochais mean spirit “Spirit of Hope” in Gaelic.
Only 200 bottles being produced.
Bottle 62.

NAME: Courvoisier Erte Collection Vigne - No.1
DESCRIPTION:
Part of the Vigne collection Erte was the first release. This is decanter E 4617. Shortly after the first edition was released the leading decor artist Erte sadly died. 
 
This is bottle 1 of 7 bottles produced.

NAME: Midleton - Very Rare 2003 - Irish Whiskey
DESCRIPTION:
A blend of famous whiskies released every year since 1984. Each bottle is numbered individually and signed by the master distiller Barry Crockett. 2012 was the year he decided to retire and to honour him they release Barry Crockett legacy. This whisky has been aged for a maximum of 25 years and a minimum of 12 years in Bourbon casks only.
Bottle 11454. This bottle comes with the relevant certs.

NAME: Ledaig - 10 Year Old 1972 Gordon and MacPhail Connoisseurs Choice
DESCRIPTION:
Arguably the most famous independent bottler of Scotch whisky there is. Gordon & MacPhail was founded in Elgin in 1895 by James Gordon and John Alexander MacPhail. It is now owned by the Urquhart Family who have bow bottled over 350 different expressions from around 69 different distilleries. Gordon & MacPhail is the Trading name of Speymalt Whiskies while also owning the Benromach distillery, which they purchased in 1993. Some of the brands include Connoisseurs Choice, Cask Strength, Rare Old and Speymalt.
A small island distillery off the west coast of Scotland, Mull, distilled this malt in 1972. It was bottled 10 years later by Gordon and Macphail as part of their original connoisseurs choice range.

NAME: Benriach - 30 Year Old SMWS 12.37 Invitation To The Promised Land
DESCRIPTION:
Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
This Speyside single malt was aged for 30 Years prior to being bottled for the SMWS 12.37 release. It was distilled on the 23rd December 1988 from a refill ex bourbon Hogshead. It makes up part of the Vaults collection and is one of 212 bottles. Titled - Invitation to the promised land.

NAME: Macallan - 10 Year Old Cask Strength - 1 Litre 58.1%
DESCRIPTION:
The much loved 10 year old Macallan bottled at its cask strength - 58.1%.
Matured in Sherry Oak casks from Jerez, Spain.
The very recognisable Easter Elchie house depicted on the front of the box. Some of the earlier releases would have been painted by Sara Middleton.

NAME: Macallan - Oscuro
DESCRIPTION: Macallan Oscuro, which is now discontinued is just a sherry lovers dream. It contains whiskies from 1987 to 1997. It was released at the high end of the 1824 series. Other bottles include the Gold, Amber, Sienna and Ruby.

NAME: Macallan - 12 Year Old (1980s)  - 1L
DESCRIPTION: This is a 1-litre bottling of 12 year old single malt from Macallan, bottled in the 1980s. Very collectable indeed.

NAME: Bowmore - 25 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: From the oldest official distillery on Islay, this dram is so icon showing the gulls on the front of the bottle. It is an older style of 25-year old that is long discontinued.

NAME: Macallan - Easter Elchies Black - 2018
DESCRIPTION: The Macallan Easter Elchies 2018 Black edition was released in 2018.  Only 1,958 limited edition bottles were drawn from the casks.  It was bottled with natural colour at 49.2% ABV.  The release celebrates the distillery’s ‘spiritual home’ at the heart of the Macallan Estate.

NAME: Macallan - Easter Elchies Black - 2019
DESCRIPTION: The Macallan Easter Elchies 2019 Black edition was released in late 2019.  It was bottled with natural colour at 49.7% ABV.  The release celebrates the distillery’s ‘spiritual home’ at the heart of the Macallan Estate.

NAME: Hakushu - 18 Year Old Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION:
Hakushu 18 Year Old is part of the Suntory group. Not many people know, but at the time of writing this description, Bowmore is part of this conglomerate. 
This particular edition was released for the travel retail market only.

NAME: Macallan - Oscuro (2017)
DESCRIPTION: Macallan Oscuro, which is now discontinued is just a sherry lovers dream. It contains whiskies from 1987 to 1997. It was released at the high end of the 1824 series. Other bottles include in the series include Gold, Amber, Sienna and Ruby.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 20 Year Old 1969 4928-4932
DESCRIPTION:
A lovely single malt from the island of Islay that was distilled 26.11.1969 and bottled 20 years later. The maturation took place in an sherry oak cask before bottling took place for Prestonfield House. 
1200 bottles were produced.
This is number 489.

NAME: Macallan - Whisky Maker's Edition - Nick Veasey Pillars Collection (6 x 70cl)
DESCRIPTION: The 6 x 70cl Macallan Whisky Maker's Editions that make up the Nick Veasey Pillars Collection.  Each expression represents one of Macallan’s Six Pillars;  including:

NAME: Hibiki - 21 Year Old - Kacho Fugetsu Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION:
Shinjirō Torii started in 1899 as a wine store in Japanese town Osaka and the rest is history for Suntory. They are seen as the founding and leading Japanese influence for Whisky.
Yamazaki was his first venture into the distilling industry and produced grain/malt whisky. After its great success, a second distillery was built and called.....Hakushu. Thank you Mr Torii.
Hibiki is the most popular blend by Suntory which came to the publics lips in 1989 with whiskies from both Yamazaki, Hakushu and the Chita grain whisky. 
This bottling represents the beauty of Japanese nature.

NAME: Hibiki - 21 Year Old - Kacho Fugetsu Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION:
Shinjirō Torii started in 1899 as a wine store in Japanese town Osaka and the rest is history for Suntory. They are seen as the founding and leading Japanese influence for Whisky.
Yamazaki was his first venture into the distilling industry and produced grain/malt whisky. After its great success, a second distillery was built and called.....Hakushu. Thank you Mr Torii.
Hibiki is the most popular blend by Suntory which came to the publics lips in 1989 with whiskies from both Yamazaki, Hakushu and the Chita grain whisky. 
This bottling represents the beauty of Japanese nature.

NAME: Macallan - Easter Elchies Black - 2019
DESCRIPTION: The Macallan Easter Elchies 2019 Black edition was released in late 2019.  It was bottled with natural colour at 49.7% ABV.  The release celebrates the distillery’s ‘spiritual home’ at the heart of the Macallan Estate.

NAME: Lagavulin - Fèis Ìle 2015
DESCRIPTION: The Lagavulin Fèis Ìle 2015 release was a 24 year old, triple matured malt aged in bourbon casks, px sherry casks and old oak puncheons. It was bottled at the natural cask strength of 59.9%.  This was a limited release of 3500 individually bottles.

NAME: Springbank - 12 Year Old 1980s
DESCRIPTION: One of the most collectable single malts in the world. This is a wonderful example of a 12 year old Springbank from Campbeltown in the early 1980s.

NAME: Macallan - Easter Elchies Black - 2018
DESCRIPTION: The Macallan Easter Elchies 2018 Black edition was released in 2018.  Only 1,958 limited edition bottles were drawn from the casks.  It was bottled with natural colour at 49.2% ABV.  The release celebrates the distillery’s ‘spiritual home’ at the heart of the Macallan Estate.

NAME: Ardbeg - 1977 Very Old
DESCRIPTION:
Hugely Iconic and recognised all around the world, Ardbeg has not always had things their own way. The distillery was bought by Hiram Walker and DCL in 1959. Their intention was to use this special malt for blending whiskies...
Thankfully this was not the case with Hiram Walker struggling in the late 1980s.
Ever since then the Glenmorangie group have owned the distillery reviving it properly in 1997.
It was hard for the group and revived distillery to produce a core range because of the lack of depth in the cask department...
This is the first age statement at a lovely 17 years old.

NAME: Dalmore - 25 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
This bottling was released in 2013 and was a very limited run.
Initially matured in American white oak before being transferred into a combination of Palomino Fino sherry butts and first-fill bourbon cask.
However, the Story of the Dalmore 25 doesn't quite stop there...it was then married together in bourbon barrels before a final finishing period in Tawny port pipes.

NAME: Convalmore - 28 Year Old Cask Strength 1977
DESCRIPTION:
This Convalmore was distilled in 1977 and bottled in 2005 at 28 years old.  This is one of only 3900 bottles produced at a cask strength of 57.9%.
Convalmore, founded in 1894, was eventually sold to W&P Lowrie & Co in 1904. They eventually went into partnership with James Buchanan in 1906.

NAME: Macallan - 21 Year Old - Fine Oak
DESCRIPTION:
Macallan Fine Oak 21 Year Old was matured in both bourbon and sherry cask. 
Whisky colour is measured using a device called a tint meter or a Tintometer. It will refer to the Lovibond colour scale which is of course brown.

NAME: Macallan - 21 Year Old - Fine Oak
DESCRIPTION:
Macallan Fine Oak 21 Year Old was matured in both bourbon and sherry cask. 
Whisky colour is measured using a device called a tint meter or a Tintometer. It will refer to the Lovibond colour scale which is of course brown.

NAME: Macallan - Folio 5
DESCRIPTION:
The fifth release from the highly collectable Macallan Archival Series, an iconic series that celebrates the classic advertising campaigns of the 1970s, 80s and 90s.
The Macallan Folio 5 pays homage to an advert featuring the tale of a “Luggy Bonnet” with the words “Keep this knot firmly tied”.
The sketched image recollects a scene of acquaintances at the end of a day on Speyside when one sportsman talks of a so-called “disaster”, missing the opportunity of a dram of The Macallan from the "Laird" as a result of his hat covering his ears!

NAME: Millburn - 16 Year Old 1966 Gordon and MacPhail Connoisseurs Choice
DESCRIPTION:
Arguably the most famous independent bottler of Scotch whisky there is. Gordon & MacPhail was founded in Elgin in 1895 by James Gordon and John Alexander MacPhail. It is now owned by the Urquhart Family who have bow bottled over 350 different expressions from around 69 different distilleries. Gordon & MacPhail is the Trading name of Speymalt Whiskies while also owning the Benromach distillery, which they purchased in 1993. Some of the brands include Connoisseurs Choice, Cask Strength, Rare Old and Speymalt.
Distilled in Inverness at this now closed distillery, Millburn, in 1966 this malt was aged for 16 years. It was bottled by Gordon and Macphail as part of their original connoisseurs choice range.

NAME: Benriach - 30 Year Old SMWS 12.37 Invitation To The Promised Land
DESCRIPTION:
Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
This Speyside single malt was aged for 30 Years prior to being bottled for the SMWS 12.37 release. It was distilled on the 23rd December 1988 from a refill ex bourbon Hogshead. It makes up part of the Vaults collection and is one of 212 bottles. Titled - Invitation to the promised land.

NAME: Waterford - Single Farm Origin - Bannow, Ballykilcavan & Ratheadon 1.1
DESCRIPTION:
Ballykilvan 1.1 is one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series. Made exclusively using Taberna barley grown by David Walsh-Kemmis on his Ballykilcavan farm in Co. Laois. After distillation, the whiskey is matured in a combination of French and American oak, and then bottled at 50% ABV
Bannow Island 1.1 is also one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series. This single malt Irish whisky was distilled using a single vintage of Overture barley grown on the south coast of Co. Wexford by Ed Harpur on his Bannow Island farm.  Matured in French and American oak casks, and bottled at 50% ABV with no chill-filtration or additional colouring.
The final release in the series is Ratheadon and is produced from Irina barley grown in Co. Carlow on a rich, loamy soil.

NAME: Macallan - Folio 5
DESCRIPTION:
The fifth release from the highly collectable Macallan Archival Series, an iconic series that celebrates the classic advertising campaigns of the 1970s, 80s and 90s.
The Macallan Folio 5 pays homage to an advert featuring the tale of a “Luggy Bonnet” with the words “Keep this knot firmly tied”.
The sketched image recollects a scene of acquaintances at the end of a day on Speyside when one sportsman talks of a so-called “disaster”, missing the opportunity of a dram of The Macallan from the "Laird" as a result of his hat covering his ears!

NAME: Macallan - Rare Cask No. 1, 2 & 3 - 2018
DESCRIPTION: This lot includes 3 x 70cl :

NAME: Macallan - Oscuro (2017)
DESCRIPTION: Macallan Oscuro, which is now discontinued is just a sherry lovers dream. It contains whiskies from 1987 to 1997. It was released at the high end of the 1824 series. Other bottles include in the series include Gold, Amber, Sienna and Ruby.

NAME: Macallan - Folio 5
DESCRIPTION:
The fifth release from the highly collectable Macallan Archival Series, an iconic series that celebrates the classic advertising campaigns of the 1970s, 80s and 90s.
The Macallan Folio 5 pays homage to an advert featuring the tale of a “Luggy Bonnet” with the words “Keep this knot firmly tied”.
The sketched image recollects a scene of acquaintances at the end of a day on Speyside when one sportsman talks of a so-called “disaster”, missing the opportunity of a dram of The Macallan from the "Laird" as a result of his hat covering his ears!

NAME: Glenmorangie - 1990 Grand Vintage - Bond House Release No.1
DESCRIPTION: This is a stunningly presented first release in the Bond House No.1 series of vintage expressions.  This 1990 vintage single was matured in a combination of ex-bourbon and ex-Sherry casks for over 25 years and was bottled at 43% ABV in 2016.

NAME: Caol Ila - 21 Year Old - Rare Malts 1975 61.3%
DESCRIPTION:
Caol Ila 1975 21 Year Old Rare Malt bottling.
This rare single malt is part of a series done by Diageo of both operational and closed distilleries. 
This edition was distilled in 1975 and bottled at a very high strength of 61.3%

NAME: Glenlochy - 14 Year Old 1968 Gordon and MacPhail Connoisseurs Choice
DESCRIPTION:
Arguably the most famous independent bottler of Scotch whisky there is. Gordon & MacPhail was founded in Elgin in 1895 by James Gordon and John Alexander MacPhail. It is now owned by the Urquhart Family who have bow bottled over 350 different expressions from around 69 different distilleries. Gordon & MacPhail is the Trading name of Speymalt Whiskies while also owning the Benromach distillery, which they purchased in 1993. Some of the brands include Connoisseurs Choice, Cask Strength, Rare Old and Speymalt.
From the now closed distillery, Glenlochy, this dram was distilled in 1968 and bottled 14 years later by Gordon and Macphail as part of their original connoisseurs choice range.

NAME: Ardbeg - Very Young 1998-2004
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in 1998, Ardbeg Very Young was released in 2004
It is part of a series called the ‘path to peaty maturity’.

NAME: Lagavulin - Feis Ile 2014
DESCRIPTION: Taken from European oak Sherry butts specially selected by Iain McArthur, this Fèis Ìle 2014 bottling of Lagavulin was distilled in 1995 and has been said to be one of the best festival releases of the year. This is one of 3,500 individually numbered bottles produced.

NAME: Macallan - Folio 5
DESCRIPTION:
The fifth release from the highly collectable Macallan Archival Series, an iconic series that celebrates the classic advertising campaigns of the 1970s, 80s and 90s.
The Macallan Folio 5 pays homage to an advert featuring the tale of a “Luggy Bonnet” with the words “Keep this knot firmly tied”.
The sketched image recollects a scene of acquaintances at the end of a day on Speyside when one sportsman talks of a so-called “disaster”, missing the opportunity of a dram of The Macallan from the "Laird" as a result of his hat covering his ears!

NAME: Macallan - Folio 5
DESCRIPTION:
The fifth release from the highly collectable Macallan Archival Series, an iconic series that celebrates the classic advertising campaigns of the 1970s, 80s and 90s.

NAME: Glenfarclas - 30 Year Old Magnus Platform 1983 - 2013
DESCRIPTION:
This bottling was commissioned by BP to celebrate 30 years of the Magnus platform producing oil in the North Sea of Scotland. The Magnus platform delivered close to a billion barrels of oil in its time. 
An old-style 30-year-old Glenfarclas. Distilled and bottled by J&G Grant, Gelnfarclas Distillery.

NAME: Macallan - Edition 2,3,4,5
DESCRIPTION:
This lot brings together the Macallan Edition set to date (minus 1), comprising of Edition no.2, 3 ,4 and 5 in the annual limited edition series.  
The Macallan 'Edition' series is a showcase of select casks producing a taste with their own individual characteristics.

NAME: Bivrost - Niflheim
DESCRIPTION:
Bivrost Niflheim is a single malt from the world's northernmost distillery! Produced using Nordic barley and matured in a combination of sherry, bourbon and virgin oak casks.
Distilled in Arctic Norway at the foot of the Lyngen Alps and matured in an underground storage vault, previously part of a network of tunnels in a Cold War NATO base.
This is aurora Spirit's inaugural release.

NAME: Waterford - SFO - Bannow &  Ballykilcavan 1.2
DESCRIPTION:
This lot includes 2 x 70cl bottlings:
Ballykilcavan: Edition 1.2 – the second release, uses barley grown by David Walsh-Kemmis west of the Barrow in Co. Laois in the barley heartlands, where his fertile fields are sheltered by ancient woodland. Bottled at 50% ABV without colouring, chill-filtration or any additives.
Bannow Island: Edition 1.2 - the second Bannow Island release by Waterford. Now 3 months older, this expression is from barley grown by Ed Harpur on the extreme southern coast of Co. Wexford, where salt-laden Atlantic winds and sandy soils create a unique, if challenging, terroir.

NAME: Kinclaith - 16 Year Old 1966 Gordon and MacPhail Connoisseurs Choice
DESCRIPTION:
Arguably the most famous independent bottler of Scotch whisky there is. Gordon & MacPhail was founded in Elgin in 1895 by James Gordon and John Alexander MacPhail. It is now owned by the Urquhart Family who have bow bottled over 350 different expressions from around 69 different distilleries. Gordon & MacPhail is the Trading name of Speymalt Whiskies while also owning the Benromach distillery, which they purchased in 1993. Some of the brands include Connoisseurs Choice, Cask Strength, Rare Old and Speymalt.
From the now closed Kinclaith distillery, this single malt is 16 years old and was distilled in 1966. Bottled by Gordon and Macphail as part of their original connoisseurs choice range.

NAME: Scapa - 16 Year Old  - Jutland Memorial 100th Anniversary Edition - Single Cask
DESCRIPTION:
A special single cask bottling of Scapa, released in 2016 to commemorate the Battle of Jutland, which occurred in 1916, bottled in a tribute the 249 ships that were involved in the Battle of Jutland. This is one of 249 bottles produced.
Bottle 98.

NAME: Bowmore - Manager's Selection - 2019 Distillery Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
This is one of only 3000 individually numbered bottles, released exclusively at Bowmore Distillery in 2019.  This limited release, from the home of the legendary No. Vaults, was specially selected by Distillery Manager David Turner, after being matured in first-fill Oloroso Sherry Hogsheads. 
The Bowmore Distillery Manager's Selection is a follow up to the Bowmore Craftsmen's Collection.
This is bottle number 0111.

NAME: Port Ellen - 24 Year Old 1982 #2461 Cask Strength
DESCRIPTION: A closed distillery that is coming back to life! Situated on the south side of the island of Islay, this distillery has fans from all over the world! Bottled at cask strength and only 644 bottles were ever produced.

NAME: Glenmorangie - 1987 Distillery Manager's Choice
DESCRIPTION:
A 1987 vintage Glenmorangie, specially selected by the distillery manager. Aged for just over 10 years in ex-Bourbon casks and then finished in a single port pipe for 35 months. It was bottled at the natural cask strength of 57.2% in May 2001. This bottle comes with a striking wooden presentation box.
This is bottle number 440.

NAME: Hibiki - 21 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
Hibiki 21 Year Old is a very popular blended whisky from Suntory.  It is made up of a blend of specially selected mature malt and grain whiskies aged over 21 years. The key Yamazaki sherry casked malt is vatted with other carefully chosen mellow unblended grain whiskies over 21 years old. 
Some awards Hibiki 21-Year-Old has received:

NAME: Bimber - Southport Whisky Festival 2020
DESCRIPTION:
Only 275 bottles of this very limited edition single malt whisky fromBimber distillery has been produced in 2020. 
It matured in an American Oak ex-bourbon single cask #127. 
This is bottle number 192.

NAME: Bimber - Southport Whisky Festival 2020 (& Sample)
DESCRIPTION:
Only 275 bottles of this very limited edition single malt whisky from Bimber distillery were produced in 2020. 
It matured in an American Oak ex-bourbon single cask #127. 
Comes with 5cl sample of an ex-bourbon test batch. 51.8%.
This is bottle number 133.

NAME: Talisker - 8 Year Old 1980s 75cl
DESCRIPTION:
Found on the beautiful Island of Skye, the Talisker distillery was founded by Hugh and Kenneth MacAskill in 1830. The two were as you probably guessed...brothers. A freak fire resulted in the distillery being badly damaged, so much so that had to be rebuilt in the 1960s. Eventually, as the drinks giant Diageo knocked on the door, they were added to their portfolio. 
This older bottling is from the 1980s and was produced under Johnnie Walker  'The Golden Spirit of the Isle of Skye.'

NAME: Bruichladdich - 30 Year Old 1970 - Valinch 'I Was There'
DESCRIPTION:
This first hit the public palets in 2001 at the Feis Isle and is a very rare Bruichladdich.
It was released to mark the 'first distillation of the re-opening of the distillery' on Tuesday 29th May.
Each bottle is signed by Jim McEwan and is one of 250 bottles from cask 5081.
Bottle 228.

NAME: Bowmore - Manager's Selection - 2019 Distillery Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
This is one of only 3000 individually numbered bottles, released exclusively at Bowmore Distillery in 2019.  This limited release, from the home of the legendary No. Vaults, was specially selected by Distillery Manager David Turner, after being matured in first-fill Oloroso Sherry Hogsheads. 
The Bowmore Distillery Manager's Selection is a follow up to the Bowmore Craftsmen's Collection.
This is bottle number 0127.

DESCRIPTION:

The Bowmore Distillery Manager's Selection is a follow up to the Bowmore Craftsmen's Collection.
This is bottle number 0101.

DESCRIPTION:

This is bottle number 0055.

DESCRIPTION:
