The Bowmore Distillery Manager's Selection is a follow up to the Bowmore Craftsmen's Collection.
This is bottle number 0069.

NAME: Bowmore - Manager's Selection - 2019 Distillery Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
This is one of only 3000 individually numbered bottles, released exclusively at Bowmore Distillery in 2019.  This limited release, from the home of the legendary No. Vaults, was specially selected by Distillery Manager David Turner, after being matured in first-fill Oloroso Sherry Hogsheads. 
The Bowmore Distillery Manager's Selection is a follow up to the Bowmore Craftsmen's Collection.

NAME: Caperdonich - 5 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: A 5 year old bottling from Caperdonich. This Distillery closed in 2002 so the bottled are becoming hard to find.

NAME: Yamazaki - Limited Edition (2014)
DESCRIPTION: Released in 2014, Suntory’s limited edition Yamazaki is a blend of various cask-matured Yamazaki vintages and a credit to Suntory’s chief Master Blender Shinji Fukuyo.  The single malt comprises of vintages of up to 20 years old, including whiskies matured in bourbon, sherry, and European oak casks.

NAME: Macallan - Chairman's Release - 1700 Series
DESCRIPTION:
The Chairman's Release is considered the flagship of Macallan's 1700 series. The series takes its name from the year that Easter Elchies House, the home of The Macallan, was built.
Bottled in 2001, The Chairman's Release single malt is held in an elegant flint gicel glass bottle.

NAME: Bowmore - 19 Year Old 1998 Feis Ile 2017
DESCRIPTION: This distillery exclusive matured for 19 years in 1988 first fill sherry puncheon was distilled on 13th January 1988 in cask 57 to be bottled on 27th May 2017 at 54.3% ABV for the Islays Feis Ile Festival Collection 2018.

NAME: Macallan - Rare Cask Black - Steven Klein
DESCRIPTION:
Released exclusively for travel retail, uniquely, Rare Cask Black has been crafted from first fill Spanish and American sherry seasoned oak casks from less than 100 casks.  This yielded 5,000 bottles of a more peated spirit.
This is the sixth release from the Macallan Masters of Photography range and adorns imagery created by Steven Klein, a US photographer whose clients have previously included the likes of Madonna, Lady Gaga and Britney Spears amidst many high profile fashion labels and magazines.

NAME: Glen Garioch - 33 Year Old - 1985 Single Cask #1586
DESCRIPTION:
This is a beautifully presented limited edition hand filled single Highland malt from Glen Garioch.  It was distilled in 1985, matured in sherry cask #1586 for 33 years and was bottled at 43.1% ABV. 
 
Bottle 62.

NAME: Lagavulin - 21 Year Old - Jazz Festival 2019
DESCRIPTION:
A limited release from the home of Islay Jazz, Lagavulin. 2004 bottles were released and they were only available to purchase from the distillery.
Bottled at cask strength it displays a great balance between the classic Lagavulin smokiness and a refined tropical fruit flavour.
 
This is bottle number 44.

NAME: Bruichladdich - Redder Still 22 Year Old 1984
DESCRIPTION:
The original bottle from this series was called Blacker Still. This is the second release, "Redder Still".
Bottled in 2007 after being matured in first-fill bourbon cask & finally finished in Chateau Lafleur Bordeaux.
Distilled in 2007 this is one of 2080 bottles worldwide.

NAME: Yamazaki - 18 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
Yamazaki 18 Year Old is an award-winning Japanese single malt from Suntory Distillery.
This bottling earned Gold at the 2007 International Spirits Challenge, and impressively it also won double gold at the 2005 San Francisco World Spirits Competition.

NAME: Lagavulin - 1986 Distillers Edition 2002
DESCRIPTION:
Lagavulin 1986 Distillers Edition was double matured and was bottled in 2002 at 43% ABV.  Lagavulin is the most sought after bottling of the Distiller’s Edition range.
Batch No. lgv.4/490

NAME: Springbank - 27 Year Old - 1993 cask #26 (IAAS)
DESCRIPTION: IAAS is the 'It’s All About Springbank' group on Facebook. They sourced a cask of Springbank 1993 which was made available for group members.  This 27-year-old was bottled from cask #26 on 14/05/2020.

NAME: Macallan - 10 Year Old (1980s)
DESCRIPTION: This is an older style of bottling of the famous Macallan 10-year-old malt whisky. It comes presented in the all-white box showing Easter Elchies House,  which is increasingly hard to find.

NAME: Glenugie - 15 Year Old 1966 Gordon and MacPhail Connoisseurs Choice
DESCRIPTION:
Arguably the most famous independent bottler of Scotch whisky there is. Gordon & MacPhail was founded in Elgin in 1895 by James Gordon and John Alexander MacPhail. It is now owned by the Urquhart Family who have bow bottled over 350 different expressions from around 69 different distilleries. Gordon & MacPhail is the Trading name of Speymalt Whiskies while also owning the Benromach distillery, which they purchased in 1993. Some of the brands include Connoisseurs Choice, Cask Strength, Rare Old and Speymalt.
This now closed distillery, Glenugie, distilled this cracking dram in 1966 and bottled it 15 years later for Gordon and Macphail as part of their original connoisseurs choice range.

NAME: Aberfeldy - 16 Year Old 1966 Gordon and MacPhail Connoisseurs Choice
DESCRIPTION:
Arguably the most famous independent bottler of Scotch whisky there is. Gordon & MacPhail was founded in Elgin in 1895 by James Gordon and John Alexander MacPhail. It is now owned by the Urquhart Family who have bow bottled over 350 different expressions from around 69 different distilleries. Gordon & MacPhail is the Trading name of Speymalt Whiskies while also owning the Benromach distillery, which they purchased in 1993. Some of the brands include Connoisseurs Choice, Cask Strength, Rare Old and Speymalt.
Distilled at the Highland distillery, owned by Bacardi, this Aberfeldy was matured for 16 years before being bottled by Gordon and Macphail as part of their original connoisseurs choice range. The distillation year was 1966.

NAME: Hazelwood 105 - 15 Year Old (Kininvie) - 105th birthday of Janet Sheed Roberts
DESCRIPTION:
This is a special bottling of Hazelwood whisky to celebrate the 105th birthday of Janet Sheed Roberts on August 13th 2006.  It is also it is the first bottling of single malt whisky from Kininvie distillery.
The bottle was given to selected staff members of the distillery.  This whisky has been matured for 15 years and was bottled at 105 proof (52.5%).

NAME: Macallan - 100 Queen Street
DESCRIPTION: A special presentation of Macallan given to Edrington staff members to celebrate the move of the company's headquarters from Perth to Glasgow in April 2017.  100 Queen Street, Glasgow is Macallan's new global headquarters.

NAME: Lagavulin - Islay Jazz Festival 2013
DESCRIPTION:
This is the 2013 edition of the Lagavulin Islay Jazz Festival bottling. A collectable bottle released during their 200th Anniversary year - the whisky was drawn hand-selected casks Sherry Butts. 
In order to celebrate the 2013 Islay Jazz festival only 1,500 bottles of this delightful dram. 
This is bottle number 0518.

NAME: Adelphi - Caol Ila - 21 Year Old (1976)
DESCRIPTION: This rare, 21 year old, Islay single malt was distilled at Caol Ila Distillery in 1976 and bottled for Adelphi Distillery Ltd.  It was drawn from single cask no. 8093 at a natural strength 59.9% ABV. This limited release is one of just 178 bottles.

NAME: Bladnoch - 23 Year Old (1977)  -  Rare Malts 53.6%
DESCRIPTION:
This Bladnoch 23 Year Old limited edition was bottled for the Rare Malts series. Distilled in 1977 this Lowland single malt was bottled at the natural cask strength of 53.6% in October 2001. 
The Rare Malt Selection is a historic selection of single malt whiskies from operational and lost distilleries, all released between 1995 and 2005 Diageo.

NAME: Ardbeg - Corryvreckan - Committee Reserve
DESCRIPTION:
This special release of Corryvreckan was only available to Ardbeg Committee members before it was repackaged and released to the public in 2008.
This is one of a limited release of only 5000 bottles.
Corryvreckan is now one of Ardbeg's core malt range which also includes the 10-year-old & Uigeadail as well as An Oa.  Named after a whirlpool close to Ardbeg distillery, Corryvreckan is an intense dram that has risen in popularity.

NAME: Benriach - 12 Year Old 1969 Gordon and MacPhail Connoisseurs Choice
DESCRIPTION:
Arguably the most famous independent bottler of Scotch whisky there is. Gordon & MacPhail was founded in Elgin in 1895 by James Gordon and John Alexander MacPhail. It is now owned by the Urquhart Family who have bow bottled over 350 different expressions from around 69 different distilleries. Gordon & MacPhail is the Trading name of Speymalt Whiskies while also owning the Benromach distillery, which they purchased in 1993. Some of the brands include Connoisseurs Choice, Cask Strength, Rare Old and Speymalt.
This Speyside single malt was distilled at Benriach in 1969 and bottled 12 years later by Gordon and Macphail as part of their original connoisseurs choice range.

NAME: Scapa - 8 Year Old Gordon and MacPhail 75cl
DESCRIPTION:
Arguably the most famous independent bottler of Scotch whisky there is. Gordon & MacPhail was founded in Elgin in 1895 by James Gordon and John Alexander MacPhail. It is now owned by the Urquhart Family who have bow bottled over 350 different expressions from around 69 different distilleries. Gordon & MacPhail is the Trading name of Speymalt Whiskies while also owning the Benromach distillery, which they purchased in 1993. Some of the brands include Connoisseurs Choice, Cask Strength, Rare Old and Speymalt.
This Orcadian single malt was distilled at Scapa and matured for 8 great years before being bottled by Gordon and Macphail.

NAME: Royal Lochnagar - 24 Year Old - 1974 Rare Malt 55.7%
DESCRIPTION: This Rare Malts expression of 1974 vintage Royal Lochnagar was released in 2006. Bottled at the natural cask strength of 55.7%, this limited edition 24-year-old single malt was distilled in 1974.  The Royal Lochnagar distillery is situated close to Balmoral, the Queen’s official residence in Scotland.

NAME: North Port - 20 Year Old - 1979 Rare Malts 61.2%
DESCRIPTION:
This series was created by United Distillers, using bottlings from mostly closed distilleries in 1995. The single malts were distilled between the late 60’s and early 80’s maturing for at least 18 years each and some even reaching 30 years. Due to the great success of this, an annual release was formed, aptly named “Special Releases” in 2001. Distilleries on that list include Benrinnes, Brora, Linkwood & Teaninich.
This single malt is from the closed distillery, North Port, that was demolished in 1983. Distilled in 1979, it was bottled at 20 Years old at the natural cask strength of 61.2%. This is a limited edition, individually numbered bottles.

NAME: W.L. Weller - 8 Year Old Craft Your Perfect Bourbon C.Y.P.B 75cl
DESCRIPTION:
A few years ago...the question was asked, what is your perfect bourbon. Since then, the people have spoken with this Craft Your Perfect Bourbon or C.Y.P.B.
A poll was created online in which the bourbon lovers were asked what was their favourite recipe, proof, warehouse location and age was.
As a result, this 8 year old 47.5% proof came to the public domain...

NAME: Nikka Taketsuru - 21 Year Old -  (Pure Malt)
DESCRIPTION:
Headquartered in Tokyo, The Nikka Whisky company is a producer of great Japanese whisky. A number of different Japanese distilleries are under its umbrella including Yoichi & Hokkaido. Meanwhile...back in Scotland, they also own Ben Nevis distillery. This blended malt is named in honour of Masataka Taketsuru, the father of Japanese whisky. He is the first Japanese who mastered whisky making in Scotland and brought his expertise back to Japan.
This whisky was stored and matured for 21 years or more in oak casks.

NAME: Bimber - Southport Whisky Festival 2020
DESCRIPTION:
Only 275 bottles of this very limited edition single malt whisky fromBimber distillery has been produced in 2020. 
It matured in an American Oak ex-bourbon single cask #127.

NAME: Tomatin - 17 Year Old 1964 Gordon and MacPhail Connoisseurs Choice
DESCRIPTION:
Arguably the most famous independent bottler of Scotch whisky there is. Gordon & MacPhail was founded in Elgin in 1895 by James Gordon and John Alexander MacPhail. It is now owned by the Urquhart Family who have bow bottled over 350 different expressions from around 69 different distilleries. Gordon & MacPhail is the Trading name of Speymalt Whiskies while also owning the Benromach distillery, which they purchased in 1993. Some of the brands include Connoisseurs Choice, Cask Strength, Rare Old and Speymalt.
Distilled in 1964 and bottled 17 years later by Gordon and Macphail as part of their original connoisseurs choice range.

NAME: Convalmore - 12 Year Old 1969 Gordon and MacPhail Connoisseurs Choice
DESCRIPTION:
Arguably the most famous independent bottler of Scotch whisky there is. Gordon & MacPhail was founded in Elgin in 1895 by James Gordon and John Alexander MacPhail. It is now owned by the Urquhart Family who have bow bottled over 350 different expressions from around 69 different distilleries. Gordon & MacPhail is the Trading name of Speymalt Whiskies while also owning the Benromach distillery, which they purchased in 1993. Some of the brands include Connoisseurs Choice, Cask Strength, Rare Old and Speymalt.
From the now closed Convalmore distillery, this dram was aged for 12 years after being distilled in 1969. Bottled by Gordon and Macphail as part of their original connoisseurs choice range.

NAME: Coleburn - 17 Year Old 1965 Gordon and MacPhail Connoisseurs Choice
DESCRIPTION:
Arguably the most famous independent bottler of Scotch whisky there is. Gordon & MacPhail was founded in Elgin in 1895 by James Gordon and John Alexander MacPhail. It is now owned by the Urquhart Family who have bow bottled over 350 different expressions from around 69 different distilleries. Gordon & MacPhail is the Trading name of Speymalt Whiskies while also owning the Benromach distillery, which they purchased in 1993. Some of the brands include Connoisseurs Choice, Cask Strength, Rare Old and Speymalt.
This now closed Speyside distillery distilled this malt in 1965 and bottled in 17 years later. It was bottled by Gordon and Macphail as part of their original connoisseurs choice range.

NAME: Dalwhinnie - 20 Year Old 1962 Gordon and MacPhail Connoisseurs Choice
DESCRIPTION:
Arguably the most famous independent bottler of Scotch whisky there is. Gordon & MacPhail was founded in Elgin in 1895 by James Gordon and John Alexander MacPhail. It is now owned by the Urquhart Family who have bow bottled over 350 different expressions from around 69 different distilleries. Gordon & MacPhail is the Trading name of Speymalt Whiskies while also owning the Benromach distillery, which they purchased in 1993. Some of the brands include Connoisseurs Choice, Cask Strength, Rare Old and Speymalt.
Distilled in Speyside at the Dalwhinnie distillery in 1962, this single malt was matured for 20 years prior to being bottled by Gordon and Macphail as part of their original connoisseurs choice range.

NAME: Benromach - 16 Year Old 1965 Gordon and MacPhail Connoisseurs Choice
DESCRIPTION:
Arguably the most famous independent bottler of Scotch whisky there is. Gordon & MacPhail was founded in Elgin in 1895 by James Gordon and John Alexander MacPhail. It is now owned by the Urquhart Family who have bow bottled over 350 different expressions from around 69 different distilleries. Gordon & MacPhail is the Trading name of Speymalt Whiskies while also owning the Benromach distillery, which they purchased in 1993. Some of the brands include Connoisseurs Choice, Cask Strength, Rare Old and Speymalt.
Little did they know that many years later they would be the owners on this distillery. Tis single malt was matured for 16 years after distillation in 1965. Bottled by Gordon and Macphail as part of their original connoisseurs choice range.

NAME: North Port - 14 Year Old 1968 Gordon and MacPhail Connoisseurs Choice
DESCRIPTION:
Arguably the most famous independent bottler of Scotch whisky there is. Gordon & MacPhail was founded in Elgin in 1895 by James Gordon and John Alexander MacPhail. It is now owned by the Urquhart Family who have bow bottled over 350 different expressions from around 69 different distilleries. Gordon & MacPhail is the Trading name of Speymalt Whiskies while also owning the Benromach distillery, which they purchased in 1993. Some of the brands include Connoisseurs Choice, Cask Strength, Rare Old and Speymalt.
The distillery at the time was owned by the Mitchel Bros and this dram was distilled in 1968. Bottled 14 years later by Gordon and Macphail as part of their original connoisseurs choice range.

NAME: Macduff - 18 Year Old 1963 Gordon and MacPhail Connoisseurs Choice
DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macduff Glen Deveron Whisky for auction
DESCRIPTION:
Arguably the most famous independent bottler of Scotch whisky there is. Gordon & MacPhail was founded in Elgin in 1895 by James Gordon and John Alexander MacPhail. It is now owned by the Urquhart Family who have bow bottled over 350 different expressions from around 69 different distilleries. Gordon & MacPhail is the Trading name of Speymalt Whiskies while also owning the Benromach distillery, which they purchased in 1993. Some of the brands include Connoisseurs Choice, Cask Strength, Rare Old and Speymalt.
This 18 year old Macduff was distilled in 1963 and bottled by Gordon and Macphail as part of their original connoisseurs choice range.

NAME: Dallas Dhu - 14 Year Old 1968 Gordon and MacPhail Connoisseurs Choice
DESCRIPTION:
Arguably the most famous independent bottler of Scotch whisky there is. Gordon & MacPhail was founded in Elgin in 1895 by James Gordon and John Alexander MacPhail. It is now owned by the Urquhart Family who have bow bottled over 350 different expressions from around 69 different distilleries. Gordon & MacPhail is the Trading name of Speymalt Whiskies while also owning the Benromach distillery, which they purchased in 1993. Some of the brands include Connoisseurs Choice, Cask Strength, Rare Old and Speymalt.
Distilled in 1968 at the Dallas Dhu distillery in Speyside, this single malt was aged for 14 years prior to being bottled by Gordon and Macphail as part of their original connoisseurs choice range.

NAME: Benrinnes - 14 Year Old 1968 Gordon and MacPhail Connoisseurs Choice
DESCRIPTION:
Arguably the most famous independent bottler of Scotch whisky there is. Gordon & MacPhail was founded in Elgin in 1895 by James Gordon and John Alexander MacPhail. It is now owned by the Urquhart Family who have bow bottled over 350 different expressions from around 69 different distilleries. Gordon & MacPhail is the Trading name of Speymalt Whiskies while also owning the Benromach distillery, which they purchased in 1993. Some of the brands include Connoisseurs Choice, Cask Strength, Rare Old and Speymalt.
Distilled and bottled in Speyside. This dram was distlled in 1968 and bottled 14 years later by Gordon and Macphail as part of their original connoisseurs choice range.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 34 Year Old - 1972 Legacy Series #6
DESCRIPTION:
Released for the Legacy series from 2002 until 2007 from Bruichladdich and this is the last release in the series.
Number 6 is a vatting of casks from 1965, 1970 and 1972, and comes as a limited release of 1,704 individually numbered bottles
This is bottle 388.

NAME: Ardbeg - 23 Year Old - Twenty Something (Committee Release)
DESCRIPTION: Released in late 2017, Ardbeg Twenty Something is 23 year old single malt matured in ex-Bourbon and ex-Oloroso Sherry casks. This is a limited edition committee bottling elected by Dr Bill Lumsden, Director of Distilling, Whisky Creation & Whisky Stocks at Ardbeg. He has created a non-chill filtered whisky that’s been bottled at 46.3% ABV.

NAME: Highland Park - 26 Year Old - Søren Solkær Photography
DESCRIPTION:
This is a stunningly presented limited-edition single malt from Highland Park. This 26-year-old single malt has been made in collaboration with Danish photographer Soren Solker. Matured in a combination of sherry-seasoned American oak and first-fill bourbon casks, it is a rich, fruity whisky with notes of creamy vanilla.
This single malt comes presented in a limited-edition black leather look case, with a book containing 250 photographs by Soren Solker & Highland Park.

NAME: Laphroaig - 22 Year Old SMWS 29.268 Feis 2020
DESCRIPTION:
This 22-year-old Laphroaig was distilled in 1996 and bottled in 2020.
It would have been released for the Islay whisky festival or some may know its called Feis Ile. Unfortunately, the festival had to be cancelled because of the world pandemic of Covid-19.
SMWS already had this expression bottled and is just such a fantastic release.
SMWS: 29.268 - Essence of Gelfing.

NAME: Ardbeg - Alligator Committee Reserve
DESCRIPTION:
The Ardbeg Committee release in June 2011 which was bottled 'for discussion'.
The new American White Oak barrels are charred to such an extent that they start to crack a little on the inside, and this resembles alligator skin, thus the name.

NAME: Chieftain's Choice - 30 Year Old 1960 Lowland 75cl
DESCRIPTION: A full-bodied scotch whisky from a mysterious Lowland distillery. Distilled in June 1960 and bottled in September 1990 by Scottish independent distillers.

NAME: Glendronach - 26 Year Old - 1992 Single Cask #64 Whisky Shop
DESCRIPTION:
A sherry cask matured Glendronach for 26 years, this is part of their extensive and popular single cask series.
This bottling has been selected for The Whisky Shop in 2018 and is one of only 493 bottles.

NAME: Ardbeg - 23 Year Old - Twenty Something (Committee Release)
DESCRIPTION: Released in late 2017, Ardbeg Twenty Something is 23 year old single malt matured in ex-Bourbon and ex-Oloroso Sherry casks. This is a limited edition committee bottling elected by Dr Bill Lumsden, Director of Distilling, Whisky Creation & Whisky Stocks at Ardbeg. He has created a non-chill filtered whisky that’s been bottled at 46.3% ABV.

NAME: Nikka Taketsuru - 21 Year Old -  (Pure Malt)
DESCRIPTION:
Headquartered in Tokyo, The Nikka Whisky company is a producer of great Japanese whisky. A number of different Japanese distilleries are under its umbrella including Yoichi & Hokkaido. Meanwhile...back in Scotland, they also own Ben Nevis distillery. This blended malt is named in honour of Masataka Taketsuru, the father of Japanese whisky. He is the first Japanese who mastered whisky making in Scotland and brought his expertise back to Japan.
This whisky was stored and matured for 21 years or more in oak casks.

NAME: Johnnie Walker - Red Label Limited Edition Paisley 2021 UK City of Culture x 4
DESCRIPTION:
A limited-edition and special release to celebrate Paisley's chance to become the UK's City of Culture in 2021. Johnnie Walker (Diageo) supported the cause and the eventual winner was Coventry. 
This bottle quickly became a collector's piece.

NAME: Macphail's - 30 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
One of the worlds leading whisky specialists this bottling of 30-year-old whisky has been bottled as part of Gordon & MacPhail's undisclosed distillery range.
It is made up from a long list of Speyside distilleries.

NAME: Scapa - 23 Year Old Single Cask Edition #1069
DESCRIPTION:
This single cask series comes from the Chivas Brothers, was bottled on the 28th of July in 2015. Matured in cask 1069 for 23 years this cask produced 780 bottles.
All of the Chivas distillery single cask editions were made available from their respective distillery shop. This, of course, is quite rare a rare bottling and made even more so for this fact. Grab it now while you can.

NAME: Caol Ila - 28 Year Old Old & Rare 1979 Platinum Selection
DESCRIPTION:
Bottled as part of Douglas Laings Platinium selection, this bottling was distilled at Caol Ila distillery on Islay. The distillery takes in some amazing views of the Island of Jura. 
It was distilled in 1979 and bottled in 2007, a September bottling. 
Bottle 205.

NAME: Hibiki - Japenese Harmony-  30th Anniversary (Limited Edition)
DESCRIPTION:
This was a very limited release, in late 2018, to celebrate the 30th anniversary of the first Hibiki which was released in 1989.
Hibiki Japanese Harmony is a blend of over ten malts and grains featuring Yamazaki, Hakushu, and Chita all aged in five types of cask.  It was developed by fourth generation chief blender Shinji Fukuyo with production overseen by third generation master blender and great-grandson of the founder, Shingo Torii.
This limited edition has bottle art inspired by a traditional kimono pattern, embellished with tabane noshi – tied bundles of strips that have long been a symbol of cherished gifts.  As always with Hibiki the bottle always has 24 facets representing the 24 seasons of the Japanese lunar calendar.

NAME: Caperdonich - 12 Year Old 1968 Gordon and MacPhail Connoisseurs Choice
DESCRIPTION:
Arguably the most famous independent bottler of Scotch whisky there is. Gordon & MacPhail was founded in Elgin in 1895 by James Gordon and John Alexander MacPhail. It is now owned by the Urquhart Family who have bow bottled over 350 different expressions from around 69 different distilleries. Gordon & MacPhail is the Trading name of Speymalt Whiskies while also owning the Benromach distillery, which they purchased in 1993. Some of the brands include Connoisseurs Choice, Cask Strength, Rare Old and Speymalt.
This now closed distillery produced / distilled this single malt in 1968. It was bottled 12 years later by Gordon and Macphail as part of their original connoisseurs choice range.

NAME: Ardbeg - 23 Year Old - Twenty Something (Committee Release)
DESCRIPTION: Released in late 2017, Ardbeg Twenty Something is 23 year old single malt matured in ex-Bourbon and ex-Oloroso Sherry casks. This is a limited edition committee bottling elected by Dr Bill Lumsden, Director of Distilling, Whisky Creation & Whisky Stocks at Ardbeg. He has created a non-chill filtered whisky that’s been bottled at 46.3% ABV.

NAME: Rosebank - 12 Year Old - Flora & Fauna
DESCRIPTION: This is an increasingly hard to find bottling, from the closed and now redeveloped Rosebank distillery.   It is a classic lowland malt and is part of the 26-bottle 'Flora & Fauna' series, made famous by whisky writer Michael Jackson.  Rosebank produced some of the most beautiful and delicate whiskies and this is true of this summery dram.

NAME: Glen Keith - 17 Year Old 1963 Gordon and MacPhail Connoisseurs Choice
DESCRIPTION:
Arguably the most famous independent bottler of Scotch whisky there is. Gordon & MacPhail was founded in Elgin in 1895 by James Gordon and John Alexander MacPhail. It is now owned by the Urquhart Family who have bow bottled over 350 different expressions from around 69 different distilleries. Gordon & MacPhail is the Trading name of Speymalt Whiskies while also owning the Benromach distillery, which they purchased in 1993. Some of the brands include Connoisseurs Choice, Cask Strength, Rare Old and Speymalt.
Distilled in 1963 at the Glen Keith distillery in Speyside, this single malt was aged for 21 years prior to being bottled by Gordon and Macphail as part of their original connoisseurs choice range.

NAME: Talisker - 10 Year Old - Map Label 75cl
DESCRIPTION: An older release of 10 Year Old from Talisker distillery on the Isle of Skye.  Aged for a minimum of 10 years in American oak casks. The bottle label and the box feature a map of Skye.

NAME: Millburn - 18 Year Old 1975 Rare Malts 58.9%
DESCRIPTION:
The Rare Malt Selection is one of the best third-party bottlers the whisky world has ever seen. Single malt whiskies range from operational to lost distilleries that were released between 1995 and 2005.
Distilled on the outskirts of Inverness in 1975 this is a very limited bottling and hard to find for whisky collectors. Bottled at cask strength 58.9%.

NAME: Compass Box -  Tobias & The Angel
DESCRIPTION:
A blend single malts, from Clynelish and Caol Ila - Tobias & The Angel has been created by Compass Box whisky maker John Glaser.  Both of the whiskies used were matured in hogsheads that had previously held bourbon, creating a gentle undercurrent of vanilla.
This is a limited edition of just 2,634 bottles worldwide.

NAME: Game of Thrones - Limited Editions - 9 x 70cl (with Mortlach)
DESCRIPTION:
Game of Thrones series plus Johnnie Walker White Walker Game of Thrones edition. 
In celebration of the eighth and final season of the critically-acclaimed TV series, Game of Thrones, Diageo and HBO have released a limited-edition collection of single malt Scotch whiskies celebrating the show.
Each of the Game of Thrones Scotch whiskies has been paired with a particular house from the seven kingdoms in the television series, plus the final bottling in the Game of Thrones Single Malts Collection - Mortlach - 15 Year Old.
Dalwhinnie Winter’s Frost - 43%: House StarkSingleton of Glendullan Select - 40%: House TullyCardhu Gold Reserve 40%: House TargaryenLagavulin 9 Year Old - 46%: House LannisterOban Bay Reserve - 43%: The Night’s WatchTalisker Select Reserve - 45.8%: House GreyjoyRoyal Lochnagar 12 Year Old - 40%: House BaratheonClynelish Reserve – 51.2%: House TyrelMortlach - 15 Year Old - Game of Thrones - 46% This lot contains 9 x 70cl bottles - one of each listed above.

NAME: Bowmore - 12 Year Old - 1980s
DESCRIPTION: This is an iconic old dumpy style 75cl bottle of Bowmore 12-year-old Bowmore estimated to be from the 1980s.  It was bottled when the distillery was Morrison's Bowmore before it was bought over by Suntory in 1989.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 30 Year Old 1970 - Valinch 'I Was There'
DESCRIPTION:
This first hit the public palets in 2001 at the Feis Isle and is a very rare Bruichladdich.
It was released to mark the 'first distillation of the re-opening of the distillery' on Tuesday 29th May.
Each bottle is signed by Jim McEwan and is one of 250 bottles from cask 5081.
This is bottle number 197.

NAME: Jura - 30 Year Old - Limited Edition - World of Whiskies
DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Isle of Jura Whisky for auction
DESCRIPTION: Jura is situated just across the water from the famous whisky island of Islay. It can certainly hold its own with the big boys...this 30 year old bottle is a limited release from Jura for "World of Whiskies" a travel retail Shop.

NAME: Coleburn - 21 Year Old (1979) - Rare Malts 59.4%
DESCRIPTION:
This Coleburn 21-Year-Old limited edition was bottled for the Rare Malts series. Distilled in 1979 this Speyside single malt was bottled at the natural cask strength of 59.4% in October 2000.
The Rare Malt Selection is a historic selection of single malt whiskies from operational and lost distilleries, all released between 1995 and 2005 Diageo.
 
This is bottle number 4291.

NAME: Glen Ord - 23 Year Old - Rare Malts 60.8%
DESCRIPTION:
The Rare Malts Selection is now-discontinued - but it was a series of cask-strength releases designed by Diageo to showcase some of the hidden treasures in their portfolio.
Glen Ord was founded in 1838 on Clan Mackenzie land at Muir of Ord.
With a peaty nose and full-body, a lovely dram and still very rare at auction.
 
This is bottle number 1964.

NAME: Royal Brackla - 12 Year Old 1969 Gordon and MacPhail Connoisseurs Choice
DESCRIPTION:
Arguably the most famous independent bottler of Scotch whisky there is. Gordon & MacPhail was founded in Elgin in 1895 by James Gordon and John Alexander MacPhail. It is now owned by the Urquhart Family who have bow bottled over 350 different expressions from around 69 different distilleries. Gordon & MacPhail is the Trading name of Speymalt Whiskies while also owning the Benromach distillery, which they purchased in 1993. Some of the brands include Connoisseurs Choice, Cask Strength, Rare Old and Speymalt.
Distilled in the Highlands at Royal Brackla in 1969, this dram was matured for 12 years before being bottled by Gordon and Macphail as part of their original connoisseurs choice range.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 30 Year Old 1988 Douglas Laing XOP
DESCRIPTION:
Douglas Laing founded the company in 1948 and has gone on from strength to strength. This bottling is part of their XOP Xtra old particular range. The single cask matured on Islay for 30 years. It was distilled at the Bunnahabhain distillery in 1988 and bottled in MArch of 2018. 
Bottled at its natural cask strength of 44.6%.

NAME: Bowmore - 24 Year Old - 2019 Hand Fill - Sherry Cask #1558
DESCRIPTION:
This is a stunning single cask handfill from Bowmore Distillery. This is one of the oldest distillery exclusive single casks to be released to date.
It was distilled in July 1995 and matured in sherry cask #1558 for 24 years until September 2019 when it was bottled at 48.8% abv. 
Bottle number 522.

NAME: Glenlossie - 12 Year Old 1968 Gordon and Macphail 75cl
DESCRIPTION:
Arguably the most famous independent bottler of Scotch whisky there is. Gordon & Macphail was founded in Elgin in 1895 by James Gordon and John Alexander MacPhail. It is now owned by the Urquhart Family who have bow bottled over 350 different expressions from around 69 different distilleries. Gordon & MacPhail is the Trading name of Speymalt Whiskies while also owning the Benromach distillery, which they purchased in 1993. Some of the brands include Connoisseurs Choice, Cask Strength, Rare Old and Speymalt.
Bottled at 12 years old by G&M this Glenlossie was distilled in 1968.

NAME: Waterford - Single Farm Origin - Ratheadon 1.1
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in 2016 and bottled in 2020, this dram has been made purely from Irish barely.
The final release in the series is Ratheadon and is produced from Irina barley grown in Co. Carlow on a rich, loamy soil.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 1972 Valinch - Continuation of the Celebration
DESCRIPTION:
This bottling from Bruichladdich was distilled in 1972 and bottled from a single refill bourbon cask #9. It was originally only available at Bruichladdich Distillery, released in continuation of the re-opening of Bruichladdich Distillery.  This is one of only 250 bottles. This is a 50cl bottling.
 
 
This is bottle number 112.

NAME: Rosebank - 8 Year Old Unblended Single Malt 1980s
DESCRIPTION:
This Lowland single malt has been becoming increasingly popular in the past few years with the news of the distillery coming back to life. 
Rosebank was shut down in 1993 but since it changed hands to Ian Macleod Distillers this almost lost distillery has been going through somewhat of a purple patch...
This 8 year old was released in 1982was packaged as part of DCL's Ascot Malt Cellar.

NAME: Glen Albyn - 18 Year Old 1963 Gordon and MacPhail Connoisseurs Choice
DESCRIPTION:
Arguably the most famous independent bottler of Scotch whisky there is. Gordon & MacPhail was founded in Elgin in 1895 by James Gordon and John Alexander MacPhail. It is now owned by the Urquhart Family who have bow bottled over 350 different expressions from around 69 different distilleries. Gordon & MacPhail is the Trading name of Speymalt Whiskies while also owning the Benromach distillery, which they purchased in 1993. Some of the brands include Connoisseurs Choice, Cask Strength, Rare Old and Speymalt.
Distilled in the Highlands, this single malt distillery is now unfortunately closed. Distilled at Glen Albyn, this dram was aged for 18 years beofre bottling. Distilled in 1963 this was bottled by Gordon and Macphail as part of their original connoisseurs choice range.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 1970 Valinch Cask #5085
DESCRIPTION: A 1970 vintage Bruichladdich Valinch from bourbon cask #5085. This is the name given to the 'fill your own bottles' sold exclusively at the distillery, in celebration of the first distillation of the re-opening of Bruichladdich distillery.

NAME: Lagavulin - 11 Year Old - Manager's Dram 2013
DESCRIPTION:
An 11 Year Old Lagavulin chosen by distillery manager Georgette Crawford, bottled in December 2013.
The Manager’s Dram series of whiskies were bottled exclusively for employees of what is now known as Diageo.  These whiskies were selected by the respective distillery managers within Diageo and bottled at natural cask strength.
 
This is bottle number 0035.

NAME: Macallan - Boutique Collection 2016
DESCRIPTION:
Bottled at 100 proof, The Macallan Boutique Collection 2016 bottling was drawn from a selection of matured casks reserved only for distinguished guests visiting Easter Elchers House.
Released exclusively to Travel Retail - this is the first of a two batch release.

NAME: Yamazaki - Limited Edition (2015)
DESCRIPTION: Released in 2015, Suntory’s limited edition Yamazaki is a blend of various cask-matured Yamazaki vintages and a credit to Suntory’s chief Master Blender Shinji Fukuyo.  The single malt comprises of vintages of up to 20 years old, including whiskies matured in bourbon, sherry, and European oak casks.

NAME: Ardbeg - Rollercoaster - Committee Release
DESCRIPTION: This Ardbeg Rollercoaster was released exclusively to the Ardbeg Committee in June 2010 to mark the 10th anniversary of The Ardbeg Committee.  The Rollercoaster consists of ten vintages from 1997 to 2006.

NAME: Lagavulin - 11 Year Old - Manager's Dram 2013
DESCRIPTION:
An 11 Year Old Lagavulin chosen by distillery manager Georgette Crawford, bottled in December 2013.
The Manager’s Dram series of whiskies were bottled exclusively for employees of what is now known as Diageo.  These whiskies were selected by the respective distillery managers within Diageo and bottled at natural cask strength.

NAME: Hibiki - 17 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: A world-famous Japanese blend, made with specially aged malt and grain whiskies from Suntory's distilleries. This popular blend was matured in mizunara casks for over seventeen years and has been awarded an "Editor's Choice" from Whisky Magazine.

NAME: Hakushu - 18 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: Hakushu 18 Year Old is part of the Suntory group. Not many people know, but at the time of writing this descrpition, Bowmore is part of this conglomerate.

NAME: Bowmore - 24 Year Old - 2019 Hand Fill - Sherry Cask #1558
DESCRIPTION:
This is a stunning single cask handfill from Bowmore Distillery. This is one of the oldest distillery exclusive single casks to be released to date.
It was distilled in July 1995 and matured in sherry cask #1558 for 24 years until September 2019 when it was bottled at 48.8% abv. 
Bottle 39.

NAME: Macallan - Rare Cask Black - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: The Macallan Rare Cask Black Limited Edition was released to celebrate the opening of the new Macallan Distillery.  It is part of the Macallan 1824 series and features stunning photography by Paolo Pellegrin and a bespoke flask from the Distillery Visitor Centre.  The release was a limited edition of 7000 sets, which were only available at airports.

NAME: Arran - White Stag - Second Edition
DESCRIPTION:
The second release was made available to Arran's community, the White Stag.
Each release is specially selected by a tasting panel of members of the White Stag.
Each release is always eagerly awaited and sells out very quickly. 
Distilled on 23rd September 1996 and bottled 4th October 2016 from a single Sherry butt; #1996/1335, at 20 Year Old.

NAME: Ardbeg - Rollercoaster - Committee Release
DESCRIPTION: This Ardbeg Rollercoaster was released exclusively to the Ardbeg Committee in June 2010 to mark the 10th anniversary of The Ardbeg Committee.  The Rollercoaster consists of ten vintages from 1997 to 2006.

NAME: GlenDronach - 24 Year Old - 1993 Single Sherry Butt #55
DESCRIPTION: Distilled in 15th of January 1993 and bottled in 2017 from single sherry butt #55. Matured for 24 years and then bottled at 56.7%. This is one of 567 bottles drawn and is part of  Batch 16 of The GlenDronach Cask Releases

NAME: Fettercairn - 30 Year Old (1978)
DESCRIPTION: Distilled in 1978 and matured for 30 years in Spanish Oloroso sherry butts.  The expression was part of the distillery’s Vintage Range released in 2009. This was a limited release of only 3000 bottles. It comes in a stunning presentation case.

NAME: Yamazaki - Limited Edition (2016)
DESCRIPTION: Released in 2016, Suntory’s limited edition Yamazaki is a blend of various cask-matured Yamazaki vintages and a credit to Suntory’s chief Master Blender Shinji Fukuyo.  The single malt comprises of vintages of up to 20 years old, including whiskies matured in bourbon, sherry, and European oak casks.

NAME: Yamazaki - Limited Edition (2017)
DESCRIPTION: Released in 2017, Suntory’s limited edition Yamazaki is a blend of various cask-matured Yamazaki vintages and a credit to Suntory’s chief Master Blender Shinji Fukuyo.  The single malt comprises of vintages of up to 20 years old, including whiskies matured in bourbon, sherry, and European oak casks.

NAME: Macallan - 10 Year Old (1990s)
DESCRIPTION: This is an old-style presentation of Macallan 10 Year old was bottled in the 1990s. This classic Speyside malt whisky matured in sherry oak casks from Jerez. Very collectable.

NAME: Hakushu - 18 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: Hakushu 18 Year Old is part of the Suntory group. Not many people know, but at the time of writing this descrpition, Bowmore is part of this conglomerate.

NAME: Waterford - Single Farm Origin - Ratheadon 1.1
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in 2016 and bottled in 2020, this dram has been made purely from Irish barely.
The final release in the series is Ratheadon and is produced from Irina barley grown in Co. Carlow on a rich, loamy soil.

NAME: Hibiki - 17 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: A world-famous Japanese blend, made with specially aged malt and grain whiskies from Suntory's distilleries. This popular blend was matured in mizunara casks for over seventeen years and has been awarded an "Editor's Choice" from Whisky Magazine.

NAME: Macallan - 10 Year Old (1990s)
DESCRIPTION: This is an old-style presentation of Macallan 10 Year old was bottled in the 1990s. This classic Speyside malt whisky matured in sherry oak casks from Jerez. Very collectable.

NAME: Waterford - SFO - Ballymorgan & Sheestown 1.1
DESCRIPTION: This lot includes 2 x 70cl bottlings:

NAME: Highland Park - 1988 18 3/5 Year Old - Lunar Bottling
DESCRIPTION:
This 18 year old Highland Park, named The Lunar Bottling as it was inspired by the cycle of the moon (the Lunar Nutation) which takes 18 3/5 years. Distilled in 1988, the single malt was aged for 18 3/5 years, then bottled in 2006 at 45.1% ABV. 
This is one of just 500 bottles.

NAME: Macallan - Estate Reserve - Ernie Button
DESCRIPTION:
The Macallan Estate Reserve forms part of The Macallan 1824 Collection and is a classic style of Macallan that includes a parcel of specially selected casks to deliver great richness and intensity.  
This Limited Edition has focused around the close-up pictures of whisky in a glass. Released for the travel-retail market and contains a high proportion of whisky aged in Spanish-oak sherry casks.

NAME: Edradour - 10 Year Old 1972 Gordon and MacPhail Connoisseurs Choice
DESCRIPTION:
Arguably the most famous independent bottler of Scotch whisky there is. Gordon & MacPhail was founded in Elgin in 1895 by James Gordon and John Alexander MacPhail. It is now owned by the Urquhart Family who have bow bottled over 350 different expressions from around 69 different distilleries. Gordon & MacPhail is the Trading name of Speymalt Whiskies while also owning the Benromach distillery, which they purchased in 1993. Some of the brands include Connoisseurs Choice, Cask Strength, Rare Old and Speymalt.
From the Highland distillery, Edradour, this bottling was distilled in 1972 and bottled 10 years later by Gordon and Macphail as part of their original connoisseurs choice range.

NAME: Bowmore - 24 Year Old - 2019 Hand Fill - Sherry Cask #1558
DESCRIPTION:
This is a stunning single cask handfill from Bowmore Distillery. This is one of the oldest distillery exclusive single casks to be released to date.
It was distilled in July 1995 and matured in sherry cask #1558 for 24 years until September 2019 when it was bottled at 48.8% abv.

NAME: Highland Park - 11 Year Old - The Battle of Jutland
DESCRIPTION: This expression was distilled in 2004, and matured in a refill puncheon cask #3378 for 11 years.  582 bottles were produced to commemorate the largest naval battle of WW1 fought between British and German naval forces with much of the British fleet dispatched from Orkney’s Scapa Flow bay.

NAME: Laphroaig 11 Year Old Feis Ile 2003 / with 2 x Glasses
DESCRIPTION:
Bottled exclusively for Feis Ile in 2003 comes this beautifully presented 11 year old Laphroaig complete with two Glencairn Crystal glasses.
For those who have been lucky enough to try this dram, there is a very apparent difference to the 10-year-old Laphroaig.

NAME: Macallan - 18 Year Old Sherry Oak (1997)
DESCRIPTION:
This annual release of The Macallan's popular 18 Year Old Sherry Oak is matured exclusively in sherry seasoned casks, built from both Spanish and American oak, providing a beautifully dark flavour with rich aromas.
The nose opens with dried fruits, ginger and hints of citrus with vanilla and cinnamon. The palate is rich in dried fruits, spices, orange, cloves and wood smoke, before a full and lingering finish with sweet toffee, ginger and a hint of smoke.

NAME: Ardbeg - 21 Year Old - Committee Release 2016
DESCRIPTION: Ardbeg Twenty One came from a Bourbon cask and matured for 21 years. In 2016 the fan club got the opportunity to purchase this committee release. They most certainly won't be disappointed if they grabbed that opportunity with both hands!

NAME: Game of Thrones - Limited Editions - 9 x 70cl
DESCRIPTION:
Game of Thrones series plus Johnnie Walker White Walker Game of Thrones edition. 
In celebration of the eighth and final season of the critically-acclaimed TV series, Game of Thrones, Diageo and HBO have released a limited-edition collection of single malt Scotch whiskies celebrating the show.
Each of the Game of Thrones Scotch whiskies has been paired with a particular house from the seven kingdoms in the television series, plus also the Night's Watch guard. 
Dalwhinnie Winter’s Frost - 43%: House StarkSingleton of Glendullan Select - 40%: House TullyCardhu Gold Reserve 40%: House TargaryenLagavulin 9 Year Old - 46%: House LannisterOban Bay Reserve - 43%: The Night’s WatchTalisker Select Reserve - 45.8%: House GreyjoyRoyal Lochnagar 12 Year Old - 40%: House BaratheonClynelish Reserve – 51.2%: House TyrelJohnnie Walker White Walker - 41.7%This lot contains 9 x 70cl bottles - one of each listed above.

NAME: Ardbeg - Uigeadail - Inaugural Release 2003
DESCRIPTION: This is the inaugural release of Uigeadail, bottled at the cask strength of 54.2% in 2003. Named after the Loch that all the Ardbeg water flows from. This limited edition Ardbeg was created from a marriage of single malt from bourbon barrels and sherry butts.

NAME: Macallan - 10 Year Old (1990s)
DESCRIPTION: This is an old-style presentation of Macallan 10 Year old was bottled in the 1990s. This classic Speyside malt whisky matured in sherry oak casks from Jerez. Very collectable.

NAME: Prometheus - 26 Year Old - Speyside - Cache 1
DESCRIPTION:
A 26 year old single cask Speyside single malt bottled by Singular Fine & Rare Whiskies, a subdivision of the Glasgow distillery.  Glasgow distillery only released their first single malt in 2018. The source of this independent bottling is undisclosed.  
It has received the following awards: 
International Whisky Competition – GOLDChina Wine & Spirits Awards – SILVER

NAME: Macallan - Travel Decades Series - Fifties (50cl)
DESCRIPTION:
One of the most collectable sets of Macallan you will find.
 This expression is a re-creation of 1950's style Macallan
During the 1950s, Macallan whisky was as rich and spicy as modern-day Macallan, but with a hint of peat smoke. This was due to Spanish oak sherry casks becoming available again, following the disruption of the second world war. Macallan was ale to revert to using only first and second fill casks. 50cl, 40%.

NAME: Trinidad Rum - 21 Year Old - Caroni
DESCRIPTION:
This small batch of Caroni, Trinidad 21 Year Old rum was distilled in 1998 and bottled in 2019. A limited release from the now closed Caroni Distillery. With 10 years of tropical maturation in Trinidad before the casks were brought to Europe for further refinement. 
There is only 900 bottles.
This is bottle number 220.

NAME: Macallan - 12 Year Old - Sherry Oak
DESCRIPTION: The Macallan Sherry Oak 12 Years Old forms part of the Sherry Oak range which features a series of single malt whiskies matured exclusively in hand-picked sherry seasoned oak casks from Jerez for richness and complexity.

NAME: Hakushu - 18 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: Hakushu 18 Year Old is part of the Suntory group. Not many people know, but at the time of writing this descrpition, Bowmore is part of this conglomerate.

NAME: Hakushu - 18 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: Hakushu 18 Year Old is part of the Suntory group. Not many people know, but at the time of writing this descrpition, Bowmore is part of this conglomerate.

NAME: Bimber - Sherry Cask #41
DESCRIPTION: This single cask release was fully matured in an Ex-Pedro Ximenez sherry cask #41. Sourced from Spain, this cask was previously utilised in a Jerez Solera for several decades, imparting a delectable selection of bright and rich fruit-forward notes. This is one of only 335 bottles produced.

NAME: Bimber - Ex-Bourbon Cask #15
DESCRIPTION: Released in May 2020, this single cask Bimber, matured in ex-bourbon cask #15 was bottled at the natural cask strength of 58.1%. This is one of just 264 bottles produced.

NAME: Highland Park - Ice & Fire - 2 x 70cl
DESCRIPTION: This lot contains 2 x 70 cl.

NAME: Glenlivet - 38 Year Old 1981 - North Star Spirits
DESCRIPTION: This is a superb 1981 vintage Glenlivet single malt from independent bottler North Star Spirits.  Aged in a single hogshead for almost 38 years, before being bottled in May 2020 at 49.1%.  This is one of just 78 bottles.

NAME: Hibiki - 17 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: A world-famous Japanese blend, made with specially aged malt and grain whiskies from Suntory's distilleries. This popular blend was matured in mizunara casks for over seventeen years and has been awarded an "Editor's Choice" from Whisky Magazine.

NAME: Bowmore - 20 Year Old - 2019 Hand Fill - PX Cask #26
DESCRIPTION:
This Bowmore hand fill comes from the legendary No.1 Vaults on Islay after being held in a 1st fill PX Sherry Cask for 20 years!
Arguably one of the nicest bottles to come from the distillery this year so far and the fact it can only be bought from the Island makes it even rarer.
Distillation Date - 20/1/1999
Date Bottled - 16/7/2019
This is bottle number 150

NAME: Hibiki - 12 Year Old New Beginning 2014
DESCRIPTION:
This now-discontinued Hibiki 12 year old is a superb blended Japanese whisky meaning it has become a very popular, rare and collectable bottling. Hibiki includes malt whisky from Yamazaki and Hakushu, as well as grain whisky from Chita. The whisky is partly matured in plum liqueur barrels.  Unfortunately, Hibiki 12 was discontinued by Suntory in 2015.
This was a special release only given to the workers of Beam Suntory.

NAME: AnCnoc - 30 Year Old 1975 Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION:
Released from Knockdhu and when this was bottled it was the oldest ever expression at the time. Named the 1975 for obvious reasons, it was distilled in 1975 and bottled in 2005 with a superb colour which has had no additives.  
It has spent these 30 years maturing in Spanish and American Oak Casks.

NAME: Lagavulin - 20 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2020
DESCRIPTION:
This 20-year-old Lagavulin was matured in a carefully selected mix of refill and PX/Oloroso seasoned casks personally selected by distillery manager Colin Gordon. This Fèis Ìle 2020 edition has been expertly tuned to give its own unique and memorable performance. Bottled at the natural cask strength of 54%. This is one of just 6000 bottles released.
Bottle 3729.

NAME: Lagavulin - 20 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2020
DESCRIPTION:
This 20-year-old Lagavulin was matured in a carefully selected mix of refill and PX/Oloroso seasoned casks personally selected by distillery manager Colin Gordon. This Fèis Ìle 2020 edition has been expertly tuned to give its own unique and memorable performance. Bottled at the natural cask strength of 54%. This is one of just 6000 bottles released.
Bottle 4908

NAME: Talisker - 17 Year Old - Manager's Dram
DESCRIPTION:
A rare Talisker single malt whisky bottled in 2011 for Diageo staff, at natural cask strength.  The malt was specially selected by distillery managers within Diageo and bottled at 55.2%. This is an individually numbered bottle.
This is bottle number 0480.

NAME: Lagavulin - 20 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2020
DESCRIPTION:
This 20-year-old Lagavulin was matured in a carefully selected mix of refill and PX/Oloroso seasoned casks personally selected by distillery manager Colin Gordon. This Fèis Ìle 2020 edition has been expertly tuned to give its own unique and memorable performance. Bottled at the natural cask strength of 54%. This is one of just 6000 bottles released.
This is bottle number 5010.

DESCRIPTION:
This annual release of The Macallan's popular 18 Year Old Sherry Oak is matured exclusively in sherry seasoned casks, built from both Spanish and American oak, providing a beautifully dark flavour with rich aromas.
The nose opens with dried fruits, ginger and hints of citrus with vanilla and cinnamon. The palate is rich in dried fruits, spices, orange, cloves and wood smoke, before a full and lingering finish with sweet toffee, ginger and a hint of smoke.

NAME: Macallan - 18 Year Old Sherry Oak (1996)
DESCRIPTION:

The nose opens with dried fruits, ginger and hints of citrus with vanilla and cinnamon. The palate is rich in dried fruits, spices, orange, cloves and wood smoke, before a full and lingering finish with sweet toffee, ginger and a hint of smoke.

NAME: Ardbeg - 17 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: Ardbeg 17 year old is an increasingly rare bottling, it has been discontinued for a good few years. The first bottling of this sparked the revival of Ardbeg's fortunes after the takeover by Glenmorangie.

NAME: Highland Park - 25 Year Old - 45.7%
DESCRIPTION:
This Highland Park 25-Year-Old, bottled at 45.7% ABV is estimated to have been bottled in the early 2000s.  
It comes with a striking, wooden presentation box.

NAME: Talisker - 17 Year Old - Manager's Dram
DESCRIPTION: A rare Talisker single malt whisky bottled in 2011 for Diageo staff, at natural cask strength.  The malt was specially selected by distillery managers within Diageo and bottled at 55.2%. This is an individually numbered bottle.

NAME: Ardbeg - Dark Cove - Committee Release 2016
DESCRIPTION:
This limited edition 2016 Committee Release of Dark Cove was matured in ex-bourbon and dark Sherry casks to create ‘The Darkest Ardbeg Ever.’
Punchier than the standard release, this has notes of dark fruits, intense peat, ginger and bacon, with a long smoky finish.  It is said to be created to honour the Islay coastline's shadowy past – although the colour isn’t too dark at all, the dark casks used provide plenty of oaky depth.

NAME: Bimber - Virgin Cask #94
DESCRIPTION: Released in May 2020, this single cask Bimber, matured in American virgin oak cask #94 was bottled at the natural cask strength of 57.4%. This is one of just 263 bottles produced.

NAME: Aultmore - 1983 Flora and Fauna Cask Strength​
DESCRIPTION:
This is a very rare release as part of the Flora & Fauna of which there was only 9 different bottles in the series. It was bottled at cask strength in 1997 and distilled back in 1983. 
This is bottle number 01005.

NAME: Old Perth - 13 Year Old - 2004
DESCRIPTION: This 13 year old expression follows on from a popular blended malt that Morrison & MacKay created for the Old Perth series.  It is a blend that combines whisky from two highly poplular and well respected distilleries - Highland Park and Macallan.

NAME: Scapa - 15 Year Old 2001 - Single Cask #663
DESCRIPTION: This single cask edition from Scapa distillery was distilled on the 16th December 2001.  It was then bottled from a single first fill barrel on the 4th of May 2017.  This is one of only 312 bottles, which were only originally available to purchase from the distillery.

NAME: Highland Park - 13 Year Old - Single Cask Series - Sweden #6403
DESCRIPTION: This 13 Year Old Highland Park was bottled for Sweden.  It is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series.  Distilled in 2002, the single malt was matured in first fill European Sherry Hogshead #6403 for 13 years and was bottled in 2016 at 58.6% ABV.  This a limited release of just 300 bottles.

NAME: Lagavulin - 20 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2020
DESCRIPTION:
This 20-year-old Lagavulin was matured in a carefully selected mix of refill and PX/Oloroso seasoned casks personally selected by distillery manager Colin Gordon. This Fèis Ìle 2020 edition has been expertly tuned to give its own unique and memorable performance. Bottled at the natural cask strength of 54%. This is one of just 6000 bottles released.
Bottle 5035

Bottle 4010.

NAME: Lagavulin - 18 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2016
DESCRIPTION:
This is the Lagavulin Fèis Ìle 2016 release - an 18 year old single malt drawn from European oak ex-bodega Sherry butts and refill American oak hogsheads personally selected by Iain McArthur. 2016 was the year that Lagavulin distillery celebrated their 200th anniversary - as noted on the label of this collectable expression.  This is a limited edition, individually numbered bottle.
This is bottle number 75.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 1989 Valinch 'Cotes du Rhinns'
DESCRIPTION:
The majority of Valinch bottlings are all 50cl and all single casks that are available from the distillery. If you know and have been to the magical island you too can take part in the hand-filling process.
This particular valinch 'Cotes du Rhinns'  was released for Feis Ile in 2006. It was distilled in 1989 it finished its maturation in a Guigal Hermitage Syrah wine cask.
There were only 430 bottles produced.

NAME: Glenlivet - 31 Year Old (Chairman's Stock) Cadenhead's
DESCRIPTION: A bottle of Linkwood-Glenlivet 31 Year Old Chairman's Stock.  Distilled in 1981, it was matured in a single oak cask.  This is one of just 204 bottled in July 2012 by Cadenhead's at 44.8%.

NAME: Caol Ila - 22 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2019
DESCRIPTION:
This 22-year-old single malt was released by Caol Ila Distillery as their Fèis Ìle 2019 bottling.  It has been fully matured in Sherry-treated American oak hogsheads and bottled at a cask strength of 58.4% abv. The whisky is said to contain ‘fresh mint, citrus, spicy medicinal notes finished with a dominant note of spice’ on the palate.
This is one of 3000 individually numbered bottles.
This is bottle number 76.

NAME: Lagavulin - 20 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2020
DESCRIPTION:
This 20-year-old Lagavulin was matured in a carefully selected mix of refill and PX/Oloroso seasoned casks personally selected by distillery manager Colin Gordon. This Fèis Ìle 2020 edition has been expertly tuned to give its own unique and memorable performance. Bottled at the natural cask strength of 54%. This is one of just 6000 bottles released.
Bottle 982.

DESCRIPTION:

Punchier than the standard release, this has notes of dark fruits, intense peat, ginger and bacon, with a long smoky finish.  It is said to be created to honour the Islay coastline's shadowy past – although the colour isn’t too dark at all, the dark casks used provide plenty of oaky depth.

NAME: Glendronach - 21 Years Old - 1995 Single Cask #3048 Taiwan Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
Glendronach Single Cask Series distilled on 9th June 1995 and fully matured in PX Sherry Puncheon before being bottled in October 2016.
 Cask 3048 yielded 650 bottles. 
Only 630 bottled were produced.
This is bottle 618.

NAME: Laphroaig - 10 Year Old - Original Cask Strength 55.7%
DESCRIPTION:
Blowing your socks off at a nice little cask strength of 55.7% this Islay malt is 10 years old. A highly sought-after edition.
Bottled straight from the wood the rich flavours come through like never before.

NAME: Lagavulin - 20 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2020
DESCRIPTION:
This 20-year-old Lagavulin was matured in a carefully selected mix of refill and PX/Oloroso seasoned casks personally selected by distillery manager Colin Gordon. This Fèis Ìle 2020 edition has been expertly tuned to give its own unique and memorable performance. Bottled at the natural cask strength of 54%. This is one of just 6000 bottles released.
This is bottle number 0043.

NAME: Lagavulin - 20 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2020
DESCRIPTION: This 20-year-old Lagavulin was matured in a carefully selected mix of refill and PX/Oloroso seasoned casks personally selected by distillery manager Colin Gordon. This Fèis Ìle 2020 edition has been expertly tuned to give its own unique and memorable performance. Bottled at the natural cask strength of 54%. This is one of just 6000 bottles released.

NAME: Auchentoshan - 1988 - Wine Cask
DESCRIPTION: This wine cask finished was initally matured for 8 years in North American bourbon casks followed by 17 years in first fill wine barriques from Bordeaux before being bottled.

NAME: Bowmore - 26 Year Old - Vintner's Trilogy II (French Oak Barrique)
DESCRIPTION: This is the second release in Bowmore's Vintner's Trilogy - each released with different wine finish. This 26-year-old was double matured; for the first 13 years, it was aged in bourbon barrels, then aged for the remaining 13 years in French Oak Barriques. The double maturation and wine finish has resulted in hints of oak spiced smoke and salty dark chocolate.

NAME: Octomore - Concept 0.2 - X4+10
DESCRIPTION: This is the second release from the Concept series, this bottle was quadruple distilled before being bottled at 10 years old at 70% ABV. The X4+10 is a super-heavily peated whisky. Peated to 162ppm. This is a 50cl bottling.

NAME: Glenury Royal - 12 Year Old 1980s
DESCRIPTION:
Produced by the then proprietors John Gillion & Co, Stonehaven this is a 12-year-old single malt from Glenury Royal. 
This bottling is becoming increasingly sought after due to the closure of the auction.

NAME: Dalmore - Port Vintage 1996
DESCRIPTION:
A port lovers dream from this Highland malt giant.
The Dalmore vintage from 1996.
This bottling is an assemblage of port cask finishes.
Each year only has 300 bottles produced.

NAME: Lagavulin - 18 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2016
DESCRIPTION: This is the Lagavulin Fèis Ìle 2016 release - an 18 year old single malt drawn from European oak ex-bodega Sherry butts and refill American oak hogsheads personally selected by Iain McArthur. 2016 was the year that Lagavulin distillery celebrated their 200th anniversary - as noted on the label of this collectable expression.  This is a limited edition, individually numbered bottle.

NAME: Nikka - Taketsuru Fortune ‘80
DESCRIPTION:
A blend from Taketsuru in the 1980s which was discontinued in the following decade.
Rarely seen at auction, this blend is originally from Nikka and for the experts among us will deduce that this should have Miyagikyo and Yoichi contained within.

NAME: Nikka - Armor of King
DESCRIPTION:
At the time and still today this is a rather iconic version of the Nikka release what was only available in the Japanese duty-free.
The bottle is encased by an armoured Knight.

NAME: ChiChibu - On The Way - 2015
DESCRIPTION: The 'On The Way' series by Chichibu charts the fledgeling distillery's progress over the years.  This is the 2015 release of Chichibu On The Way.  It is a multi-vintage vatting of whisky distilled from when they opened in 2008, including some of their oldest whiskies which has been matured in bourbon casks then finished in Mizunara casks.  This bottling is already very popular with Japanese whisky enthusiasts as it showcases the skill of distiller Ichiro Akuto and his team.

NAME: Daftmill - 2006 - Winter Release
DESCRIPTION:
This was the third release from Daftmill, a family (The Cuthbert's) owned and operated seasonal distillery located in Fife.  Granted a license on St Andrews Day 2005, first distillation took place in December 2005.  
This is a limited edition Winter batch release which was distilled shortly after opening in 2006.  It is one of only 1,625 bottles and is made up of whisky from 6 first fill Bourbon barrels.

NAME: Lagavulin - 18 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2016
DESCRIPTION: This is the Lagavulin Fèis Ìle 2016 release - an 18 year old single malt drawn from European oak ex-bodega Sherry butts and refill American oak hogsheads personally selected by Iain McArthur. 2016 was the year that Lagavulin distillery celebrated their 200th anniversary - as noted on the label of this collectable expression.  This is a limited edition, individually numbered bottle.

NAME: Highland Park - 14 Year Old - Single Cask #6159 - Bulgaria 681
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was hand-selected and bottled exclusively for Bulgaria 681.  Distilled in 2003, this single malt was matured for 14 years in first-fill European hogshead #2966 at the cask strength of 58.4% ABV.  With only 554 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

NAME: Lagavulin - 18 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2016
DESCRIPTION:
This is the Lagavulin Fèis Ìle 2016 release - an 18 year old single malt drawn from European oak ex-bodega Sherry butts and refill American oak hogsheads personally selected by Iain McArthur. 2016 was the year that Lagavulin distillery celebrated their 200th anniversary - as noted on the label of this collectable expression.  This is a limited edition, individually numbered bottle.
This is bottle number 82.

NAME: Highland Park - 16 Year Old Odin
DESCRIPTION:
This stunning bottle is the fourth and final part of Highland Park's Valhalla collection that follows on from Thor, Loki and Freya.
'The Furious One' has been described as a rich and dark whisky with the distillery's trademark sweet and gently peaty character.  
It has been aged for 16 years in a combination of first fill sherry and refill hogshead casks.  This is one of 17,000 bottles produced.

NAME: Ardbeg - 1990 Airigh Nam Beist 2008
DESCRIPTION: Ardbeg 1990 Airigh Nam Beist 2008 - Prior to the Galileo, this is one of the few age statement malts that Ardbeg have been producing. Its name comes from a Gaelic origin which translates to shelter. Distilled in 1990 it was bottled in 2008 at 46% ABV.

NAME: Dalmore - 1996 Cromartie
DESCRIPTION:
This is the third release in The Clan Mackenzie Series of limited-editions. Distilled in 1996, this single malt was matured in American White Oak then Oloroso Sherry.  It was bottled at 45% ABV. This is bottle number C7664820.
A 'significant proportion' of the profits from the original sale of each of these  bottles went to the Mackenzie Clan to help protect their ancestral seat Castle Leo

NAME: Bowmore - 18 Year Old 2001 - 2020 Hand Fill - Sherry Cask #1520
DESCRIPTION:
This 18-Year-Old hand filled bottling from Bowmore Distillery was distilled on 27th November 2001, matured in single sherry cask #1520 and bottled in February 2020 at 56.7%.
 
This is bottle number 549

NAME: Tamnavulin-Glenlivet - The Old Mill - 1968
DESCRIPTION:
This guarenteed "Naturally Light' was distilled at Tamnavulin-Glenlivet Distillery during the month of June 1968 and was filled into oak casks 2528-2531. The casks were stored for 18 years until August 1986 when they were selected for the special bottling 'The Old Mill'.
There is only 1506 bottles.

NAME: Lagavulin - 18 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2016
DESCRIPTION: This is the Lagavulin Fèis Ìle 2016 release - an 18 year old single malt drawn from European oak ex-bodega Sherry butts and refill American oak hogsheads personally selected by Iain McArthur. 2016 was the year that Lagavulin distillery celebrated their 200th anniversary - as noted on the label of this collectable expression.  This is a limited edition, individually numbered bottle.

NAME: Balvenie - 19 Year Old - The Edge of Burnhead Wood
DESCRIPTION: The Edge of Burnhead Wood is the fourth release in Balvenie's Stories range.  This edition celebrates the story of how Malt Master David Stewart made the perfect match between heather and barley.

NAME: Springbank - 21 Year Old​ 1993 Lockett Bros
DESCRIPTION:
This dram came from a bourbon hogshead #470 and was a private bottling.
Bottled in 2015 by the Lockett Bros of North Berwick and aged for 21 years. 
Bottled at cask strength and it is one of only 250 bottles.

NAME: Bowmore - 17 Year Old  - 1999 Hand Filled PX Cask #24 - Fèis Ìle 2016
DESCRIPTION:
This single cask handfill is one of three releases by Bowmore for the Fèis Ìle 2016.
It was distilled in January 1999 and matured in a single Pedro Ximenez European oak cask #24. 
This is bottle number 368.

NAME: Bowmore - 18 Year Old 2001 - 2020 Hand Fill - Sherry Cask #1520
DESCRIPTION:
This 18-Year-Old hand filled bottling from Bowmore Distillery was distilled on 27th November 2001, matured in single sherry cask #1520 and bottled in February 2020 at 56.7%.
 
Bottle 566.

NAME: Chichibu - The Peated 2018 - 10th Anniversary
DESCRIPTION:
This was a limited release of 11,550 bottles and is a peated malt which was distilled in 2013 and bottled 2018 at the cask strength of 55.5%.
In 2007, Ichiro Akuto, the grandson of the founder of the Hanyu Distillery, started a new chapter in Japans whisky industry by building CHchibu distillery. Some of the equipment includes a small mill, mash tun and washback made of Japanese Oak.

NAME: Bimber - Oloroso Sherry Butt #544-7/67 - Selfridges Exclusive & Wine
DESCRIPTION:
An exclusive partnership between the London distillery and department store Selfridges. This Bimber was made from single farm barley (which was malted at Westminster Maltings) and matured in four 1st fill American Oak Ex-bourbon casks. It was then finished in a 2010 single Oloroso sherry butt from hugely renowned Spanish sherry producer González Byass. Bottled in June 2020 at 51.5% ABV.
Only 937 bottles were produced from Cask #544-7/67. Each tube which cases the bottles has artwork from the Dutch artist and sculptor Eelke van Willegen.
Gonzalez Byass Oloroso 2010 sherry: 750ml, 18%. The renowned Gonzalez Byass one of the most celebrated Bodegas across Spain. This Oloroso 2010 is stunning and very popular.  It is said to be short and dry, with notes of almond, plum and figs. Pair with game, cheese and nuts to bring out its natural, fruity undertones.

NAME: Lagavulin - 19 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2019
DESCRIPTION:
The 2019 Fèis Ìle release from Lagavulin was a 19 year old single malt, matured in three types of casks: refill American oak cask, second Sherry treated American oak cask and a European oak puncheon. 6000 bottles were released.
Colin Gordon, Lagavulin distillery manager, said: ‘This bottle is extra special because it’s been chosen by everyone here – from the visitor centre to the warehouse teams.'
This is bottle number 5656

NAME: Bimber - Oloroso Sherry Butt #544-7/67 - Selfridges Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
An exclusive partnership between the London distillery and department store Selfridges. This Bimber was made from single farm barley (which was malted at Westminster Maltings) and matured in four 1st fill American Oak Ex-bourbon casks. It was then finished in a single Oloroso sherry butt from hugely renowned Spanish sherry producer González Byass. Bottled in June 2020 at 51.5% ABV.
Only 937 bottles were produced from Cask #544-7/67. Each tube which cases the bottles has artwork from the Dutch artist and sculptor Eelke van Willegen.
Bottle 819.

NAME: Bimber - Oloroso Sherry Butt #544-7/67 - Selfridges Exclusive & Wine
DESCRIPTION:
An exclusive partnership between the London distillery and department store Selfridges. This Bimber was made from single farm barley (which was malted at Westminster Maltings) and matured in four 1st fill American Oak Ex-bourbon casks. It was then finished in a 2010 single Oloroso sherry butt from hugely renowned Spanish sherry producer González Byass. Bottled in June 2020 at 51.5% ABV.
