Gonzalez Byass Oloroso 2010 sherry: 750ml, 18%. The renowned Gonzalez Byass one of the most celebrated Bodegas across Spain. This Oloroso 2010 is stunning and very popular.  It is said to be short and dry, with notes of almond, plum and figs. Pair with game, cheese and nuts to bring out its natural, fruity undertones.
Bottle 103.

NAME: GlenDronach - 15 Year Old - Sherry Oak
DESCRIPTION: 100% matured in sherry casks this 15 Year Old from GlenDronach was very popular in the 1990's before Billy Walker took over the distillery.

NAME: Waterford - Single Farm Estate Ballymorgan 1.1
DESCRIPTION: Ballymorgan 1.1 is one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series grown by Robert Milne on one of Ireland’s premier malting barley terroirs – the famous Clonroche Series in Co. Wexford, with its loamy, clay soils derived from slate and granite.

NAME: Ardbeg - Supernova - 2015 Committee Release
DESCRIPTION:
Ardbeg Supernova SN2015 is the final release of a 4 part series.
The story of this bottle is quite incredible, Ardbeg successfully launched whisky into space and believe it or not...it returned.
At over 100 PPM peated you could certainly say this whisky hits the pallet with a big bang!

NAME: Cameronbridge - 40 Year Old SMWS G4.20 - Milk and Honey
DESCRIPTION:
This Cameronbridge bottling was bottled SMWS an impressive 40 years old. Aged in a refill ex-bourbon hogshead and is one of an outurn of only 82.  A special and highly limited bottling.
Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.

NAME: Lagavulin - 19 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2019
DESCRIPTION:
The 2019 Fèis Ìle release from Lagavulin was a 19 year old single malt, matured in three types of casks: refill American oak cask, second Sherry treated American oak cask and a European oak puncheon. 6000 bottles were released.
Colin Gordon, Lagavulin distillery manager, said: ‘This bottle is extra special because it’s been chosen by everyone here – from the visitor centre to the warehouse teams.'
This is bottle number 5563.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 1983 Valinch - '1st Anniversary of the Re-opening'
DESCRIPTION:
This single cask bottling is from cask no.1330 - a fresh Oloroso Sherry Butt.  Distilled in 1983, the single malt was bottled in May 2002 to 'commemorate the first anniversary if Bruichladdich Distillery.'  This cask from Warehouse No.2 was selected by Master Blended Jim McEwan to celebrate the historic day.
Bottle 49

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 14 Year Old - 1973 El Vino
DESCRIPTION: This 1973 vintage Bunnahabhain was matured for 14-years, then independently bottled by El Vino of London and Edinburgh in October 1987.  This is a 75cl bottling.

NAME: Macallan - 18 Year Old - 2017 Release
DESCRIPTION: This Macallan 18 Year Old Single malt was bottled in 2017 in Speyside Scotland.  This classic was one of the last bottles in this shape.  It is now becoming rarer and a staple item in a collectors cellar!

NAME: Macallan - 18 Year Old - 2016 Release
DESCRIPTION: This Macallan 18 Year Old Single malt was bottled in 2016 in Speyside Scotland.  This classic was one of the last bottles in this shape.  It is now becoming rarer and a staple item in a collectors cellar!

NAME: Convalmore - 16 Year Old 1981 First Cask
DESCRIPTION:
Direct wines, owners of Laithwaites wines are an independent bottler and they release whiskies under the 'first cask' label. The series of single cask whiskies are all bottled at 46% ABV from a variety of distilleries (some of which are unidentified), for its customers to order by the mixed case.
From the now closed distillery in Speyside, this 16-year-old Convlamore was distilled on the 18th of March 1981. 
Bottle 166.

NAME: Hibiki - 12 Year Old (50cl)
DESCRIPTION: This now-discontinued Hibiki 12 year old is a superb blended Japanese whisky meaning it has become a very popular, rare and collectable bottling. Hibiki includes malt whisky from Yamazaki and Hakushu, as well as grain whisky from Chita. The whisky is partly matured in plum liqueur barrels.  Unfortunately, Hibiki 12 was discontinued by Suntory in 2015.

NAME: Suntory - Excellence Pot Still Decanter 76cl
DESCRIPTION:
Suntory has been around creating Japanese whisky from the very beginning and was established in 1899 by Shinjirō Torii. His first venture was a wine shop in Osaka, Japan. 
This work of art really is a Japanese blended malt encased in a decanter that is of course shaped like a copper pot still.

NAME: Nikka Taketsuru - 17 Year Old (Pure Malt)
DESCRIPTION: Headquartered in Tokyo, The Nikka Whisky company is a producer of great Japanese whisky. A number of different Japanese distilleries are under its umbrella including Yoichi & Hokkaido. Meanwhile...back in Scotland, they also own Ben Nevis distillery. This blended malt is named in honour of Masataka Taketsuru, the father of Japanese whisky. He is the first Japanese who mastered whisky making in Scotland and brought his expertise back to Japan.

NAME: Highland Park - 12 Year Old 1980's 1L
DESCRIPTION:
A classic from the Orkney distillery, Highland Park 12 in the old style dumpy bottles.
Features a screen print on the label.

NAME: Highland Park - The Dolphins (First Edition)
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park created THE DOLPHINS as an officially licenced product for sale in the bars and shops at the The Royal Navy’s Faslane base in Scotland.
The ‘Dolphins’ badge, featuring two dolphins and a crowned anchor, is awarded to British Submariners on successful completion of what is regarded as one of the toughest courses in the world – the Submarine Command Course,aptly known as ‘Perisher’.
The elegant matte black bottle is designed to evoke the hull of a Submarine and the release is rumoured to be limited to 1500 bottles.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 2002 - Maderia Finish - Fèis Ìle 2020
DESCRIPTION:
This limited edition single malt from Bunnahabhain Distillery was matured for 14 years in classic bourbon barrels, then finished in Maderia casks for another three years.  Bottled at 53%, and released by Bunnahabhain for the 25th anniversary of Fèis Ìle - Fèis Ìle 2020.  This is one of only 1164 bottles produced.
Bottle 73.

NAME: Clynelish - 24 Year Old 1989 - Adelphi #3846
DESCRIPTION: This 1989 vintage cask strength Clynelish was bottled by Adelphi in 2013 from single cask #3846, as always, without chill-filtration and with no added colouring. Limited to just 246 bottles.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 20 Year Old  - 1989 Rum Finish - Feis Ile 2010
DESCRIPTION:
This 1989 vintage Bruichladdich was aged in a single cask and finished in a rum barrel.   One of 105 bottles produced to celebrate the Rum Masterclass at the 2010 Islay festival. This is a 50cl bottling.
This is bottle 17.

NAME: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Single Cask #1792 - Trillium 75cl
DESCRIPTION:
This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Trillium and was exclusive to Toronto.  Distilled in 2005, this single malt was matured for 12 years in Refill butt #1792 and was bottled at a cask strength of 61.4% ABV.  This is one of only 556 bottles produced.
This is a 75cl bottling.

NAME: Macallan - 18 Year Old - Sherry Oak (2019)
DESCRIPTION:
This annual release of The Macallan's popular 18 Year Old Sherry Oak is matured exclusively in sherry seasoned casks, built from both Spanish and American oak, providing a beautifully dark flavour with rich aromas.
The nose opens with dried fruits, ginger and hints of citrus with vanilla and cinnamon. The palate is rich in dried fruits, spices, orange, cloves and wood smoke, before a full and lingering finish with sweet toffee, ginger and a hint of smoke.

NAME: Bowmore - Fly Fishing Championship - 2009
DESCRIPTION: This special Bowmore bottling was distilled and bottled to commemorate the Commonwealth Fly Fishing Championships which were held on Islay between the 15th and 20th June 2009. This bottle was a very limited edition run of 150 bottles, presented by Morrison Bowmore Distillers Ltd.

NAME: Macallan - 18 Year Old Sherry Oak (2018)
DESCRIPTION:
This annual release of The Macallan's popular 18 Year Old Sherry Oak is matured exclusively in sherry seasoned casks, built from both Spanish and American oak, providing a beautifully dark flavour with rich aromas.
The nose opens with dried fruits, ginger and hints of citrus with vanilla and cinnamon. The palate is rich in dried fruits, spices, orange, cloves and wood smoke, before a full and lingering finish with sweet toffee, ginger and a hint of smoke.

NAME: Glenlivet - Alpha
DESCRIPTION:
Only 3350 bottles were released of this very stunning bottle when it was released in 2013. Only 600 were released in the UK and instead of giving the public the details of their inner liquid, once all of the bottle sold out, the information was released in a video in June 2013 by Alan Winchester.
He tells all and gives away the secret that this dram was entirely matured in ex-Scotch whisky casks.

NAME: Laphroaig - 10 Year Old Cask Strength Batch #001
DESCRIPTION:
Bottled in February 2009, popular but a discontinued Laphroaig.
This was replaced by the non-age statement Laphroaig cask strength.

NAME: Macallan - Boutique Collection 2017
DESCRIPTION:
The Macallan Boutique Collection 2017 release was drawn from a selection of matured casks reserved only for distinguished guests visiting Easter Elchers House.
Released exclusively to Travel Retail - this is the second of a two batch release.

NAME: Laphroaig - 10 Year Old Cask Strength Batch #001
DESCRIPTION:
Bottled in February 2009, popular but a discontinued Laphroaig.  
This was replaced by the non-age statement Laphroaig cask strength.

NAME: Mortlach - 12 Year Old - 1980s - Gordon and MacPhail
DESCRIPTION: This bottling was matured in sherrywood casks by Mortlach Glenlivet Distillery for  over 12 years and then bottled by independent bottlers Gordon & Macphail.

NAME: Macallan - Boutique Collection 2019
DESCRIPTION:
This is the 2019 Macallan Boutique release.
Taken from a few different matured casks this beautiful dram has notes of sweet dried fruits, ginger and Oak spices. Created for the boutiques only.

NAME: Bimber - Oloroso Sherry Butt #544-7/67 - Selfridges Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
An exclusive partnership between the London distillery and department store Selfridges. This Bimber was made from single farm barley (which was malted at Westminster Maltings) and matured in four 1st fill American Oak Ex-bourbon casks. It was then finished in a single Oloroso sherry butt from hugely renowned Spanish sherry producer González Byass. Bottled in June 2020 at 51.5% ABV.
Only 937 bottles were produced from Cask #544-7/67. Each tube which cases the bottles has artwork from the Dutch artist and sculptor Eelke van Willegen.

NAME: Glendronach - 19 Years Old - 1995 Single Cask #1711
DESCRIPTION:
Glendronach Single Cask Series distilled on 13th December 1995 and fully matured in Oloroso Sherry Puncheon before being bottled in November 2015.
 Cask 1711 yielded 650 bottles. 
This is bottle number 584.

NAME: Bimber - Oloroso Sherry Butt #544-7/67 - Selfridges Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:

DESCRIPTION:

The nose opens with dried fruits, ginger and hints of citrus with vanilla and cinnamon. The palate is rich in dried fruits, spices, orange, cloves and wood smoke, before a full and lingering finish with sweet toffee, ginger and a hint of smoke.

NAME: ChiChibu - On The Way - 2019
DESCRIPTION:
The 'On The Way' series by Chichibu charts the fledgeling distillery's progress over the years.  This is the 2019 release of Chichibu On The Way.  It is a multi-vintage vatting of whisky distilled from when they opened in 2008, including some of their oldest whiskies which has been matured in bourbon casks then finished in Mizunara casks.  This bottling is already very popular with Japanese whisky enthusiasts as it showcases the skill of distiller Ichiro Akuto and his team.
Bottle 9364.

NAME: Bimber - Oloroso Sherry Butt #544-7/67 - Selfridges Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:

Only 937 bottles were produced from Cask #544-7/67. Each tube which cases the bottles has artwork from the Dutch artist and sculptor Eelke van Willegen.
Bottle 475.

NAME: Bowmore - 10 Year Old Devil's Cask Inspired Small Batch II
DESCRIPTION:
Bowmore 10 Year Old Devil's Cask is a limited edition and incorporates a unique fusion of rich fruit and dark chocolate.  It is from the finest first fill Sherry casks.
This is the second edition of the bottling.

NAME: Bimber - Oloroso Sherry Butt #544-7/67 - Selfridges Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
An exclusive partnership between the London distillery and department store Selfridges. This Bimber was made from single farm barley (which was malted at Westminster Maltings) and matured in four 1st fill American Oak Ex-bourbon casks. It was then finished in a single Oloroso sherry butt from hugely renowned Spanish sherry producer González Byass. Bottled in June 2020 at 51.5% ABV.

Bottle 830.

NAME: Bimber - Oloroso Sherry Butt #544-7/67 - Selfridges Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:

It was then finished in a single Oloroso sherry butt from hugely renowned Spanish sherry producer González Byass. Bottled in June 2020 at 51.5% ABV.
Only 937 bottles were produced from Cask #544-7/67. Each tube which cases the bottles has artwork from the Dutch artist and sculptor Eelke van Willegen.
Bottle number 752.

NAME: Highland Park - 15 Year Old - Freya
DESCRIPTION:
This stunning bottle is the third part of Highland Park's Valhalla collection and was released in 2013.
Freya is a 15 year old single malt named after the Norse Goddess associated with fertility, wealth and war.  This bottling comes with a striking wooden stand that resembles a Viking boat.
There are 19,000 bottles of Freya.

NAME: Ardbeg - Blaaack 20th Anniversary Committee Release 2020 & Limited Edition Jacket
DESCRIPTION:
Founded in the year 2000, the Ardbeg committee marks the occasion every year with a special release. This release celebrates 20 years of releases with the Ardbeg Blaaack.
This limited edition is feisty and unique in the same breath. Its the first time in the distilleries history that they have used Pinot Noir casks from the country that lies the furthest distance from Islay - New Zealand. 
The legendary have knitted together this special release to give hints of "velvety summer fruit pudding and bitter cherry, with a deeper edge of soot and Ardbeg’s hallmark smoke."
The Grand Whisky Auction is very proud to have this bottling as their bonus bottle in the February auction of 2020.
Sláinte to all the Ardbeg committee members out there!

NAME: Speyburn - 1974 Gordon and MacPhail
DESCRIPTION: This is a 1974 vintage Speyburn, bottled by Gordon & MacPhail for the Connoisseurs Choice range in 2001 at around 27 years of age.

NAME: Ardbeg - Blaaack 20th Anniversary Committee Release 2020 & Limited Edition Jacket
DESCRIPTION:
Founded in the year 2000, the Ardbeg committee marks the occasion every year with a special release. This release celebrates 20 years of releases with the Ardbeg Blaaack.

NAME: Waterford - Single Farm Estate Ballymorgan 1.1
DESCRIPTION: Ballymorgan 1.1 is one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series grown by Robert Milne on one of Ireland’s premier malting barley terroirs – the famous Clonroche Series in Co. Wexford, with its loamy, clay soils derived from slate and granite.

NAME: Highland Park - Capella Special Edition
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park Capella was released in 2002. It marks the 60th anniversary of one of the most famous landmarks on the island  - The Italian Chapel.
This is 1 of only 5,400 produced from the Northernmost Scotch Whisky Distillery in the world.

NAME: Ardbeg - Blaaack 20th Anniversary Committee Release 2020 & Limited Edition Jacket
DESCRIPTION:
Founded in the year 2000, the Ardbeg committee marks the occasion every year with a special release. This release celebrates 20 years of releases with the Ardbeg Blaaack.

Sláinte to all the Ardbeg committee members out there!

NAME: Dalmore - Distillery Exclusive 2017
DESCRIPTION:
Bottled in 2017, this yearly release from the distillery has been matured in Californian Merlot Barrique casks. 
Distilled in 2000 it's said to have a palate resembling Morello cherries, blueberry pie, cinnamon and soft chewy liquorice.
Bottled at cask strength.

NAME: Dalmore - 25 Year Old 1992 - Cadenhead's
DESCRIPTION: This Dalmore 25 Year Old 1992 vintage Highland from a single bourbon hogshead was in bottled Summer 2017 by Cadenhead's for the 175th Anniversary series. This is one of 270 bottles.

NAME: Glen Scotia - 25 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This bottle of Glen Scotia 25 Year Old has been matured in the finest Bourbon casks. The bottle was released in 2017 in time for the Campbeltown Malts Festival.

NAME: Jura - Elements - Fire Vintage 1998
DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Isle of Jura Whisky for auction
DESCRIPTION: This bottle by Jura is part of the 'Elements' series. 'Fire' came from fired bourbon casks, left for a decade the fiery fledging spirt won character. Distilled in October 1998 and bottled in 2008, there is only 684 bottles.

NAME: Ardbeg - Supernova - 2015 Committee Release
DESCRIPTION:
Ardbeg Supernova SN2015 is the final release of a 4 part series.
The story of this bottle is quite incredible, Ardbeg successfully launched whisky into space and believe it or not...it returned.
At over 100 PPM peated you could certainly say this whisky hits the pallet with a big bang!

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 2002 - Maderia Finish - Fèis Ìle 2020
DESCRIPTION:
This limited edition single malt from Bunnahabhain Distillery was matured for 14 years in classic bourbon barrels, then finished in Maderia casks for another three years.  Bottled at 53%, and released by Bunnahabhain for the 25th anniversary of Fèis Ìle - Fèis Ìle 2020.  This is one of only 1164 bottles produced.
This is bottle number 0877.

NAME: Laphroaig - 10 Year Old - Original Cask Strength Batch #002
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is from batch 002, original cask strength bottling of the medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour. This release was bottled at 58.3% in January 2010.

NAME: Ledaig - 16 Year Old Sherry Cask Finish / Distillery Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
The Isle of Mull's Tobermory distillery opened in 1798 and was originally known as Ledaig. 
This dram was finished in a Spanish Oak cask, this is one of only 600 bottles that were only available at the distillery.

NAME: ChiChibu - On The Way - 2019
DESCRIPTION: The 'On The Way' series by Chichibu charts the fledgeling distillery's progress over the years.  This is the 2019 release of Chichibu On The Way.  It is a multi-vintage vatting of whisky distilled from when they opened in 2008, including some of their oldest whiskies which has been matured in bourbon casks then finished in Mizunara casks.  This bottling is already very popular with Japanese whisky enthusiasts as it showcases the skill of distiller Ichiro Akuto and his team.

It was then finished in a single Oloroso sherry butt from hugely renowned Spanish sherry producer González Byass. Bottled in June 2020 at 51.5% ABV.
Only 937 bottles were produced from Cask #544-7/67. Each tube which cases the bottles has artwork from the Dutch artist and sculptor Eelke van Willegen.
Bottle 68.

DESCRIPTION:

This is bottle number 0104.

NAME: Glenfarclas - 2003 Family Cask Summer 2018 #1963
DESCRIPTION:
Owned by the Grant family, this Speyside distillery in Ballindalloch has 6 stills and has a production capacity of around 3.5 million litres of spirit per year. 
Around 68,000 casks are being kept maturing for the future.
This bottling is part of their family cask selection, bottled in 06/12/2018 this is one of only 612 bottles produced.

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.2
DESCRIPTION: This is the second release from the Macallan Edition series.  Edition No.2 is a collaboration between Macallan's master blender Bob Delgarno and legendary Spanish chefs Joan, Josep and Jordi Roca.  The Rocas are the three brothers behind El Celler de Can Roca (named Best Restaurant in the World twice by Restaurant magazine).  This single malt was drawn from a combination of sherry puncheons, butts and refill hogsheads.

NAME: Ardbeg - Blaaack 20th Anniversary Committee Release 2020
DESCRIPTION:
Founded in the year 2000, the Ardbeg committee marks the occasion every year with a special release. This release celebrates 20 years of releases with the Ardbeg Blaaack.
This limited edition is feisty and unique in the same breath. Its the first time in the distilleries history that they have used Pinot Noir casks from the country that lies the furthest distance from Islay - New Zealand.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 1988 Valinch - Continuation of the Celebration
DESCRIPTION:
This bottling from Bruichladdich was distilled in 1988 and bottled from a single fresh bourbon cask #1132. It was originally only available at Bruichladdich Distillery, released in continuation of the re-opening of Bruichladdich Distillery.  This is one of 300 bottles. This is a 50cl bottling.
 
 
This is bottle number 7.

NAME: Ardbeg - Supernova - 2015 Committee Release
DESCRIPTION:
Ardbeg Supernova SN2015 is the final release of a 4 part series.
The story of this bottle is quite incredible, Ardbeg successfully launched whisky into space and believe it or not...it returned.
At over 100 PPM peated you could certainly say this whisky hits the pallet with a big bang!

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.2
DESCRIPTION: This is the second release from the Macallan Edition series.  Edition No.2 is a collaboration between Macallan's master blender Bob Delgarno and legendary Spanish chefs Joan, Josep and Jordi Roca.  The Rocas are the three brothers behind El Celler de Can Roca (named Best Restaurant in the World twice by Restaurant magazine).  This single malt was drawn from a combination of sherry puncheons, butts and refill hogsheads.

NAME: Ardbeg - Blaaack 20th Anniversary Committee Release 2020
DESCRIPTION:
Founded in the year 2000, the Ardbeg committee marks the occasion every year with a special release. This release celebrates 20 years of releases with the Ardbeg Blaaack.
This limited edition is feisty and unique in the same breath. Its the first time in the distilleries history that they have used Pinot Noir casks from the country that lies the furthest distance from Islay - New Zealand. 
The legendary have knitted together this special release to give hints of "velvety summer fruit pudding and bitter cherry, with a deeper edge of soot and Ardbeg’s hallmark smoke."
The Grand Whisky Auction is very proud to have this bottling as their bonus bottle in the February auction of 2020.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 18 Year Old - Valinch #038 - Phil Spencer
DESCRIPTION:
A special single bottle of 1991 vintage 18-year-old Bruichladdich bottled to celebrate the visit of Phil Spencer on 27th of January 2010. This is bottle 01 of 01.
Signed.

NAME: Macallan - Gold (Limited Edition)
DESCRIPTION:
Macallan Gold was released in late 2012 as part of a series of colour-themed bottlings introduced to replace the distillery's age-statement expressions. Produced from 9-15yo first fill and refill sherry casks, it was designed to sit between the now-defunct 10yo Sherry Oak and 10yo Fine Oak bottlings.
This is a limited edition bottling.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 1988 Valinch 'Queens 80th Birthday'
DESCRIPTION:
This 1988 vintage Bruichladdich was bottled in celebration of the Queen's 80th Birthday in 2006. This is one of 300 bottles from sherry cask #1192. 
This is bottle number 010.

DESCRIPTION:
Bowmore 10 Year Old Devil's Cask is a limited edition and incorporates a unique fusion of rich fruit and dark chocolate.  It is from the finest first fill Sherry casks.
This is the second edition of the bottling.

NAME: Dailuaine - 17 Year Old (2000) - Manager's Dram
DESCRIPTION:
A 17 year old from Dailuaine Distillery in Aberlour, specially selected by Malt Distillery Managers within Diageo Distilling Ltd. and bottled at the cask strength of 59.5% in November 2000.  
This bottle is from the highly collectable Manager's Dram series of single malt releases. The bottles were released to be available exclusively to employees of Diageo.
 
This is bottle number 0970.

NAME: Daftmill - 2007 Winter Batch
DESCRIPTION:
A family-owned and operated distillery which is located in the heart of the kingdom of Fife.
This limited edition is one of only 1785 bottles which was distilled in 2007. The seven first-fill ex-bourbon barrels that make up this release are: 023/2007, 024/2007, 025/2007, 027/2007, 032/2007, 035/2007 and 038/2007 which were all distilled and filled in November 2007. This release was bottled in 2019.
When not distilling Francis Cuthbert looks after the estate, growing and malting the barley.

NAME: Wolfburn - Kylver Series - 1st Release
DESCRIPTION:
This is the first instalment in the Wolfburn Distillery Kylver collectors’ series. 
The first Kylver release was matured in bourbon barrels. It was released in August 2016 at 46%. This is one of 1200 bottles. 
The Kylver series follows the Viking runic alphabet engraved on a large stone excavated in Gotland (Sweden) in 1903.  The fourth symbol  is called “Ansuz”, which roughly translates as “god” or “gods”.  
Wolfburn Distillery is located in Thurso, making it the Northern most distillery on the UK mainland.  Based around a long lost distillery that ended around 1850, this new Wolfburn reopened in 2013.

NAME: Lagavulin - 16 Year Old - White Horse
DESCRIPTION:
This is a popular and much sought-after single malt with the massive peat-smoke that's typical of southern Islay - but also offering richness and a dryness that turns it into a truly interesting tipple. The 16 year old, aged in oak casks has truly become a benchmark Islay dram from the Lagavulin distillery.
This whisky was The Runner Up in TWE's Whisky of the Year 2014 & 2015 Silver Outstanding Medal Winner - International Wine & Spirits Competition amongst other accolades. 
White Horse Edition is very appealing to collectors and is fast disappearing.

NAME: Bowmore - 15 Year Old Mariner
DESCRIPTION:
From the shores of Islay this 15 year old whisky was matured in both bourbon barrels and sherry oak barrels.
These casks came from North America and Spain before arriving at their new home in Islay.

NAME: Highland Park - 21 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: 21 Year Old Highland Park is considered one of the best expressions Highland Park produces by many.  Originally created exclusively for global travel retail and duty-free markets, this whisky was named Best Single Malt of the Year at the World Whisky Awards 2009. Released in October 2007, Highland Park 21 is a full-flavoured, powerful, sweet single malt with a rich smoky finish.

NAME: Laphroaig - 10 Year Old - Original Cask Strength Batch #002
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is from batch 002, original cask strength bottling of the medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour. This release was bottled at 58.3% in January 2010.

NAME: Longrow - 17 Year Old (2002) -  Single Sherry Cask - The Nectar
DESCRIPTION:
This single cask Longrow was distilled in October 2002 and matured in a single sherry hogshead for 17 years, until it was bottled in November 2019.
One of 282 bottles, specially selected and bottled for The Nectar, Belgium. 
Longrow is a double distilled, heavily peated single malt from Springbank Distillery.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 2002 - Maderia Finish - Fèis Ìle 2020
DESCRIPTION: This limited edition single malt from Bunnahabhain Distillery was matured for 14 years in classic bourbon barrels, then finished in Maderia casks for another three years.  Bottled at 53%, and released by Bunnahabhain for the 25th anniversary of Fèis Ìle - Fèis Ìle 2020.  This is one of only 1164 bottles produced.

NAME: Springbank - 9 Year Old 1989 Millennium Malt Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION:
To celebrate the millennium S H Jones & Co have selected this cracking Springbank 9 Year Old from Campbelltown in Argyllshire.
Only 100 bottles of this single malt were produced. 
 
This is bottle 61.

NAME: English Whisky Co - Birth of Prince George Decanter 2013
DESCRIPTION:
Produced by the English whisky company to celebrate the birth of HRH Prince George. He is the 1st Son of Duke and Duchess of Cambridge and was born on the 2nd July 2013.
This is one of only 299 bottles.
Bottle number 238.

NAME: Bowmore - 10 Year Old Devil's Cask Inspired Small Batch II
DESCRIPTION:
Bowmore 10 Year Old Devil's Cask is a limited edition and incorporates a unique fusion of rich fruit and dark chocolate.  It is from the finest first fill Sherry casks.
This is the second edition of the bottling.

NAME: Bowmore - 12 Year Old Fèis Ìle 2015 First Fill Sherry
DESCRIPTION:
This 2015 Fèis Ìle release by Bowmore was matured for 12 Years in a first fill sherry butt giving this whisky such a rich hue.  
Date distilled 7/10/2002. 
This is bottle number 534, which was hand filled on the 25/5/2015.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 14 Year Old (2005) Burgundy Finish
DESCRIPTION:
This Bunnahabhain was distilled in late 2005 and was matured in refill whisky hogsheads before being transferred Burgundy wine casks for the rest of the maturation period. This is one of 600 bottles.
This is bottle number 109.

NAME: Macallan - Ruby - 1824 Series
DESCRIPTION: The Macallan Ruby is from the 1824 series.  Other bottles in the series include Macallan Gold, Sienna and Amber. As you can tell from the colouring this bottle is very full of character and most certainly at the higher end of the flavour spectrum.

NAME: Macallan - Ruby - 1824 Series
DESCRIPTION: The Macallan Ruby is from the 1824 series.  Other bottles in the series include Macallan Gold, Sienna and Amber. As you can tell from the colouring this bottle is very full of character and most certainly at the higher end of the flavour spectrum.

NAME: Glen Moray - 21 Year Old SMWS 35.243 - 21st Anniversary London Branch
DESCRIPTION:
This Speyside single malt is from Glen Moray and has been aged for 21 years.  This is one of only 167 bottles produced in celebration of the SMWS London Branch -  the release has been named 'A Tropical Treasure'
Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.

NAME: Highland Park - Quercus - Keystone Series 3rd Release
DESCRIPTION:
The Keystones Series 3rd release, from Highland Park, Quercus.
The series explores five traditional 'keystones' that have been essential for the production and have been unchanged for 220 years.
The bottle takes its name from the kind of Oak used to make their casks. They are sent to Spain (Jerez) in order to in sherry before returning to the distillery. 
This is one of only 1200 bottles.

NAME: Glenfiddich - 23 Year Old Grand Cru
DESCRIPTION:
The Glenfiddich range has a new member, Grand Cru.
'The ultimate spirit of celebration' was released on general sale at the distillery in 2019 and has been matured for 23 years in American and European oak casks.
The finishing touch is the expression being finished in French cuvée casks.

NAME: Highland Park - 12 Year Old 1980's 75cl
DESCRIPTION:
A classic from the Orkney distillery, Highland Park 12 in the old style dumpy bottles.
Features a screen print on the label.

Each limited release batch represents the volume of only 50 oak sherry butts.

NAME: Bowmore - 15 Year Old - Darkest
DESCRIPTION: The Bowmore Darkest has been matured in Bourbon casks initially, but the final three years the single malt spent in Oloroso sherry casks gives the whisky its rich, deep colour.  This 15 year old was bottled at 43% abv.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 2002 - Maderia Finish - Fèis Ìle 2020
DESCRIPTION: This limited edition single malt from Bunnahabhain Distillery was matured for 14 years in classic bourbon barrels, then finished in Maderia casks for another three years.  Bottled at 53%, and released by Bunnahabhain for the 25th anniversary of Fèis Ìle - Fèis Ìle 2020.  This is one of only 1164 bottles produced.

NAME: Macallan - Ruby - 1824 Series
DESCRIPTION: The Macallan Ruby is from the 1824 series.  Other bottles in the series include Macallan Gold, Sienna and Amber. As you can tell from the colouring this bottle is very full of character and most certainly at the higher end of the flavour spectrum.

NAME: Bruichladdich - Valinch 1990 'The Valinch' Cask #451
DESCRIPTION:
The majority of Valinch bottlings are all 50cl and all single casks that are available from the distillery. If you know and have been to the magical island you too can take part in the hand-filling process. The term Valinch is a piece of old whisky terminology that comes from the Spanish & French. It is the word for a pipette that takes the samples from a cask. These bottlings were introduced to the public after the distillery was purchased in 2001 by Murray McDavid.
A single cask distilled on 7th February 1990 from Bruichladdich. This dram was bottled on the 11th November 2004 from a refill sherry hogshead #451. 
The hoggy yielded 350 bottles and was available only to visitors of the distillery.
Bottle 68.

NAME: Ardbeg - Blaaack 20th Anniversary Committee Release 2020
DESCRIPTION:
Founded in the year 2000, the Ardbeg committee marks the occasion every year with a special release. This release celebrates 20 years of releases with the Ardbeg Blaaack.
This limited edition is feisty and unique in the same breath. Its the first time in the distilleries history that they have used Pinot Noir casks from the country that lies the furthest distance from Islay - New Zealand. 
The legendary have knitted together this special release to give hints of "velvety summer fruit pudding and bitter cherry, with a deeper edge of soot and Ardbeg’s hallmark smoke."
The Grand Whisky Auction is very proud to have this bottling as their bonus bottle in the February auction of 2020.

DESCRIPTION:
A 19 year old refill cask Mortlach, specially selected by Malt Distillery Managers within Diageo Distilling Ltd. and bottled at cask strength of 55.8% in December 2002.  
This bottle is from the highly collectable Manager's Dram series of single malt releases. The bottles were released to be available exclusively to employees of Diageo.
This is bottle number 1654.

NAME: Glenmorangie - 10 Year Old - 1993 Cask Strength - 100 Best UK Companies To Work For
DESCRIPTION:
This is a bottling of Glenmorangie 10 year old...but not just any 10 year old.
Distilled in 1993 and released in 2003 after being matured in American White Oak.
This bottling was released to commemorate Glenmorangie being one of the 100 best companies to work for within the UK.
Only 350 bottles were released and is signed by Paul Neep, Glenmorangie Chief Executive. 
Bottle number 281.

NAME: Dailuaine - 22 Year Old 20cl 1973 Rare Malt 61.80%
DESCRIPTION:
This wonderful series was created by United Distillers, using bottlings from mostly closed distilleries in 1995. The single malts were distilled between the late 60’s and early 80’s maturing for at least 18 years each and some even reaching 30 years. Due to the great success of this, an annual release was formed, aptly named “Special Releases” in 2001. Distilleries on that list include Benrinnes, Brora, Linkwood & Teaninich.
Distilled in 1973 at Dailuaine it was then bottled 22 years old later at cask strength of 60.92%.
This is a 20cl bottle.

NAME: GlenAllachie - 19 Year Old 2000 PX Hogshead #6248 (with Glass)
DESCRIPTION:
Bottled at the natural cask strength of 52.5% this is an exclusive for The Whisky World. It was distilled in April of the Millenium and bottled at 19 years old in March 2020...very close to a 20 year old!
The story for this bottling is complex, it was first stored in a American Standard Barrel/Refill Bourbon cask and then transferred to a PX Hogshead. 
This dram was transferred into its new cask under the careful guidance of Billy Walker for at least 2 years which gives it a great finish/colour. 
Bottle number 309, box number 280.

NAME: Laphroaig - 11 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
Released by Suntory Beam following the purchase of Beam Global by Suntory.  Matured in ex-Bourbon casks, quarter casks and ex-Oloroso sherry casks.  This is one of 1400 bottles exclusively sold at Amsterdam Airport Schiphol.
 
This is bottle number 0543.

NAME: Dalmore - Dee Dram (2010 Limited Edition)
DESCRIPTION:
The Dalmore Dee Dram is part of the famous Dalmore 2011 River’s Collection. 
The Rivers Collection included four bottlings, each named after a famous Scottish Salmon river; The Dee, The Spey, The Tweed and The Tay.
The Dee Dram was released to help raise money for the River Dee Trust - a conservation trust which improves the habitat along the tributaries helps ease obstructions to fish migration and plants native trees along the riverbanks and upper sections of the Dee to protect rare and threatened Spring Salmon.

DESCRIPTION: This is Committee exclusive release of Ardbeg Kelpie, a single malt released in 2017.  It was matured in casks made from virgin Black Sea oak and more traditional bourbon casks.
