NAME: Longrow - 17 Year Old (2002) -  Single Sherry Cask - The Nectar
DESCRIPTION:
This single cask Longrow was distilled in October 2002 and matured in a single sherry hogshead for 17 years, until it was bottled in November 2019.
One of 282 bottles, specially selected and bottled for The Nectar, Belgium. 
Longrow is a double distilled, heavily peated single malt from Springbank Distillery.

NAME: Nikka - G&G  Knight Ornament
DESCRIPTION: Known for its smooth taste comes this rare bottle of Nikka G&G.

NAME: Ardbeg - 19 Year Old - Traigh Bhan
DESCRIPTION: Matured in American oak and Oloroso sherry casks – Ardbeg Traigh Bhan is a 19 year old whisky and the Distillery’s latest small batch release. Inspired by Islay’s Traigh Bhan beach (known locally as the Singing Sands), this rare aged spirit is an enchanting reflection of the place to which it gets its name.

NAME: Macallan - Ruby - 1824 Series
DESCRIPTION: The Macallan Ruby is from the 1824 series.  Other bottles in the series include Macallan Gold, Sienna and Amber. As you can tell from the colouring this bottle is very full of character and most certainly at the higher end of the flavour spectrum.

NAME: Macallan - Ruby - 1824 Series
DESCRIPTION: The Macallan Ruby is from the 1824 series.  Other bottles in the series include Macallan Gold, Sienna and Amber. As you can tell from the colouring this bottle is very full of character and most certainly at the higher end of the flavour spectrum.

NAME: Macallan - Ruby - 1824 Series
DESCRIPTION: The Macallan Ruby is from the 1824 series.  Other bottles in the series include Macallan Gold, Sienna and Amber. As you can tell from the colouring this bottle is very full of character and most certainly at the higher end of the flavour spectrum.

NAME: Daftmill - 2007 Winter Batch
DESCRIPTION:
A family-owned and operated distillery which is located in the heart of the kingdom of Fife.
This limited edition is one of only 1785 bottles which was distilled in 2007. The seven first-fill ex-bourbon barrels that make up this release are: 023/2007, 024/2007, 025/2007, 027/2007, 032/2007, 035/2007 and 038/2007 which were all distilled and filled in November 2007. This release was bottled in 2019.
When not distilling Francis Cuthbert looks after the estate, growing and malting the barley.

NAME: Macallan - Ruby - 1824 Series
DESCRIPTION: The Macallan Ruby is from the 1824 series.  Other bottles in the series include Macallan Gold, Sienna and Amber. As you can tell from the colouring this bottle is very full of character and most certainly at the higher end of the flavour spectrum.

NAME: Nikka Taketsuru - Single Malt Apple Brandy Wood Finish
DESCRIPTION: This is a non-age-statement expression of Nikka Taketsuru single malt to commemorate the 100th anniversary of the wedding of Nikka Whisky Distillery founder Masataka Taketsuru to Rita Cowan, Nikka have released a bottling of their Yoichi expression which has been matured in an Apple Brandy Wood cask.

NAME: Daftmill - 2007 Winter Batch
DESCRIPTION:
A family-owned and operated distillery which is located in the heart of the kingdom of Fife.
This limited edition is one of only 1785 bottles which was distilled in 2007. The seven first-fill ex-bourbon barrels that make up this release are: 023/2007, 024/2007, 025/2007, 027/2007, 032/2007, 035/2007 and 038/2007 which were all distilled and filled in November 2007. This release was bottled in 2019.
When not distilling Francis Cuthbert looks after the estate, growing and malting the barley.

NAME: Clynelish - 23 Year Old 1995 - Signatory - Cask Strength
DESCRIPTION:
This 23 year old Clynelish single malt was bottled by Signatory Vintage Scotch Whisky Co. in 2019 from a single refill hogshead #2157 for their cask strength collection.  Distilled on 26.04.1995, this is one of just 574 bottles. 
 
This is bottle number 491.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 14 Year Old (2005) Burgundy Finish
DESCRIPTION:
This Bunnahabhain was distilled in late 2005 and was matured in refill whisky hogsheads before being transferred Burgundy wine casks for the rest of the maturation period. This is one of 600 bottles.
This is bottle 100.

NAME: Port Charlotte - The Heretic 2001 & PC 2005 Valinch - Fèis Ìle 2018 (2 x
DESCRIPTION:
Port Charlotte - The Heretic 2001: 'The Last of the First' - Fèis Ìle 2018: The Heretic, 2001 has been named 'The Last of the First' as the limited release of 1300 bottles was from the last five casks from Port Charlotte’s first year of distillation in 2001. Adam Hannett, Head Distiller carefully married these five casks which previously held either American whiskey, rum or fine French wine. 
This was a limited edition, Feis Ile 2018, Distillery exclusive release from Bruichladdich Distillery. 55.9%, 70cl.
Port Charlotte - 2005 Valinch - Feis Ile 2018: The second of two bottles master distiller Adam Hannett created for the 2018 Fèis Ìle (Islay Festival). It is a single cask, heavily peated 2005 vintage aged in an oloroso sherry butt. This is one of only 956 bottles. They were sold at the distillery on the morning of the 27th of May 2018, Bruichladdich Open Day. 59.3%, 50cl.
 
This lot comes with the Feis Ile Ticket 2018 entry tickets.
Port Charlotte - The Heretic 2001: 'The Last of the First' - Fèis Ìle 2018 bottle number: 0972.
Port Charlotte - 2005 Valinch - Feis Ile 2018 Bottle number 167.

NAME: Oban - 12 Years Old 1980's
DESCRIPTION: Oban 12 Year Old 1980s in the iconic shape from when John Hopkins & Co Ltd owned the distillery.

NAME: Daftmill - 2007 Winter Batch 2020 (EU Release)
DESCRIPTION:
A family-owned and operated distillery which is located in the heart of the kingdom of Fife.
This limited edition is one of only 1690 bottles which was distilled in 2007. The seven first-fill ex-bourbon barrels that make up this release are: 047/2007, 048/2007, 049/2007, 051/2007, 051/2007, 052/2007 and 053/2007 which were all distilled and filled in November 2007. This release was bottled in 2020.
When not distilling Francis Cuthbert looks after the estate, growing and malting the barley.

NAME: Bowmore - Stillmen's Selection - 17 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
The Stillmen's Selection is a Bowmore distillery exclusive release consisting of 1500 individually numbered bottles. The Stillman's Selection is a part of The Craftsmen's Collection.
This single malt was distilled on 22nd June 1998 and matured in Bordeaux wine barriques.  It has been aged for 17 Years in Bowmore's legendary No.1 Vaults, the world's oldest Scotch maturation warehouse.

NAME: Springbank - 9 Year Old 2001 - Cadenhead's
DESCRIPTION:
This Campbeltown single malt was distilled in 2001 at the Springbank Distillery.  It was bottled by WM Cadenhead in October 2011. It was matured in a single oak rum cask for 9 years and bottled at natural strength of 57.1%.
Wm Cadenhead's is the oldest independent bottler in Scotland.  This bottle is part of the highly collectable white label Cadenhead's Cask Strength series, this heavily sherried malt has a fill level into the neck.

NAME: Highland Park - 15 Year Old #3297 Gotham City
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park is known for being the most Northern Scotch Whisky Distillery in the world. It is situated on the outskirts of the biggest town in Orkney 58.9847°N. It is so far North it is almost in the Arctic circle. To give you an idea, it is on the same latitude as Anchorage, Alaska.
The distillery has been distilling in the same site since 1798 where the founder, Magnus Eunson’s, original illicit still was at High Park.
They smoke their own barley from over 4,000 year old peat which has been cut from the Hobbister Moor only seven miles from the distillery.
This single cask #3297 was bottled exclusively for Gotham City and the liquid within was matured in a Refill Butt. Distilled in 2002, it was bottled in 2017.

NAME: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Single Cask #2208 - Dubai
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Dubai. Distilled in 2005 this single malt was matured for 12 years in refill Hogshead #2208 at the cask strength of 58.9% ABV.  With only 288 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

NAME: Caol Ila - 16 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2020
DESCRIPTION: A 16 year old double matured in refill then Amoroso-seasoned hogshead.  The Fèis Ìle 2020 Edition of Caol Ila has been finely rehearsed to give its own smooth virtuoso performance.  Bottled at the natural cask strength of 53.9%. This is one of 3000 bottles released.

NAME: Ardbeg - Kelpie - Committee Release
DESCRIPTION: This is Committee exclusive release of Ardbeg Kelpie, a single malt released in 2017.  It was matured in casks made from virgin Black Sea oak and more traditional bourbon casks. The Committee Release is bottled at the higher strength of 51.7% ABV (while the standard Ardbeg Kelpie has bottled at 46% ABV).

NAME: Glen Garioch - 10 Year Old 1980s
DESCRIPTION:
This bottling came to the market in the 1980's and was produced at the Highland distillery Glen Garioch. 
Until relatively recently,1995, the distillery was heavily peated, however, if you are fortunate enough to win this bottle we are sure you would taste the difference!

NAME: Glenfiddich - Winter Storm #3
DESCRIPTION: This is the third release in Glenfiddich's Experimental Series by Malt Master Brian Kinsman and the first to be a limited batch release.  This 21 year old Glenfiddich has been finished in an ice wine cask from Peller Estate in Niagra, Canada.

NAME: Ardbeg - Kelpie - Committee Release
DESCRIPTION: This is Committee exclusive release of Ardbeg Kelpie, a single malt released in 2017.  It was matured in casks made from virgin Black Sea oak and more traditional bourbon casks. The Committee Release is bottled at the higher strength of 51.7% ABV (while the standard Ardbeg Kelpie has bottled at 46% ABV).

NAME: Port Charlotte - 2001 Valinch First Cut 27/05/07
DESCRIPTION:
A super peated single malt which is produced at Bruichladdich, this is under the Port Charlotte label. These bottlings were introduced to the public after the distillery was purchased in 2001 by Murray McDavid. No longer standing, this line of branding is named after a towns neighbouring distillery, Port Charlotte, which was actually unseated!! They were quick to change this and now have lines such as Lochindaal and Octomore…which we all know have some serious peaty punch.
The majority of Valinch bottlings are all 50cl and all single casks that are available from the distillery. If you know and have been to the magical island you too can take part in the hand-filling process.
One of only 950 bottles from cask 007. It was distilled in 2001 and bottled in MAy 2007. 
This is bottle 47.

NAME: Glen Moray - 21 Year Old SMWS 35.243 - 21st Anniversary London Branch
DESCRIPTION:
This Speyside single malt is from Glen Moray and has been aged for 21 years.  This is one of only 167 bottles produced in celebration of the SMWS London Branch -  the release has been named 'A Tropical Treasure'
Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.

NAME: Ardbeg - 10 Year Old - Introducing
DESCRIPTION: An old bottling of Ardbeg 10-year-old which was bottled in 2003 - this release features an ‘Introducing’ stripe across the top right of the box - meaning that it is from the original release of whisky after the distillery reopened in 1997.

NAME: Aberlour - 15 Year old Blackadder Raw Cask
DESCRIPTION:
A Speyside Dram and one of 207 bottled at cask strength from a single Sherry Hogshead number 3325.
Bottled in 2005 it is all-natural colour.

NAME: Glendronach - 12 Year Old - Original
DESCRIPTION: Glendronach 12 Year Old - Original was double cask matured in sherry wood and traditional oak barrels.

NAME: Pittyvaich - 12 Year Old - Flora and Fauna
DESCRIPTION:
Pittyvaich, from the most shortlived and now, lost distillery, comes this 12-Year-Old single malt which was released by Diageo as part of the Flora and Fauna series.
In the 1990's Diageo created the Flora and Fauna series. Some bottles are, as usual, harder to come by than others.  As it only operated from 1974 until 1993 there is only a very small number of bottlings of their spirit available.

NAME: Ardbeg - Dark Cove 2016
DESCRIPTION: The Ardbeg Dark Cove was matured in ex-bourbon and dark Sherry casks to create ‘The Darkest Ardbeg Ever.’   This release, although bottled at a lower ABV than the Committee Release, has garnered great reviews, including one from Dramming.com's Oliver Klimek. It has notes of dark fruits, intense peat, ginger and bacon, with a long smoky finish.  It is said to be created to honour the Islay coastline's shadowy past – although the colour isn’t too dark at all, the dark casks used provide plenty of oaky depth.

NAME: Dalmore - Distillery Exclusive 2017
DESCRIPTION:
Bottled in 2017, this yearly release from the distillery has been matured in Californian Merlot Barrique casks. 
Distilled in 2000 it's said to have a palate resembling Morello cherries, blueberry pie, cinnamon and soft chewy liquorice.
Bottled at cask strength.

NAME: Dalmore - Distillery Exclusive 2016 Bourbon Barrels 1997
DESCRIPTION:
Bottled in 2016, this yearly release from the distillery has been matured in Californian Merlot Barrique casks. 
Distilled in 1997 it's said to have a palate resembling spicy pineapple, caramel fudge and Ogen melon.
Bottled at cask strength.

NAME: Laphroaig - 10 Year Old - Original Cask Strength Batch #003
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is from batch 003, original cask strength bottling of the medicinal 10-year-old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour. This release was bottled at 55.3% in January 2011.

NAME: Laphroaig - Cairdeas - Port Wood Edition
DESCRIPTION:
Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members. 
This expression was bottled in 2013 and includes double matured Laphroaig from bourbon and port wood casks to create an exceptional balance of their signature peat flavour with tangy citrus fruits and a floral finish.
It was bottled at 51.3% ABV.

NAME: Jura - Elements - Water Vintage 1989
DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Isle of Jura Whisky for auction
DESCRIPTION:
This bottle by Jura is part of the 'Elements' series, 'water' from Loch a’ Bhaile-Mhargaidh. Distilled in October 1989 and bottled in 2008, there is only 624 bottle.
This is bottle number 225.

NAME: Highland Park - Quercus - Keystone Series 3rd Release
DESCRIPTION:
The Keystones Series 3rd release, from Highland Park, Quercus.
The series explores five traditional 'keystones' that have been essential for the production and have been unchanged for 220 years.
The bottle takes its name from the kind of Oak used to make their casks. They are sent to Spain (Jerez) in order to in sherry before returning to the distillery. 
This is one of only 1200 bottles.

NAME: Jura - Elements - Water Vintage 1989
DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Isle of Jura Whisky for auction
DESCRIPTION: This bottle by Jura is part of the 'Elements' series, 'water' from Loch a’ Bhaile-Mhargaidh. Distilled in October 1989 and bottled in 2008, there is only 624 bottle.

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.3
DESCRIPTION:
The third release in the Macallan Edition series.  A unique selection of oak cask styles are combined to yield a new limited edition expression each year.  
Edition No.3 was a collaboration between master perfumer Roja Dove and master whisky maker Bob Dalgarno.  With Dove's remarkable sensory knowledge, Dalgarno shaped the character of Edition No.3 from a combination of European and American oak casks to create a deliciously sweet, single malt with floral notes.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 2002 - Maderia Finish - Fèis Ìle 2020
DESCRIPTION:
This limited edition single malt from Bunnahabhain Distillery was matured for 14 years in classic bourbon barrels, then finished in Maderia casks for another three years.  Bottled at 53%, and released by Bunnahabhain for the 25th anniversary of Fèis Ìle - Fèis Ìle 2020.  This is one of only 1164 bottles produced.
Bottle 85.

NAME: Johnnie Walker - Blue Label Casks Edition Travel Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
A travel retail exclusive from Johnnie Walker and it bears the Blue Label.
It has been bottled at cask strength.

NAME: Highland Park - 15 Year Old - Single Cask #2123 - HKexcl
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for HKexcl.  Distilled in 2002, this single malt was matured for 15 years in refill butt #2123 at the cask strength of 58.3% ABV.  With only 523 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

NAME: Laphroaig - 10 Year Old - Original Cask Strength Batch #003
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is from batch 003, original cask strength bottling of the medicinal 10-year-old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour. This release was bottled at 55.3% in January 2011.

NAME: Ben Nevis - 22 Year Old (1996) - Whisky Show - TWE 20th Anniversary
DESCRIPTION: Released for The Whisky Exchange at Whisky Show 2019 as part of the Magic of the Cask series & their 20th-anniversary celebrations. The label design revels when a UV light is shined on it! This 1996 Ben Nevis single malt spent 22 years in a single refill sherry butt, before being bottled in 2019.

NAME: Littlemill - 8 Year Old 1980s
DESCRIPTION:
A classic and original bottling from the now-closed little mill distillery. Labelled as 100% scotch whisky this bottle is certainly a blast from the past and can never be recreated after its final closure in 1994.
Littlemill has a very turbulent history and was one of Scotland's oldest distilleries in its time.
Distilling was taking place with illicit stills in the late 18th century.

NAME: Cardhu - 12 Year Old 1980s
DESCRIPTION:
An early bottling of this Speyside malt. It is a key ingredient for the Johnnie Walker blend.
Becoming even rarer this older style bottle has since been replaced with a more dumpy bottle.

NAME: Highland Park - 13 Year Old - Single Cask Series California #3609
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park is known for being the most Northern Scotch Whisky Distillery in the world. It is situated on the outskirts of the biggest town in Orkney 58.9847°N. It is so far North it is almost in the Arctic circle. To give you an idea, it is on the same latitude as Anchorage, Alaska.
The distillery has been distilling in the same site since 1798 where the founder, Magnus Eunson’s, original illicit still was at High Park.
They smoke their own barley from over 4,000 year old peat which has been cut from the Hobbister Moor only seven miles from the distillery.
This Highland Park 12-Year-Old is part of the single cask series by the Island Distillery.
Distileld in 2005, matured in Refill Sherry Butt and bottled in 2017 at the natural cask strength of 62.7%.
This limited release is one of 588 bottles exclusively produced for California.

NAME: Macallan - 18 Year Old - Triple Cask 2018 (Fine Oak)
DESCRIPTION: This 18 year old Macallan single malt was released in 2018 and sits is at the top of the Triple Cask range (which replaced the Fine Oak range).  The whisky was matured in a combination of European sherry seasoned casks, American sherry seasoned casks and American ex-bourbon casks.  This expression boasts bountiful notes of vanilla, dried fruit and woody spice.

NAME: Macallan - Rare Cask No. 1 - 2019
DESCRIPTION: The Macallan Rare Cask Batch No.1, 2018 release introduced a new look for Rare Cask which has been rebranded and revised.  It is an attempt by Macallan to give greater insight into their whisky making process.  This first batch was one of three batches to be released in 2018, with further batches planned for subsequent years. Each limited release batch represents the volume of only 50 oak sherry butts.

NAME: Ardbeg - Supernova - 2019 Committee Release
DESCRIPTION: Excluisvley released to Ardbeg Committee members in September 2019, this is the fifth and latest release of the Ardbeg Supernova.  Matured in ex-Bourbon casks, this limited edition, non-age- statement release is described as having aromas of ‘pungent aniseed, menthol and eucalyptus’, with a ‘nebula of bonfires, soot, charred oak, birch tar and menthol’ on the palate.

NAME: Port Charlotte - 12 Year Old - 2002 Cask Exploration #01
DESCRIPTION: A Port Charlotte 2002 vintage matured for 12 years in Sauternes cask #1202. Part of the Cask Exploration range, this is edition 01 Seolaid. One of 375 individually numbered bottles, this is a limited edition from Bruichladdich Distillery. This is a 50cl bottling.

NAME: Arran - White Stag - Fourth Release
DESCRIPTION:
This is the fourth release in the Arran Distillery White Stag series.  It was released exclusively to Arran's online community, the White Stag.  
This small batch bottling from 4 ex-bourbon barrels was specially selected by a tasting panel of 20 members of the White Stag.

NAME: Ardbeg - Alligator - 5cl Mini (Leather Case)
DESCRIPTION:
An alligator skin is one that looks cracked and full of scars that would have been caused during a heated battle. Well, that exactly where the name of this whisky comes from. When heat is applied to the inside of a cask, the wood begins to crack...'alligator char'.
This is the un-tammed release which came after the committee release in 2012.

NAME: Ardbeg - Alligator - 5cl Mini (Leather Case)
DESCRIPTION:
An alligator skin is one that looks cracked and full of scars that would have been caused during a heated battle. Well, that exactly where the name of this whisky comes from. When heat is applied to the inside of a cask, the wood begins to crack...'alligator char'.
This is the un-tammed release which came after the committee release in 2012.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 18 Year Old - Hand Filled (Culag)
DESCRIPTION:
This Distillery Exclusive handful was drawn from a 'Culag' cask.  The single malt has been matured for 18 years, including a finish in a Cognac cask.
It was bottled by hand on the 24th of May 2019. This is one of only 190 bottles.
 
This is bottle number 39.

NAME: Dalmore - Distillery Exclusive 2018 PX Finish 1999
DESCRIPTION:
Bottled in 2018, this yearly release from the distillery has been finished in Pedro Ximenez casks. 
Distilled in 1999 it's said to have a palate resembling Columbian coffee, roasted hazelnuts and pecan pie.
Bottled at cask strength.

NAME: GlenAllachie - 19 Year Old 2000 PX Hogshead #6248
DESCRIPTION:
Bottled at the natural cask strength of 52.5% this is an exclusive for The Whisky World. It was distilled in April of the Millenium and bottled at 19 years old in March 2020...very close to a 20 year old!
The story for this bottling is complex, it was first stored in a American Standard Barrel/Refill Bourbon cask and then transferred to a PX Hogshead. 
This dram was transferred into its new cask under the careful guidance of Billy Walker for at least 2 years which gives it a great finish/colour. 
Bottle number 269 and box number 317.

NAME: Ardbeg - 12 Year Old - Serendipity
DESCRIPTION: Born out of a happy accident when someone mistakenly mixed some Glen Moray into a vat of old Ardbeg. The mix-up created this blend that is 2 parts Glen Moray and 8 parts of older Ardbeg.  Serendipity is a lightly smoky blended malt. A rare find with a charming story.

NAME: Ardbeg - Dark Cove 2016
DESCRIPTION: The Ardbeg Dark Cove was matured in ex-bourbon and dark Sherry casks to create ‘The Darkest Ardbeg Ever.’   This release, although bottled at a lower ABV than the Committee Release, has garnered great reviews, including one from Dramming.com's Oliver Klimek. It has notes of dark fruits, intense peat, ginger and bacon, with a long smoky finish.  It is said to be created to honour the Islay coastline's shadowy past – although the colour isn’t too dark at all, the dark casks used provide plenty of oaky depth.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 2002 - Maderia Finish - Fèis Ìle 2020
DESCRIPTION:
This limited edition single malt from Bunnahabhain Distillery was matured for 14 years in classic bourbon barrels, then finished in Maderia casks for another three years.  Bottled at 53%, and released by Bunnahabhain for the 25th anniversary of Fèis Ìle - Fèis Ìle 2020.  This is one of only 1164 bottles produced.
This is bottle number 1006.

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.3
DESCRIPTION:
The third release in the Macallan Edition series.  A unique selection of oak cask styles are combined to yield a new limited edition expression each year.  
Edition No.3 was a collaboration between master perfumer Roja Dove and master whisky maker Bob Dalgarno.  With Dove's remarkable sensory knowledge, Dalgarno shaped the character of Edition No.3 from a combination of European and American oak casks to create a deliciously sweet, single malt with floral notes.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 2002 - Maderia Finish - Fèis Ìle 2020
DESCRIPTION: This limited edition single malt from Bunnahabhain Distillery was matured for 14 years in classic bourbon barrels, then finished in Maderia casks for another three years.  Bottled at 53%, and released by Bunnahabhain for the 25th anniversary of Fèis Ìle - Fèis Ìle 2020.  This is one of only 1164 bottles produced.

NAME: Old Pulteney - 20 Year Old 1997 #1078
DESCRIPTION:
Hand bottled at one of the most Northern distilleries on the mainland UK. This Old Pulteney was distilled in and filled on the 8th of September 1997.   It was bottled at cask strength 52.3%.
This is bottle 48.

NAME: Macallan - Rare Cask No. 1 - 2019
DESCRIPTION: The Macallan Rare Cask Batch No.1, 2018 release introduced a new look for Rare Cask which has been rebranded and revised.  It is an attempt by Macallan to give greater insight into their whisky making process.  This first batch was one of three batches to be released in 2018, with further batches planned for subsequent years. Each limited release batch represents the volume of only 50 oak sherry butts.

NAME: Macallan - Rare Cask Batch No.2 - 2018
DESCRIPTION:
This is the second release from The Macallan Rare Cask batched series.  It contains whisky drawn from just 50 sherry butts to craft a rich and fruity dram. 
This was one of 3 small-batch releases in the series realeased by Macallan in 2018.

NAME: Ardbeg - Dark Cove 2016
DESCRIPTION: The Ardbeg Dark Cove was matured in ex-bourbon and dark Sherry casks to create ‘The Darkest Ardbeg Ever.’   This release, although bottled at a lower ABV than the Committee Release, has garnered great reviews, including one from Dramming.com's Oliver Klimek. It has notes of dark fruits, intense peat, ginger and bacon, with a long smoky finish.  It is said to be created to honour the Islay coastline's shadowy past – although the colour isn’t too dark at all, the dark casks used provide plenty of oaky depth.

NAME: Daftmill - 2008 Summer Batch
DESCRIPTION:
A family owned and operated distillery which is located in the heart of the kingdom of Fife.
This limited edition is one of only 1760 bottles which has been distilled in 2008 and bottled in 2019.
When not distilling Francis Cuthbert looks after the estate, growing and malting the barley. 
The barley variety is called Optic and was grown in the south fields.

NAME: Ardbeg - Dark Cove 2016
DESCRIPTION: The Ardbeg Dark Cove was matured in ex-bourbon and dark Sherry casks to create ‘The Darkest Ardbeg Ever.’   This release, although bottled at a lower ABV than the Committee Release, has garnered great reviews, including one from Dramming.com's Oliver Klimek. It has notes of dark fruits, intense peat, ginger and bacon, with a long smoky finish.  It is said to be created to honour the Islay coastline's shadowy past – although the colour isn’t too dark at all, the dark casks used provide plenty of oaky depth.

NAME: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Single Cask #6551 - Arizona 75cl
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Arizona.  Distilled in 2004, this single malt was matured for 12 years in first-fill European Sherry Oak Butt #6651 at the cask strength of 65.6% ABV.  With only 294 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

NAME: Nikka - Yoichi and Miyagikyo Rum Wood Finish (1 x 70cl)
DESCRIPTION:
Both these Nikka whiskies are from Japan, Miyagikyo and Yoichi were finished in Caribbean rum wood. They were bottled in 2017.
 
This lot only includes 1 x 70cl.

NAME: Tomatin - 25 Year Old 1988 Batch #1
DESCRIPTION:
This is Batch 1 of a 1988 release from Tomatin which has matured for over 25 years in Bourbon Barrels & Port Pipes. 
There is 2500 releases of this bottle.

NAME: Glenfarclas - 21 Year Old 1997 SMWS 1.208
DESCRIPTION:
Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
"Long conversations by the crackling log fire" is a 1997 vintage Glenfarclas, bottled by the Scotch Malt Whisky Society (SMWS). Distilled on 5th March 1997 and matured in a first in an ex-bourbon hogshead, followed by a 1st fill Pedro Ximenez hogshead.  This is one of only 234 bottles.

NAME: Spica - 40 Year Old Blend - North Star Spirits
DESCRIPTION: A 40-Year-Old bottling of Spica blended Scotch whisky from indie bottler North Star Spirits, bottled in 2020.  This is one of 877 bottles.

NAME: Highland Park - Yesnaby - Keystone 4th Release
DESCRIPTION:
The Keystones Series 4th release, from Highland Park, Yesnaby.
The series explores five traditional 'keystones' that have been essential for the production and have been unchanged for 220 years.
The bottle takes its name from the cliff on the coast of the Islands. Atlantic side.
Cask Info
- First-fill Sherry seasoned American Oak casks.
This is one of only 1200 bottles.

NAME: Macallan - Estate Reserve - 2019
DESCRIPTION:
The Macallan Estate Reserve 2019 forms part of The 1824 Collection. It is a classic style of Macallan that includes a parcel of specially selected casks to deliver great richness and intensity.
All of the whisky used was grown locally on the Macallan estate.  The whisky is distilled just once a year, over the course of a single week. The single malt was then matured exclusively in sherry seasoned butts and hogsheads.

NAME: Mortlach - 22 Year Old - 1989 The Nectar of Daily Drams
DESCRIPTION: An independent Mortlach selected and bottled The Nectar, Belgium. Distilled in 1989 and bottled in 2012 at 22 years old for The Nectar of the Daily Drams range of whiskies bottled by The Nectar (Belgian whisky importer and distributor).

NAME: Benriach - 18 Year Old -  Gaja Barolo Finish
DESCRIPTION: A special Benriach 18 year-old, maturred in American Bourbon casks and finished in casks previously containing Barolo wine from the famous Gaja estate.

NAME: Ardbeg - Dark Cove 2016
DESCRIPTION: The Ardbeg Dark Cove was matured in ex-bourbon and dark Sherry casks to create ‘The Darkest Ardbeg Ever.’   This release, although bottled at a lower ABV than the Committee Release, has garnered great reviews, including one from Dramming.com's Oliver Klimek. It has notes of dark fruits, intense peat, ginger and bacon, with a long smoky finish.  It is said to be created to honour the Islay coastline's shadowy past – although the colour isn’t too dark at all, the dark casks used provide plenty of oaky depth.

NAME: The Balvenie - Founders Reserve
DESCRIPTION: This bottle is the same shape for cognac and has been long since discontinued making it a collectable item. This 10-year-old from Speyside was labelled the founder's reserve.

NAME: Lagavulin - 16 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2017
DESCRIPTION: This was Lagavulin’s 2017 Fèis Ìle bottling. It is a 16-year old Islay, Moscatel Cask Wood double matured, limited to 6000 individually numbered bottles.  Bottled in 2017 at natural cask strength for the annual Islay whisky festival in May.

NAME: Lagavulin - 16 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2017
DESCRIPTION: This was Lagavulin’s 2017 Fèis Ìle bottling. It is a 16-year old Islay, Moscatel Cask Wood double matured, limited to 6000 individually numbered bottles.  Bottled in 2017 at natural cask strength for the annual Islay whisky festival in May.

NAME: Waterford - Single Farm Origin - Sheestown 1.1
DESCRIPTION: Sheestown 1.1 – This is also one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series. This single malt Irish whisky was grown by Robert Milne on one of Ireland’s premier malting barley terroirs – the famous Clonroche Series in Co. Wexford, with its loamy, clay soils derived from slate and granite.

NAME: Waterford - Single Farm Origin - Bannow Island 1.2
DESCRIPTION: Bannow Island 1.2 is the second Bannow Island release by Waterford. Now 3 months older, this expression is from barley grown by Ed Harpur on the extreme southern coast of Co. Wexford, where salt-laden Atlantic winds and sandy soils create a unique, if challenging, terroir.

NAME: Springbank - 14 Year Old - 2002 Bourbon Wood
DESCRIPTION: This limited-edition from the ever-popular Springbank distillery was matured for 14 years in ex-bourbon casks from America. Limited to only 9,000 bottles worldwide.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 1986 Baraille
DESCRIPTION:
A limited-edition valinch from Bruichladdich - 'Baraille' which is Gaelic for cask, was released exclusively for cask owners.
This is the first release in the single cask series. Distilled on the 5 February 1986 and bottled from a single Fresh Sherry cask #001 on the 17th September 2001. This is one of just 500 bottles.  This is a 50cl bottling.
This is bottle number 7.

NAME: Caol Ila - 16 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2020
DESCRIPTION: A 16 year old double matured in refill then Amoroso-seasoned hogshead.  The Fèis Ìle 2020 Edition of Caol Ila has been finely rehearsed to give its own smooth virtuoso performance.  Bottled at the natural cask strength of 53.9%. This is one of 3000 bottles released.

NAME: Waterford - Single Farm Origin - Bannow Island 1.1
DESCRIPTION: Bannow Island 1.1 is one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series. This single malt Irish whisky was distilled using a single vintage of Overture barley grown on the south coast of Co. Wexford by Ed Harpur on his Bannow Island farm.  Matured in French and American oak casks, and bottled at 50% ABV with no chill-filtration or additional colouring.

NAME: Caol Ila - 13 Year Old Adelphi 2007
DESCRIPTION:
One of only 297 bottles, this Caol Ila was distilled in 2007 and bottled in 2020. 
The famous badge graces this bottle from Adelphi...Malt does more than milton can to justify gods ways to a man.
A.E. Housman

NAME: Bruichladdich - 1989 Valinch 'Michael Jackson Tribute'
DESCRIPTION:
This Bruichladdich Valinch range was released specially as a tribute to the late whisky and beer writer, Michael Jackson 'a star without ego'. The whisky was distilled in April 1989 matured in Bourbon/Syrah cask #3 and enhanced in Guigal Hermitage casks then bottled at 52.7% ABV.  This is one of just 400 bottles.
This is a 50cl bottling.
This is bottle number 7.

NAME: Highland Park - 15 Year Old Single Cask Series DFS #2120
DESCRIPTION:
One in a large series of single cask bottlings from the Orcadian distillery Highland Park.
This bottling was done for DFS - Masters of Wines and Spirits.
It was distilled in 2002 and bottled in 2017. Matured for 15 years in cask #2120 which was a 1st fill American Oak Sherry Puncheon. 
57.6% ABV.

NAME: Caol Ila - 13 Year Old Adelphi 2007
DESCRIPTION:
One of only 297 bottles, this Caol Ila was distilled in 2007 and bottled in 2020. 
The famous badge graces this bottle from Adelphi...Malt does more than milton can to justify gods ways to a man.
A.E. Housman

NAME: Highland Park - 15 Year Old #4460 2003 SAXO
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park is known for being the most Northern Scotch Whisky Distillery in the world. It is situated on the outskirts of the biggest town in Orkney 58.9847°N. It is so far North it is almost in the Arctic circle. To give you an idea, it is on the same latitude as Anchorage, Alaska.
The distillery has been distilling in the same site since 1798 where the founder, Magnus Eunson’s, original illicit still was at High Park.
They smoke their own barley from over 4,000 year old peat which has been cut from the Hobbister Moor only seven miles from the distillery.
Limited to 605 bottles cask #4460 was a 1st fill American Sherry Oak Puncheon. It was bottled exclusively for SAXO and is the 3rd edition in the series.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 1984 Valinch - Opening of The Harvey Bottling Hall
DESCRIPTION:
This bottling from Bruichladdich was distilled in 1984 and bottled from a single American Oak cask #12.  It was originally only available at Bruichladdich Distillery, released in celebration of the opening of The Harvey Bottling Hall on Sunday 25h of May 2003.  This is one of only 575 bottles. This is a 50cl bottling.
 
 
This is bottle number 10.

NAME: Ardbeg - Supernova - 2019 Committee Release
DESCRIPTION: Excluisvley released to Ardbeg Committee members in September 2019, this is the fifth and latest release of the Ardbeg Supernova.  Matured in ex-Bourbon casks, this limited edition, non-age- statement release is described as having aromas of ‘pungent aniseed, menthol and eucalyptus’, with a ‘nebula of bonfires, soot, charred oak, birch tar and menthol’ on the palate.

NAME: Glen Mhor - 8 Year Old - (Gordon & MacPhail) 1990s
DESCRIPTION:
This is a rare, 8 year old Highland single malt from the now-closed Glen Mhor distillery, bottled by Gordon & MacPhail.
Glen Mhor closed their doors in 1983 and the distillery was demolished three years later.

NAME: Highland Park - 1995 Càrn Mòr #2475
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled on the 10th November 1995 and bottled on the 18/08/2015 this Highland Park was bottled for the Celebration of the Cask range from Sherry Hogshead #2475.  This is one of only 275 bottles produced by Càrn Mòr. 
This is bottle number 10.

NAME: Ardbeg - Supernova - 2019 Committee Release
DESCRIPTION: Excluisvley released to Ardbeg Committee members in September 2019, this is the fifth and latest release of the Ardbeg Supernova.  Matured in ex-Bourbon casks, this limited edition, non-age- statement release is described as having aromas of ‘pungent aniseed, menthol and eucalyptus’, with a ‘nebula of bonfires, soot, charred oak, birch tar and menthol’ on the palate.

NAME: Macallan - 18 Year Old - Triple Cask 2018 (Fine Oak)
DESCRIPTION: This 18 year old Macallan single malt was released in 2018 and sits is at the top of the Triple Cask range (which replaced the Fine Oak range).  The whisky was matured in a combination of European sherry seasoned casks, American sherry seasoned casks and American ex-bourbon casks.  This expression boasts bountiful notes of vanilla, dried fruit and woody spice.

NAME: Laphroaig - 18 Year Old Diamond Jubilee
DESCRIPTION:
The 18 year old expression was released in 2009 and took over from the much loved 15 year old. 
However, this is not just any 18 year old...
It was released in 2018 summer season and only 3000 were made. It has been decorated and designed to celebrate the Queen's Diamond Jubilee.
On a side note, £3000 was donated from the sale of this bottle to Queen Elizabeth Scholarship Trust by Jim Beam.

NAME: Dallas Dhu - 10 Year Old - Gordon & MacPhail (1980s)
DESCRIPTION: This Speyside Dallas Dhu 10 Year Old is estimated to have been bottled by Gordon & MacPhail in the 1980s.

NAME: Ardbeg - Still Young 1998-2006 2nd Release
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in 1998, Ardbeg Still Young was originally was released in 2006. This is the second release in 2008. 
It is part of a series called the ‘path to peaty maturity’ of which this is the second release.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 1988 Valinch - Continuation of the Celebration "Babe"
DESCRIPTION: This bottling from Bruichladdich was distilled in 1988 and bottled from a single fresh bourbon cask #930. It was originally only available at Bruichladdich Distillery, released in continuation of the re-opening of Bruichladdich Distillery.  This is a 50cl bottling.

NAME: Bowmore - 12 Year Old - Enigma (1L)
DESCRIPTION: Enigma is a 12 Year Old bottling released by Bowmore, originally bottled for Travel Retail. Enigma is an unusual expression for Bowmore as a greater amount of fresh sherry casks have been used over its 12 years of maturation.

NAME: Ardbeg - Perpetuum - Distillery Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
Ardbeg Perpetuum Distillery Release was in 2015 in memory of the 200th anniversary of the Islay distillery.
Perpetuum is actually a blend of old and young whisky which has been matured in both Bourbon and Sherry casks.

NAME: Talisker - 1986 Distillers Edition
DESCRIPTION:
The Distillers Edition is a special release from Talisker, the single malt was double matured with a finishing period in a sweet amoroso cask-wood. 
The limited-edition bottle was distilled in 1986 and bottled at 45.8%.
The Distillers Edition Series features a small number of casks from 6 distilleries that were hand-selected for double maturing.

NAME: Ardbeg - Supernova - 2019 Committee Release
DESCRIPTION: Excluisvley released to Ardbeg Committee members in September 2019, this is the fifth and latest release of the Ardbeg Supernova.  Matured in ex-Bourbon casks, this limited edition, non-age- statement release is described as having aromas of ‘pungent aniseed, menthol and eucalyptus’, with a ‘nebula of bonfires, soot, charred oak, birch tar and menthol’ on the palate.

NAME: Auchroisk - 16 Year Old - The Manager's Dram
DESCRIPTION:
This 16 year old single malt from the Auchroisk Distillery is part of The Manager's Dram series exclusively for Diageo employees (formerly United Distillers).  It was bottled in November 2015 at 55.6%. 
The Diageo Managers Dram bottlings, each selected by distillery managers, are bottled at natural cask strength.
This is bottle 0886.

NAME: Ardbeg - Grooves - Committee Release
DESCRIPTION: This limited edition Islay single malt was released to mark the 2018 Ardbeg Day at the Islay Festival of Music & Malt. The theme is a throwback to the Island's 1960s spirit, embodying the ideals of 'peat & love'! Ardbeg Grooves is crafted with ex-wine casks that are re-charred to create heavy grooves in the wood, allowing more interaction with the spirit and creating a richer flavour.

NAME: Waterford - Single Farm Origin - Sheestown 1.1
DESCRIPTION: Sheestown 1.1 – This is also one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series. This single malt Irish whisky was distilled using a single vintage of grown just outside the historic town of Kilkenny on an undulating, well-drained, lowland terroir predominantly derived from limestone, by Phil O’Brien, father of one of the distillery workers.

NAME: Ardbeg - Drum - 2019 Committee Release
DESCRIPTION:
This is the 2019 Ardbeg Committee Release.  The Ardbeg Drum is a non-age-statement single malt matured in ex-Bourbon casks and then finished in ex-rum casks from the Americas.  It was created to celebrate Ardbeg Day 2019 (June 1) held during the Islay Festival of Music & Malt (Fèis Ìle).
This limited-edition Committee Release is bottled at 52% abv, and was released exclusively to Ardbeg Committee Members.

NAME: Bruichladdich - High Noon Fèis Ìle 2015 (50cl)
DESCRIPTION:
Bruichladdich specifically released 1,881 bottles of High Noon to align with their official date of establishment in 1881. This is the last Feis Ile bottling from Jim McEwan before his retirement in July 2015. It is a culmination of his Black Arts journey - it is said that the combined age of the casks used is 134 years.
This bottle has been signed by Jim McEwan, Head Distiller, Bruichladdich.
Bottle 699
